            # == Active \Model \Errors
        
      8. 
      
        
    8. 
          
          
            #
        
      9. 
      
        
    9. 
          
          
            # Provides a modified +Hash+ that you can include in your object
        
      10. 
      
        
    10. 
          
          
            # for handling error messages and interacting with Action View helpers.
        
      11. 
      
        
    11. 
          
          
            #
        
      12. 
      
        
    12. 
          
          
            # A minimal implementation could be:
        
      13. 
      
        
    13. 
          
          
            #
        
      14. 
      
        
    14. 
          
          
            #   class Person
        
      15.

      16.

      44.

      45. 
      
        
    45. 
          
          
            # able to generate error messages correctly and also handle multiple
        
      46. 
      
        
    46. 
          
          
            # languages. Of course, if you extend your object with ActiveModel::Translation

    48.

              # Returns +true+ if the error messages include an error for the given key
        
      91. 
      
        
    91. 
          
          
              # +attribute+, +false+ otherwise.
        
      92.

              def include?(attribute)
        
      97. 
      
        
    97. 
          
          
                messages[attribute].present?
        
      98. 
      
        
    98. 
          
          
              end

      122. 
      
        
    122. 
          
          
              # Delete messages for +key+. Returns the deleted messages.
        
      123. 
      
        
    123. 
          
          
              #
        
      124. 
      
        
    124. 
          
          
              #   person.errors.get(:name)    # => ["cannot be nil"]
        
      125. 
      
        
    125. 
          
          
              #   person.errors.delete(:name) # => ["cannot be nil"]
        
      126. 
      
        
    126. 
          
          
              #   person.errors.get(:name)    # => nil
        
      127. 
      
        
    127. 
          1
          
              def delete(key)
        
      128. 
      
        
    128. 
          
          
                messages.delete(key)
        
      129. 
      
        
    129. 
          
          
              end
        
      130. 
      
        
    130. 
          
          
          
        
      131. 
      
        
    131. 
          
          
              # When passed a symbol or a name of a method, returns an array of errors
        
      132. 
      
        
    132. 
          
          
              # for the method.
        
      133. 
      
        
    133. 
          
          
              #
        
      134. 
      
        
    134. 
          
          
              #   person.errors[:name]  # => ["cannot be nil"]
        
      135. 
      
        
    135. 
          
          
              #   person.errors['name'] # => ["cannot be nil"]
        
      136. 
      
        
    136. 
          1
          
              def [](attribute)
        
      137. 
      
        
    137. 
          12
          
                get(attribute.to_sym) || set(attribute.to_sym, [])
        
      138. 
      
        
    138. 
          
          
              end
        
      139. 
      
        
    139. 
          
          
          
        
      140. 
      
        
    140. 
          
          
              # Adds to the supplied attribute the supplied error message.
        
      141. 
      
        
    141. 
          
          
              #
        
      142. 
      
        
    142. 
          
          
              #   person.errors[:name] = "must be set"
        
      143. 
      
        
    143. 
          
          
              #   person.errors[:name] # => ['must be set']
        
      144. 
      
        
    144. 
          1
          
              def []=(attribute, error)
        
      145. 
      
        
    145. 
          
          
                self[attribute] << error
        
      146. 
      
        
    146. 
          
          
              end
        
      147. 
      
        
    147. 
          
          
          
        
      148. 
      
        
    148. 
          
          
              # Iterates through each error key, value pair in the error messages hash.
        
      149. 
      
        
    149. 
          
          
              # Yields the attribute and the error for that attribute. If the attribute
        
      150. 
      
        
    150. 
          
          
              # has more than one error message, yields once for each error message.
        
      151. 
      
        
    151. 
          
          
              #
        
      152. 
      
        
    152. 
          
          
              #   person.errors.add(:name, "can't be blank")
        
      153. 
      
        
    153. 
          
          
              #   person.errors.each do |attribute, error|
        
      154. 
      
        
    154. 
          
          
              #     # Will yield :name and "can't be blank"
        
      155. 
      
        
    155. 
          
          
              #   end
        
      156. 
      
        
    156. 
          
          
              #
        
      157. 
      
        
    157. 
          
          
              #   person.errors.add(:name, "must be specified")
        
      158. 
      
        
    158. 
          
          
              #   person.errors.each do |attribute, error|
        
      159. 
      
        
    159. 
          
          
              #     # Will yield :name and "can't be blank"
        
      160. 
      
        
    160. 
          
          
              #     # then yield :name and "must be specified"
        
      161. 
      
        
    161. 
          
          
              #   end
        
      162. 
      
        
    162. 
          1
          
              def each
        
      163. 
      
        
    163. 
          82
          
                messages.each_key do |attribute|
        
      164. 
      
        
    164. 
          16
          
                  self[attribute].each { |error| yield attribute, error }
        
      165. 
      
        
    165. 
          
          
                end
        
      166. 
      
        
    166. 
          
          
              end
        
      167. 
      
        
    167. 
          
          
          
        
      168. 
      
        
    168. 
          
          
              # Returns the number of error messages.
        
      169. 
      
        
    169. 
          
          
              #
        
      170. 
      
        
    170. 
          
          
              #   person.errors.add(:name, "can't be blank")
        
      171. 
      
        
    171. 
          
          
              #   person.errors.size # => 1
        
      172. 
      
        
    172. 
          
          
              #   person.errors.add(:name, "must be specified")
        
      173. 
      
        
    173. 
          
          
              #   person.errors.size # => 2
        
      174. 
      
        
    174. 
          1
          
              def size
        
      175. 
      
        
    175. 
          
          
                values.flatten.size
        
      176. 
      
        
    176. 
          
          
              end
        
      177. 
      
        
    177. 
          
          
          
        
      178. 
      
        
    178. 
          
          
              # Returns all message values.
        
      179. 
      
        
    179. 
          
          
              #
        
      180. 
      
        
    180. 
          
          
              #   person.errors.messages # => {:name=>["cannot be nil", "must be specified"]}
        
      181. 
      
        
    181. 
          
          
              #   person.errors.values   # => [["cannot be nil", "must be specified"]]
        
      182. 
      
        
    182. 
          1
          
              def values
        
      183. 
      
        
    183. 
          
          
                messages.values
        
      184. 
      
        
    184. 
          
          
              end
        
      185. 
      
        
    185. 
          
          
          
        
      186. 
      
        
    186. 
          
          
              # Returns all message keys.
        
      187. 
      
        
    187. 
          
          
              #
        
      188. 
      
        
    188. 
          
          
              #   person.errors.messages # => {:name=>["cannot be nil", "must be specified"]}
        
      189. 
      
        
    189. 
          
          
              #   person.errors.keys     # => [:name]
        
      190. 
      
        
    190. 
          1
          
              def keys
        
      191. 
      
        
    191. 
          
          
                messages.keys
        
      192. 
      
        
    192. 
          
          
              end
        
      193. 
      
        
    193. 
          
          
          
        
      194. 
      
        
    194. 
          
          
              # Returns an array of error messages, with the attribute name included.
        
      195. 
      
        
    195. 
          
          
              #
        
      196. 
      
        
    196. 
          
          
              #   person.errors.add(:name, "can't be blank")
        
      197. 
      
        
    197. 
          
          
              #   person.errors.add(:name, "must be specified")
        
      198. 
      
        
    198. 
          
          
              #   person.errors.to_a # => ["name can't be blank", "name must be specified"]
        
      199. 
      
        
    199. 
          1
          
              def to_a
        
      200. 
      
        
    200. 
          
          
                full_messages
        
      201. 
      
        
    201. 
          
          
              end
        
      202. 
      
        
    202. 
          
          
          
        
      203. 
      
        
    203. 
          
          
              # Returns the number of error messages.
        
      204. 
      
        
    204. 
          
          
              #
        
      205. 
      
        
    205. 
          
          
              #   person.errors.add(:name, "can't be blank")
        
      206. 
      
        
    206. 
          
          
              #   person.errors.count # => 1
        
      207. 
      
        
    207. 
          
          
              #   person.errors.add(:name, "must be specified")
        
      208. 
      
        
    208. 
          
          
              #   person.errors.count # => 2
        
      209. 
      
        
    209. 
          1
          
              def count
        
      210. 
      
        
    210. 
          
          
                to_a.size
        
      211. 
      
        
    211. 
          
          
              end
        
      212. 
      
        
    212. 
          
          
          
        
      213. 
      
        
    213. 
          
          
              # Returns +true+ if no errors are found, +false+ otherwise.
        
      214. 
      
        
    214. 
          
          
              # If the error message is a string it can be empty.
        
      215. 
      
        
    215. 
          
          
              #
        
      216. 
      
        
    216. 
          
          
              #   person.errors.full_messages # => ["name cannot be nil"]
        
      217. 
      
        
    217. 
          
          
              #   person.errors.empty?        # => false
        
      218. 
      
        
    218. 
          1
          
              def empty?
        
      219. 
      
        
    219. 
          90
          
                all? { |k, v| v && v.empty? && !v.is_a?(String) }
        
      220. 
      
        
    220. 
          
          
              end
        
      221. 
      
        
    221. 
          
          
              # aliases empty?
        
      222. 
      
        
    222. 
          1
          
              alias_method :blank?, :empty?
        
      223. 
      
        
    223. 
          
          
          
        
      224. 
      
        
    224. 
          
          
              # Returns an xml formatted representation of the Errors hash.
        
      225. 
      
        
    225. 
          
          
              #
        
      226. 
      
        
    226. 
          
          
              #   person.errors.add(:name, "can't be blank")
        
      227. 
      
        
    227. 
          
          
              #   person.errors.add(:name, "must be specified")
        
      228. 
      
        
    228. 
          
          
              #   person.errors.to_xml
        
      229. 
      
        
    229. 
          
          
              #   # =>
        
      230. 
      
        
    230. 
          
          
              #   #  <?xml version=\"1.0\" encoding=\"UTF-8\"?>
        
      231. 
      
        
    231. 
          
          
              #   #  <errors>
        
      232. 
      
        
    232. 
          
          
              #   #    <error>name can't be blank</error>
        
      233. 
      
        
    233. 
          
          
              #   #    <error>name must be specified</error>
        
      234. 
      
        
    234. 
          
          
              #   #  </errors>
        
      235. 
      
        
    235. 
          1
          
              def to_xml(options={})
        
      236. 
      
        
    236. 
          
          
                to_a.to_xml({ root: "errors", skip_types: true }.merge!(options))
        
      237. 
      
        
    237. 
          
          
              end
        
      238. 
      
        
    238. 
          
          
          
        
      239. 
      
        
    239. 
          
          
              # Returns a Hash that can be used as the JSON representation for this
        
      240. 
      
        
    240. 
          
          
              # object. You can pass the <tt>:full_messages</tt> option. This determines
        
      241. 
      
        
    241. 
          
          
              # if the json object should contain full messages or not (false by default).
        
      242. 
      
        
    242. 
          
          
              #
        
      243. 
      
        
    243. 
          
          
              #   person.errors.as_json                      # => {:name=>["cannot be nil"]}
        
      244. 
      
        
    244. 
          
          
              #   person.errors.as_json(full_messages: true) # => {:name=>["name cannot be nil"]}
        
      245. 
      
        
    245. 
          1
          
              def as_json(options=nil)
        
      246. 
      
        
    246. 
          
          
                to_hash(options && options[:full_messages])
        
      247. 
      
        
    247. 
          
          
              end
        
      248. 
      
        
    248. 
          
          
          
        
      249. 
      
        
    249. 
          
          
              # Returns a Hash of attributes with their error messages. If +full_messages+
        
      250. 
      
        
    250. 
          
          
              # is +true+, it will contain full messages (see +full_message+).
        
      251. 
      
        
    251. 
          
          
              #
        
      252. 
      
        
    252. 
          
          
              #   person.errors.to_hash       # => {:name=>["cannot be nil"]}
        
      253. 
      
        
    253. 
          
          
              #   person.errors.to_hash(true) # => {:name=>["name cannot be nil"]}
        
      254. 
      
        
    254. 
          1
          
              def to_hash(full_messages = false)
        
      255. 
      
        
    255. 
          
          
                if full_messages
        
      256. 
      
        
    256. 
          
          
                  self.messages.each_with_object({}) do |(attribute, array), messages|
        
      257. 
      
        
    257. 
          
          
                    messages[attribute] = array.map { |message| full_message(attribute, message) }
        
      258. 
      
        
    258. 
          
          
                  end
        
      259. 
      
        
    259. 
          
          
                else
        
      260. 
      
        
    260. 
          
          
                  self.messages.dup
        
      261. 
      
        
    261. 
          
          
                end
        
      262. 
      
        
    262. 
          
          
              end
        
      263. 
      
        
    263. 
          
          
          
        
      264. 
      
        
    264. 
          
          
              # Adds +message+ to the error messages on +attribute+. More than one error
        
      265. 
      
        
    265. 
          
          
              # can be added to the same +attribute+. If no +message+ is supplied,
        
      266. 
      
        
    266. 
          
          
              # <tt>:invalid</tt> is assumed.
        
      267. 
      
        
    267. 
          
          
              #
        
      268. 
      
        
    268. 
          
          
              #   person.errors.add(:name)
        
      269. 
      
        
    269. 
          
          
              #   # => ["is invalid"]
        
      270. 
      
        
    270. 
          
          
              #   person.errors.add(:name, 'must be implemented')
        
      271. 
      
        
    271. 
          
          
              #   # => ["is invalid", "must be implemented"]
        
      272. 
      
        
    272. 
          
          
              #
        
      273. 
      
        
    273. 
          
          
              #   person.errors.messages
        
      274. 
      
        
    274. 
          
          
              #   # => {:name=>["must be implemented", "is invalid"]}
        
      275. 
      
        
    275. 
          
          
              #
        
      276. 
      
        
    276. 
          
          
              # If +message+ is a symbol, it will be translated using the appropriate
        
      277. 
      
        
    277. 
          
          
              # scope (see +generate_message+).
        
      278. 
      
        
    278. 
          
          
              #
        
      279. 
      
        
    279. 
          
          
              # If +message+ is a proc, it will be called, allowing for things like
        
      280. 
      
        
    280. 
          
          
              # <tt>Time.now</tt> to be used within an error.
        
      281. 
      
        
    281. 
          
          
              #
        
      282. 
      
        
    282. 
          
          
              # If the <tt>:strict</tt> option is set to +true+, it will raise
        
      283. 
      
        
    283. 
          
          
              # ActiveModel::StrictValidationFailed instead of adding the error.
        
      284. 
      
        
    284. 
          
          
              # <tt>:strict</tt> option can also be set to any other exception.
        
      285. 
      
        
    285. 
          
          
              #
        
      286. 
      
        
    286. 
          
          
              #   person.errors.add(:name, nil, strict: true)
        
      287. 
      
        
    287. 
          
          
              #   # => ActiveModel::StrictValidationFailed: name is invalid
        
      288. 
      
        
    288. 
          
          
              #   person.errors.add(:name, nil, strict: NameIsInvalid)
        
      289. 
      
        
    289. 
          
          
              #   # => NameIsInvalid: name is invalid
        
      290. 
      
        
    290. 
          
          
              #
        
      291. 
      
        
    291. 
          
          
              #   person.errors.messages # => {}
        
      292. 
      
        
    292. 
          
          
              #
        
      293. 
      
        
    293. 
          
          
              # +attribute+ should be set to <tt>:base</tt> if the error is not
        
      294. 
      
        
    294. 
          
          
              # directly associated with a single attribute.
        
      295. 
      
        
    295. 
          
          
              #
        
      296. 
      
        
    296. 
          
          
              #   person.errors.add(:base, "either name or email must be present")
        
      297. 
      
        
    297. 
          
          
              #   person.errors.messages
        
      298. 
      
        
    298. 
          
          
              #   # => {:base=>["either name or email must be present"]}
        
      299. 
      
        
    299. 
          1
          
              def add(attribute, message = :invalid, options = {})
        
      300. 
      
        
    300. 
          4
          
                message = normalize_message(attribute, message, options)
        
      301. 
      
        
    301. 
          4
          
                if exception = options[:strict]
        
      302. 
      
        
    302. 
          
          
                  exception = ActiveModel::StrictValidationFailed if exception == true
        
      303. 
      
        
    303. 
          
          
                  raise exception, full_message(attribute, message)
        
      304. 
      
        
    304. 
          
          
                end
        
      305. 
      
        
    305. 
          
          
          
        
      306. 
      
        
    306. 
          4
          
                self[attribute] << message
        
      307. 
      
        
    307. 
          
          
              end
        
      308. 
      
        
    308. 
          
          
          
        
      309. 
      
        
    309. 
          
          
              # Will add an error message to each of the attributes in +attributes+
        
      310. 
      
        
    310. 
          
          
              # that is empty.
        
      311. 
      
        
    311. 
          
          
              #
        
      312. 
      
        
    312. 
          
          
              #   person.errors.add_on_empty(:name)
        
      313. 
      
        
    313. 
          
          
              #   person.errors.messages
        
      314. 
      
        
    314. 
          
          
              #   # => {:name=>["can't be empty"]}
        
      315. 
      
        
    315. 
          1
          
              def add_on_empty(attributes, options = {})
        
      316. 
      
        
    316. 
          
          
                Array(attributes).each do |attribute|
        
      317. 
      
        
    317. 
          
          
                  value = @base.send(:read_attribute_for_validation, attribute)
        
      318. 
      
        
    318. 
          
          
                  is_empty = value.respond_to?(:empty?) ? value.empty? : false
        
      319. 
      
        
    319. 
          
          
                  add(attribute, :empty, options) if value.nil? || is_empty
        
      320. 
      
        
    320. 
          
          
                end
        
      321. 
      
        
    321. 
          
          
              end
        
      322. 
      
        
    322. 
          
          
          
        
      323. 
      
        
    323. 
          
          
              # Will add an error message to each of the attributes in +attributes+ that
        
      324. 
      
        
    324. 
          
          
              # is blank (using Object#blank?).
        
      325. 
      
        
    325. 
          
          
              #
        
      326. 
      
        
    326. 
          
          
              #   person.errors.add_on_blank(:name)
        
      327. 
      
        
    327. 
          
          
              #   person.errors.messages
        
      328. 
      
        
    328. 
          
          
              #   # => {:name=>["can't be blank"]}
        
      329. 
      
        
    329. 
          1
          
              def add_on_blank(attributes, options = {})
        
      330. 
      
        
    330. 
          
          
                Array(attributes).each do |attribute|
        
      331. 
      
        
    331. 
          
          
                  value = @base.send(:read_attribute_for_validation, attribute)
        
      332. 
      
        
    332. 
          
          
                  add(attribute, :blank, options) if value.blank?
        
      333. 
      
        
    333. 
          
          
                end
        
      334. 
      
        
    334. 
          
          
              end
        
      335. 
      
        
    335. 
          
          
          
        
      336. 
      
        
    336. 
          
          
              # Returns +true+ if an error on the attribute with the given message is
        
      337. 
      
        
    337. 
          
          
              # present, +false+ otherwise. +message+ is treated the same as for +add+.
        
      338. 
      
        
    338. 
          
          
              #
        
      339. 
      
        
    339. 
          
          
              #   person.errors.add :name, :blank
        
      340. 
      
        
    340. 
          
          
              #   person.errors.added? :name, :blank # => true
        
      341. 
      
        
    341. 
          1
          
              def added?(attribute, message = :invalid, options = {})
        
      342. 
      
        
    342. 
          
          
                message = normalize_message(attribute, message, options)
        
      343. 
      
        
    343. 
          
          
                self[attribute].include? message
        
      344. 
      
        
    344. 
          
          
              end
        
      345. 
      
        
    345. 
          
          
          
        
      346. 
      
        
    346. 
          
          
              # Returns all the full error messages in an array.
        
      347. 
      
        
    347. 
          
          
              #
        
      348. 
      
        
    348. 
          
          
              #   class Person
        
      349. 
      
        
    349. 
          
          
              #     validates_presence_of :name, :address, :email
        
      350. 
      
        
    350. 
          
          
              #     validates_length_of :name, in: 5..30
        
      351. 
      
        
    351. 
          
          
              #   end
        
      352. 
      
        
    352. 
          
          
              #
        
      353. 
      
        
    353. 
          
          
              #   person = Person.create(address: '123 First St.')
        
      354. 
      
        
    354. 
          
          
              #   person.errors.full_messages
        
      355. 
      
        
    355. 
          
          
              #   # => ["Name is too short (minimum is 5 characters)", "Name can't be blank", "Email can't be blank"]
        
      356. 
      
        
    356. 
          1
          
              def full_messages
        
      357. 
      
        
    357. 
          
          
                map { |attribute, message| full_message(attribute, message) }
        
      358. 
      
        
    358. 
          
          
              end
        
      359. 
      
        
    359. 
          
          
          
        
      360. 
      
        
    360. 
          
          
              # Returns all the full error messages for a given attribute in an array.
        
      361. 
      
        
    361. 
          
          
              #
        
      362. 
      
        
    362. 
          
          
              #   class Person
        
      363. 
      
        
    363. 
          
          
              #     validates_presence_of :name, :email
        
      364. 
      
        
    364. 
          
          
              #     validates_length_of :name, in: 5..30
        
      365. 
      
        
    365. 
          
          
              #   end
        
      366. 
      
        
    366. 
          
          
              #
        
      367. 
      
        
    367. 
          
          
              #   person = Person.create()
        
      368. 
      
        
    368. 
          
          
              #   person.errors.full_messages_for(:name)
        
      369. 
      
        
    369. 
          
          
              #   # => ["Name is too short (minimum is 5 characters)", "Name can't be blank"]
        
      370. 
      
        
    370. 
          1
          
              def full_messages_for(attribute)
        
      371. 
      
        
    371. 
          
          
                (get(attribute) || []).map { |message| full_message(attribute, message) }
        
      372. 
      
        
    372. 
          
          
              end
        
      373. 
      
        
    373. 
          
          
          
        
      374. 
      
        
    374. 
          
          
              # Returns a full message for a given attribute.
        
      375. 
      
        
    375. 
          
          
              #
        
      376. 
      
        
    376. 
          
          
              #   person.errors.full_message(:name, 'is invalid') # => "Name is invalid"
        
      377. 
      
        
    377. 
          1
          
              def full_message(attribute, message)
        
      378. 
      
        
    378. 
          
          
                return message if attribute == :base
        
      379. 
      
        
    379. 
          
          
                attr_name = attribute.to_s.tr('.', '_').humanize
        
      380. 
      
        
    380. 
          
          
                attr_name = @base.class.human_attribute_name(attribute, default: attr_name)
        
      381. 
      
        
    381. 
          
          
                I18n.t(:"errors.format", {
        
      382. 
      
        
    382. 
          
          
                  default:  "%{attribute} %{message}",
        
      383. 
      
        
    383.

      384.

      385.

      387. 
      
        
    387. 
          
          
          
        
      388. 
      
        
    388. 
          
          
              # Translates an error message in its default scope
        
      389. 
      
        
    389. 
          
          
              # (<tt>activemodel.errors.messages</tt>).
        
      390. 
      
        
    390. 
          
          
              #
        
      391. 
      
        
    391. 
          
          
              # Error messages are first looked up in <tt>models.MODEL.attributes.ATTRIBUTE.MESSAGE</tt>,
        
      392. 
      
        
    392. 
          
          
              # if it's not there, it's looked up in <tt>models.MODEL.MESSAGE</tt> and if
        
      393. 
      
        
    393. 
          
          
              # that is not there also, it returns the translation of the default message
        
      394. 
      
        
    394. 
          
          
              # (e.g. <tt>activemodel.errors.messages.MESSAGE</tt>). The translated model
        
      395. 
      
        
    395. 
          
          
              # name, translated attribute name and the value are available for
        
      396. 
      
        
    396. 
          
          
              # interpolation.
        
      397. 
      
        
    397. 
          
          
              #
        
      398. 
      
        
    398. 
          
          
              # When using inheritance in your models, it will check all the inherited
        
      399. 
      
        
    399. 
          
          
              # models too, but only if the model itself hasn't been found. Say you have
        
      400. 
      
        
    400. 
          
          
              # <tt>class Admin < User; end</tt> and you wanted the translation for
        
      401. 
      
        
    401. 
          
          
              # the <tt>:blank</tt> error message for the <tt>title</tt> attribute,
        
      402. 
      
        
    402. 
          
          
              # it looks for these translations:
        
      403. 
      
        
    403. 
          
          
              #
        
      404. 
      
        
    404. 
          
          
              # * <tt>activemodel.errors.models.admin.attributes.title.blank</tt>
        
      405. 
      
        
    405. 
          
          
              # * <tt>activemodel.errors.models.admin.blank</tt>
        
      406. 
      
        
    406. 
          
          
              # * <tt>activemodel.errors.models.user.attributes.title.blank</tt>
        
      407. 
      
        
    407. 
          
          
              # * <tt>activemodel.errors.models.user.blank</tt>
        
      408. 
      
        
    408. 
          
          
              # * any default you provided through the +options+ hash (in the <tt>activemodel.errors</tt> scope)
        
      409. 
      
        
    409. 
          
          
              # * <tt>activemodel.errors.messages.blank</tt>
        
      410. 
      
        
    410. 
          
          
              # * <tt>errors.attributes.title.blank</tt>
        
      411. 
      
        
    411. 
          
          
              # * <tt>errors.messages.blank</tt>
        
      412. 
      
        
    412. 
          1
          
              def generate_message(attribute, type = :invalid, options = {})
        
      413. 
      
        
    413. 
          4
          
                type = options.delete(:message) if options[:message].is_a?(Symbol)
        
      414. 
      
        
    414. 
          
          
          
        
      415. 
      
        
    415. 
          4
          
                if @base.class.respond_to?(:i18n_scope)
        
      416. 
      
        
    416. 
          4
          
                  defaults = @base.class.lookup_ancestors.map do |klass|
        
      417. 
      
        
    417. 
          4
          
                    [ :"#{@base.class.i18n_scope}.errors.models.#{klass.model_name.i18n_key}.attributes.#{attribute}.#{type}",
        
      418. 
      
        
    418. 
          
          
                      :"#{@base.class.i18n_scope}.errors.models.#{klass.model_name.i18n_key}.#{type}" ]
        
      419. 
      
        
    419. 
          
          
                  end
        
      420. 
      
        
    420. 
          
          
                else
        
      421. 
      
        
    421. 
          
          
                  defaults = []
        
      422. 
      
        
    422. 
          
          
                end
        
      423. 
      
        
    423. 
          
          
          
        
      424. 
      
        
    424. 
          4
          
                defaults << options.delete(:message)
        
      425. 
      
        
    425. 
          4
          
                defaults << :"#{@base.class.i18n_scope}.errors.messages.#{type}" if @base.class.respond_to?(:i18n_scope)
        
      426. 
      
        
    426. 
          4
          
                defaults << :"errors.attributes.#{attribute}.#{type}"
        
      427. 
      
        
    427. 
          4
          
                defaults << :"errors.messages.#{type}"
        
      428. 
      
        
    428. 
          
          
          
        
      429. 
      
        
    429. 
          4
          
                defaults.compact!
        
      430. 
      
        
    430. 
          4
          
                defaults.flatten!
        
      431. 
      
        
    431. 
          
          
          
        
      432. 
      
        
    432. 
          4
          
                key = defaults.shift
        
      433. 
      
        
    433. 
          4
          
                value = (attribute != :base ? @base.send(:read_attribute_for_validation, attribute) : nil)
        
      434. 
      
        
    434. 
          
          
          
        
      435. 
      
        
    435. 
          4
          
                options = {
        
      436. 
      
        
    436. 
          
          
                  default: defaults,
        
      437. 
      
        
    437. 
          
          
                  model: @base.model_name.human,
        
      438. 
      
        
    438. 
          
          
                  attribute: @base.class.human_attribute_name(attribute),
        
      439. 
      
        
    439. 
          
          
                  value: value
        
      440. 
      
        
    440. 
          
          
                }.merge!(options)
        
      441. 
      
        
    441. 
          
          
          
        
      442. 
      
        
    442. 
          4
          
                I18n.translate(key, options)
        
      443. 
      
        
    443. 
          
          
              end
        
      444. 
      
        
    444. 
          
          
          
        
      445. 
      
        
    445. 
          1
          
            private
        
      446. 
      
        
    446. 
          1
          
              def normalize_message(attribute, message, options)
        
      447. 
      
        
    447. 
          4
          
                case message
        
      448. 
      
        
    448. 
          
          
                when Symbol
        
      449. 
      
        
    449. 
          4
          
                  generate_message(attribute, message, options.except(*CALLBACKS_OPTIONS))
        
      450. 
      
        
    450. 
          
          
                when Proc
        
      451. 
      
        
    451. 
          
          
                  message.call
        
      452. 
      
        
    452. 
          
          
                else
        
      453. 
      
        
    453. 
          
          
                  message
        
      454. 
      
        
    454. 
          
          
                end
        
      455. 
      
        
    455. 
          
          
              end
        
      456. 
      
        
    456. 
          
          
            end
        
      457. 
      
        
    457. 
          
          
          
        
      458. 
      
        
    458.

      460.

                def self.initial_count_for(connection, name, table_joins)
        
      26. 
      
        
    26. 
          
          
                  # quoted_name should be downcased as some database adapters (Oracle) return quoted name in uppercase
        
      27. 
      
        
    27. 
          
          
                  quoted_name = connection.quote_table_name(name).downcase
        
      28. 
      
        
    28. 
          
          
          
        
      29. 
      
        
    29. 
          
          
                  counts = table_joins.map do |join|
        
      30. 
      
        
    30. 
          
          
                    if join.is_a?(Arel::Nodes::StringJoin)
        
      31. 
      
        
    31. 
          
          
                      # Table names + table aliases
        
      32. 
      
        
    32. 
          
          
                      join.left.downcase.scan(
        
      33. 
      
        
    33. 
          
          
                        /join(?:\s+\w+)?\s+(\S+\s+)?#{quoted_name}\son/
        
      34. 
      
        
    34. 
          
          
                      ).size
        
      35. 
      
        
    35. 
          
          
                    elsif join.respond_to? :left
        
      36. 
      
        
    36. 
          
          
                      join.left.table_name == name ? 1 : 0
        
      37. 
      
        
    37. 
          
          
                    else
        
      38. 
      
        
    38. 
          
          
                      # this branch is reached by two tests:
        
      39. 
      
        
    39. 
          
          
                      #
        
      40. 
      
        
    40. 
          
          
                      # activerecord/test/cases/associations/cascaded_eager_loading_test.rb:37
        
      41. 
      
        
    41. 
          
          
                      #   with :posts
        
      42. 
      
        
    42. 
          
          
                      #
        
      43.

      44. 
      
        
    44. 
          
          
                      #   with :comments
        
      45. 
      
        
    45. 
          
          
                      #
        
      46. 
      
        
    46. 
          
          
                      0
        
      47. 
      
        
    47. 
          
          
                    end
        
      48. 
      
        
    48. 
          
          
                  end
        
      49. 
      
        
    49. 
          
          
          
        
      50.

                  counts.sum
        
      51. 
      
        
    51. 
          
          
                end
        
      52. 
      
        
    52. 
          
          
          
        
      53. 
      
        
    53.

                def aliased_table_for(table_name, aliased_name)
        
      60. 
      
        
    60. 
          94
          
                  if aliases[table_name].zero?
        
      61. 
      
        
    61. 
          
          
                    # If it's zero, we can have our table_name
        
      62. 
      
        
    62. 
          94
          
                    aliases[table_name] = 1
        
      63. 
      
        
    63. 
          94
          
                    Arel::Table.new(table_name)
        
      64. 
      
        
    64. 
          
          
                  else
        
      65. 
      
        
    65. 
          
          
                    # Otherwise, we need to use an alias
        
      66. 
      
        
    66. 
          
          
                    aliased_name = connection.table_alias_for(aliased_name)
        
      67. 
      
        
    67. 
          
          
          
        
      68. 
      
        
    68. 
          
          
                    # Update the count
        
      69. 
      
        
    69. 
          
          
                    aliases[aliased_name] += 1
        
      70. 
      
        
    70. 
          
          
          
        
      71. 
      
        
    71. 
          
          
                    table_alias = if aliases[aliased_name] > 1
        
      72. 
      
        
    72. 
          
          
                      "#{truncate(aliased_name)}_#{aliases[aliased_name]}"
        
      73. 
      
        
    73. 
          
          
                    else
        
      74. 
      
        
    74. 
          
          
                      aliased_name
        
      75. 
      
        
    75. 
          
          
                    end
        
      76. 
      
        
    76. 
          
          
                    Arel::Table.new(table_name).alias(table_alias)
        
      77. 
      
        
    77. 
          
          
                  end
        
      78. 
      
        
    78. 
          
          
                end
        
      79. 
      
        
    79. 
          
          
          
        
      80.

      81.

                  def truncate(name)
        
      83. 
      
        
    83. 
          
          
                    name.slice(0, connection.table_alias_length - 2)

    84.

                # The target is stale if the target no longer points to the record(s) that the
        
      70. 
      
        
    70. 
          
          
                # relevant foreign_key(s) refers to. If stale, the association accessor method
        
      71.

      72.

      73. 
      
        
    73. 
          
          
                #
        
      74. 
      
        
    74. 
          
          
                # Note that if the target has not been loaded, it is not considered stale.
        
      75. 
      
        
    75. 
          1
          
                def stale_target?
        
      76. 
      
        
    76. 
          24
          
                  !inversed && loaded? && @stale_state != stale_state
        
      77. 
      
        
    77. 
          
          
                end
        
      78.

                # Sets the target of this association to <tt>\target</tt>, and the \loaded flag to +true+.
        
      80.

          1

      84.

                def scope

                # The scope for this association.
        
      90.

      92.

      93. 
      
        
    93.

      94. 
      
        
    94. 
          
          
                # actually gets built.

                  if invertible_for?(record)

      109.

                # Loads the \target if needed and returns it.
        
      128. 
      
        
    128. 
          
          
                #
        
      129. 
      
        
    129. 
          
          
                # This method is abstract in the sense that it relies on +find_target+,
        
      130. 
      
        
    130. 
          
          
                # which is expected to be provided by descendants.
        
      131. 
      
        
    131. 
          
          
                #
        
      132. 
      
        
    132. 
          
          
                # If the \target is already \loaded it is just returned. Thus, you can call
        
      133. 
      
        
    133. 
          
          
                # +load_target+ unconditionally to get the \target.
        
      134. 
      
        
    134. 
          
          
                #
        
      135. 
      
        
    135. 
          
          
                # ActiveRecord::RecordNotFound is rescued within the method, and it is
        
      136. 
      
        
    136. 
          
          
                # not reraised. The proxy is \reset and +nil+ is the return value.
        
      137. 
      
        
    137. 
          1
          
                def load_target
        
      138. 
      
        
    138. 
          34
          
                  @target = find_target if (@stale_state && stale_target?) || find_target?
        
      139. 
      
        
    139. 
          
          
          
        
      140. 
      
        
    140. 
          34
          
                  loaded! unless loaded?
        
      141. 
      
        
    141. 
          34
          
                  target
        
      142. 
      
        
    142. 
          
          
                rescue ActiveRecord::RecordNotFound
        
      143.

                  reset
        
      144. 
      
        
    144. 
          
          
                end
        
      145.

                def interpolate(sql, record = nil)

    147. 
          
          
                  if sql.respond_to?(:to_proc)
        
      148. 
      
        
    148. 
          
          
                    owner.instance_exec(record, &sql)
        
      149. 
      
        
    149. 
          
          
                  else
        
      150.

      151.

      152.

                def marshal_dump

      159.

                def marshal_load(data)
        
      161. 
      
        
    161. 
          
          
                  reflection_name, ivars = data
        
      162. 
      
        
    162. 
          
          
                  ivars.each { |name, val| instance_variable_set(name, val) }
        
      163. 
      
        
    163.

      164. 
      
        
    164. 
          
          
                end
        
      165. 
      
        
    165.

                def initialize_attributes(record) #:nodoc:
        
      167. 
      
        
    167. 
          
          
                  skip_assign = [reflection.foreign_key, reflection.type].compact
        
      168. 
      
        
    168. 
          
          
                  attributes = create_scope.except(*(record.changed - skip_assign))
        
      169. 
      
        
    169. 
          
          
                  record.assign_attributes(attributes)
        
      170. 
      
        
    170. 
          
          
                  set_inverse_instance(record)
        
      171. 
      
        
    171. 
          
          
                end
        
      172.

                  def find_target?
        
      176. 
      
        
    176. 
          
          
                    !loaded? && (!owner.new_record? || foreign_key_present?) && klass
        
      177. 
      
        
    177. 
          
          
                  end
        
      178. 
      
        
    178. 
          
          
          
        
      179. 
      
        
    179. 
          1
          
                  def creation_attributes
        
      180. 
      
        
    180. 
          
          
                    attributes = {}
        
      181. 
      
        
    181. 
          
          
          
        
      182. 
      
        
    182. 
          
          
                    if (reflection.has_one? || reflection.collection?) && !options[:through]
        
      183. 
      
        
    183. 
          
          
                      attributes[reflection.foreign_key] = owner[reflection.active_record_primary_key]
        
      184. 
      
        
    184. 
          
          
          
        
      185. 
      
        
    185.

      186. 
      
        
    186.

      187.

      188. 
      
        
    188. 
          
          
                    end
        
      189. 
      
        
    189. 
          
          
          
        
      190. 
      
        
    190.

      191. 
      
        
    191.

      192. 
      
        
    192. 
          
          
          
        
      193. 
      
        
    193. 
          
          
                  # Sets the owner attributes on the given record
        
      194. 
      
        
    194. 
          1
          
                  def set_owner_attributes(record)
        
      195. 
      
        
    195. 
          
          
                    creation_attributes.each { |key, value| record[key] = value }
        
      196. 
      
        
    196. 
          
          
                  end
        
      197. 
      
        
    197. 
          
          
          
        
      198. 
      
        
    198. 
          
          
                  # Returns true if there is a foreign key present on the owner which
        
      199. 
      
        
    199. 
          
          
                  # references the target. This is used to determine whether we can load
        
      200. 
      
        
    200. 
          
          
                  # the target if the owner is currently a new record (and therefore
        
      201. 
      
        
    201. 
          
          
                  # without a key). If the owner is a new record then foreign_key must
        
      202. 
      
        
    202. 
          
          
                  # be present in order to load target.
        
      203. 
      
        
    203. 
          
          
                  #
        
      204. 
      
        
    204. 
          
          
                  # Currently implemented by belongs_to (vanilla and polymorphic) and
        
      205. 
      
        
    205. 
          
          
                  # has_one/has_many :through associations which go through a belongs_to.
        
      206. 
      
        
    206. 
          1
          
                  def foreign_key_present?
        
      207. 
      
        
    207. 
          
          
                    false
        
      208. 
      
        
    208. 
          
          
                  end
        
      209. 
      
        
    209. 
          
          
          
        
      210. 
      
        
    210. 
          
          
                  # Raises ActiveRecord::AssociationTypeMismatch unless +record+ is of
        
      211. 
      
        
    211. 
          
          
                  # the kind of the class of the associated objects. Meant to be used as
        
      212. 
      
        
    212. 
          
          
                  # a sanity check when you are about to assign an associated record.
        
      213. 
      
        
    213. 
          1
          
                  def raise_on_type_mismatch!(record)
        
      214. 
      
        
    214. 
          21
          
                    unless record.is_a?(reflection.klass)
        
      215. 
      
        
    215. 
          
          
                      fresh_class = reflection.class_name.safe_constantize
        
      216. 
      
        
    216. 
          
          
                      unless fresh_class && record.is_a?(fresh_class)
        
      217. 
      
        
    217. 
          
          
                        message = "#{reflection.class_name}(##{reflection.klass.object_id}) expected, got #{record.class}(##{record.class.object_id})"
        
      218. 
      
        
    218. 
          
          
                        raise ActiveRecord::AssociationTypeMismatch, message
        
      219. 
      
        
    219. 
          
          
                      end
        
      220. 
      
        
    220. 
          
          
                    end
        
      221. 
      
        
    221. 
          
          
                  end
        
      222. 
      
        
    222. 
          
          
          
        
      223. 
      
        
    223. 
          
          
                  # Can be redefined by subclasses, notably polymorphic belongs_to
        
      224. 
      
        
    224. 
          
          
                  # The record parameter is necessary to support polymorphic inverses as we must check for
        
      225. 
      
        
    225. 
          
          
                  # the association in the specific class of the record.
        
      226. 
      
        
    226. 
          1
          
                  def inverse_reflection_for(record)
        
      227.

          32
          
                    reflection.inverse_of
        
      228. 
      
        
    228. 
          
          
                  end
        
      229. 
      
        
    229. 
          
          
          
        
      230. 
      
        
    230. 
          
          
                  # Returns true if inverse association on the given record needs to be set.
        
      231. 
      
        
    231. 
          
          
                  # This method is redefined by subclasses.
        
      232. 
      
        
    232. 
          1
          
                  def invertible_for?(record)
        
      233. 
      
        
    233. 
          
          
                    foreign_key_for?(record) && inverse_reflection_for(record)
        
      234. 
      
        
    234. 
          
          
                  end
        
      235. 
      
        
    235. 
          
          
          
        
      236. 
      
        
    236. 
          
          
                  # Returns true if record contains the foreign_key
        
      237. 
      
        
    237. 
          1

      238. 
      
        
    238. 
          
          
                    record.has_attribute?(reflection.foreign_key)
        
      239. 
      
        
    239. 
          
          
                  end
        
      240. 
      
        
    240. 
          
          
          
        
      241. 
      
        
    241. 
          
          
                  # This should be implemented to return the values of the relevant key(s) on the owner,
        
      242. 
      
        
    242. 
          
          
                  # so that when stale_state is different from the value stored on the last find_target,
        
      243. 
      
        
    243. 
          
          
                  # the target is stale.
        
      244. 
      
        
    244. 
          
          
                  #
        
      245. 
      
        
    245. 
          
          
                  # This is only relevant to certain associations, which is why it returns nil by default.
        
      246.

          1
          
                  def stale_state
        
      247. 
      
        
    247. 
          
          
                  end
        
      248.

                  def build_record(attributes)
        
      250.

      251. 
      
        
    251. 
          
          
                      initialize_attributes(record)
        
      252. 
      
        
    252. 
          
          
                    end
        
      253. 
      
        
    253. 
          
          
                  end
        
      254. 
      
        
    254. 
          
          
          
        
      255. 
      
        
    255. 
          
          
                  # Returns true if statement cache should be skipped on the association reader.
        
      256.

    257. 
          
          
                    reflection.scope_chain.any?(&:any?) ||
        
      258. 
      
        
    258. 
          11
          
                      scope.eager_loading? ||
        
      259. 
      
        
    259. 
          
          
                      klass.current_scope ||
        
      260. 
      
        
    260. 
          
          
                      klass.default_scopes.any? ||
        
      261. 
      
        
    261. 
          
          
                      reflection.source_reflection.active_record.default_scopes.any?
        
      262. 
      
        
    262. 
          
          
                  end
        
      263. 
      
        
    263. 
          
          
              end
        
      264.

            end

                def self.get_bind_values(owner, chain)

          11
          
                  binds = []

          11

          11

                def construct_tables(chain, klass, refl, alias_tracker)
        
      66. 
      
        
    66. 
          12
          
                  chain.map do |reflection|
        
      67. 
      
        
    67. 
          12
          
                    alias_tracker.aliased_table_for(
        
      68. 
      
        
    68. 
          
          
                      table_name_for(reflection, klass, refl),
        
      69. 
      
        
    69. 
          
          
                      table_alias_for(reflection, refl, reflection != refl)
        
      70. 
      
        
    70.

      71.

                  end
        
      72.

                end
        
      73. 
      
        
    73. 
          
          
          
        
      74. 
      
        
    74. 
          1
          
                def table_alias_for(reflection, refl, join = false)
        
      75.

          12

                def join(table, constraint)

                def column_for(table_name, column_name, alias_tracker)

                def bind(scope, table_name, column_name, value, tracker)

                def last_chain_scope(scope, table, reflection, owner, tracker, assoc_klass)
        
      99. 
      
        
    99. 
          12
          
                  join_keys = reflection.join_keys(assoc_klass)
        
      100. 
      
        
    100. 
          12
          
                  key = join_keys.key
        
      101. 
      
        
    101. 
          12
          
                  foreign_key = join_keys.foreign_key
        
      102. 
      
        
    102. 
          
          
          
        
      103. 
      
        
    103. 
          12
          
                  bind_val = bind scope, table.table_name, key.to_s, owner[foreign_key], tracker
        
      104. 
      
        
    104. 
          12
          
                  scope    = scope.where(table[key].eq(bind_val))
        
      105. 
      
        
    105. 
          
          
          
        
      106. 
      
        
    106. 
          12
          
                  if reflection.type
        
      107. 
      
        
    107. 
          
          
                    value    = owner.class.base_class.name
        
      108. 
      
        
    108. 
          
          
                    bind_val = bind scope, table.table_name, reflection.type, value, tracker
        
      109. 
      
        
    109. 
          
          
                    scope    = scope.where(table[reflection.type].eq(bind_val))
        
      110. 
      
        
    110. 
          
          
                  else
        
      111. 
      
        
    111. 
          12
          
                    scope
        
      112. 
      
        
    112. 
          
          
                  end
        
      113. 
      
        
    113. 
          
          
                end
        
      114. 
      
        
    114. 
          
          
          
        
      115. 
      
        
    115. 
          1
          
                def next_chain_scope(scope, table, reflection, tracker, assoc_klass, foreign_table, next_reflection)
        
      116. 
      
        
    116. 
          
          
                  join_keys = reflection.join_keys(assoc_klass)
        
      117. 
      
        
    117. 
          
          
                  key = join_keys.key
        
      118. 
      
        
    118. 
          
          
                  foreign_key = join_keys.foreign_key
        
      119. 
      
        
    119. 
          
          
          
        
      120. 
      
        
    120. 
          
          
                  constraint = table[key].eq(foreign_table[foreign_key])
        
      121. 
      
        
    121. 
          
          
          
        
      122. 
      
        
    122. 
          
          
                  if reflection.type
        
      123. 
      
        
    123. 
          
          
                    value    = next_reflection.klass.base_class.name
        
      124. 
      
        
    124. 
          
          
                    bind_val = bind scope, table.table_name, reflection.type, value, tracker
        
      125. 
      
        
    125. 
          
          
                    scope    = scope.where(table[reflection.type].eq(bind_val))
        
      126. 
      
        
    126. 
          
          
                  end
        
      127. 
      
        
    127. 
          
          
          
        
      128. 
      
        
    128. 
          
          
                  scope = scope.joins(join(foreign_table, constraint))
        
      129. 
      
        
    129. 
          
          
                end
        
      130. 
      
        
    130. 
          
          
          
        
      131. 
      
        
    131. 
          1
          
                def add_constraints(scope, owner, assoc_klass, refl, tracker)
        
      132. 
      
        
    132. 
          12
          
                  chain = refl.chain
        
      133. 
      
        
    133. 
          12
          
                  scope_chain = refl.scope_chain
        
      134. 
      
        
    134. 
          
          
          
        
      135. 
      
        
    135. 
          12
          
                  tables = construct_tables(chain, assoc_klass, refl, tracker)
        
      136. 
      
        
    136. 
          
          
          
        
      137. 
      
        
    137. 
          12
          
                  owner_reflection = chain.last
        
      138. 
      
        
    138. 
          12
          
                  table = tables.last
        
      139. 
      
        
    139. 
          12
          
                  scope = last_chain_scope(scope, table, owner_reflection, owner, tracker, assoc_klass)
        
      140. 
      
        
    140. 
          
          
          
        
      141. 
      
        
    141. 
          12
          
                  chain.each_with_index do |reflection, i|
        
      142. 
      
        
    142. 
          12
          
                    table, foreign_table = tables.shift, tables.first
        
      143. 
      
        
    143. 
          
          
          
        
      144. 
      
        
    144. 
          12
          
                    unless reflection == chain.last
        
      145. 
      
        
    145. 
          
          
                      next_reflection = chain[i + 1]
        
      146. 
      
        
    146. 
          
          
                      scope = next_chain_scope(scope, table, reflection, tracker, assoc_klass, foreign_table, next_reflection)
        
      147. 
      
        
    147. 
          
          
                    end
        
      148. 
      
        
    148. 
          
          
          
        
      149. 
      
        
    149. 
          12
          
                    is_first_chain = i == 0
        
      150. 
      
        
    150. 
          12
          
                    klass = is_first_chain ? assoc_klass : reflection.klass
        
      151. 
      
        
    151. 
          
          
          
        
      152. 
      
        
    152. 
          
          
                    # Exclude the scope of the association itself, because that
        
      153. 
      
        
    153. 
          
          
                    # was already merged in the #scope method.
        
      154. 
      
        
    154. 
          12
          
                    scope_chain[i].each do |scope_chain_item|
        
      155. 
      
        
    155. 
          
          
                      item  = eval_scope(klass, scope_chain_item, owner)
        
      156. 
      
        
    156. 
          
          
          
        
      157. 
      
        
    157. 
          
          
                      if scope_chain_item == refl.scope
        
      158. 
      
        
    158. 
          
          
                        scope.merge! item.except(:where, :includes, :bind)
        
      159. 
      
        
    159. 
          
          
                      end
        
      160. 
      
        
    160. 
          
          
          
        
      161. 
      
        
    161. 
          
          
                      if is_first_chain
        
      162. 
      
        
    162. 
          
          
                        scope.includes! item.includes_values
        
      163. 
      
        
    163. 
          
          
                      end
        
      164. 
      
        
    164. 
          
          
          
        
      165. 
      
        
    165. 
          
          
                      scope.unscope!(*item.unscope_values)
        
      166. 
      
        
    166. 
          
          
                      scope.where_values += item.where_values
        
      167. 
      
        
    167. 
          
          
                      scope.bind_values  += item.bind_values
        
      168. 
      
        
    168. 
          
          
                      scope.order_values |= item.order_values
        
      169. 
      
        
    169. 
          
          
                    end
        
      170. 
      
        
    170. 
          
          
                  end
        
      171. 
      
        
    171. 
          
          
          
        
      172. 
      
        
    172. 
          12
          
                  scope
        
      173. 
      
        
    173. 
          
          
                end
        
      174. 
      
        
    174. 
          
          
          
        
      175. 
      
        
    175. 
          1
          
                def alias_suffix(refl)
        
      176. 
      
        
    176. 
          12
          
                  refl.name
        
      177. 
      
        
    177. 
          
          
                end
        
      178. 
      
        
    178. 
          
          
          
        
      179. 
      
        
    179. 
          1
          
                def table_name_for(reflection, klass, refl)
        
      180. 
      
        
    180. 
          12
          
                  if reflection == refl
        
      181. 
      
        
    181. 
          
          
                    # If this is a polymorphic belongs_to, we want to get the klass from the
        
      182. 
      
        
    182. 
          
          
                    # association because it depends on the polymorphic_type attribute of
        
      183. 
      
        
    183. 
          
          
                    # the owner
        
      184. 
      
        
    184. 
          12
          
                    klass.table_name
        
      185. 
      
        
    185. 
          
          
                  else
        
      186. 
      
        
    186. 
          
          
                    reflection.table_name
        
      187. 
      
        
    187. 
          
          
                  end
        
      188. 
      
        
    188. 
          
          
                end
        
      189. 
      
        
    189. 
          
          
          
        
      190. 
      
        
    190. 
          1
          
                def eval_scope(klass, scope, owner)
        
      191. 
      
        
    191. 
          
          
                  klass.unscoped.instance_exec(owner, &scope)
        
      192. 
      
        
    192. 
          
          
                end
        
      193. 
      
        
    193. 
          
          
              end
        
      194. 
      
        
    194. 
          
          
            end
        
      195. 
      
        
    195. 
          
          
          end
