                  def columns
        
      23. 
      
        
    23. 
          
          
                    @tables.flat_map { |t| t.column_aliases }
        
      24. 
      
        
    24. 
          
          
                  end
        
      25. 
      
        
    25. 
          
          
          
        
      26. 
      
        
    26. 
          
          
                  # An array of [column_name, alias] pairs for the table
        
      27. 
      
        
    27. 
          1
          
                  def column_aliases(node)
        
      28. 
      
        
    28. 
          
          
                    @name_and_alias_cache[node]
        
      29. 
      
        
    29. 
          
          
                  end
        
      30. 
      
        
    30. 
          
          
          
        
      31. 
      
        
    31. 
          1
          
                  def column_alias(node, column)
        
      32. 
      
        
    32. 
          
          
                    @alias_cache[node][column]
        
      33. 
      
        
    33. 
          
          
                  end
        
      34. 
      
        
    34. 
          
          
          
        
      35. 
      
        
    35. 
          1
          
                  class Table < Struct.new(:node, :columns)
        
      36. 
      
        
    36. 
          1
          
                    def table
        
      37. 
      
        
    37. 
          
          
                      Arel::Nodes::TableAlias.new node.table, node.aliased_table_name
        
      38. 
      
        
    38. 
          
          
                    end
        
      39. 
      
        
    39. 
          
          
          
        
      40. 
      
        
    40. 
          1
          
                    def column_aliases
        
      41. 
      
        
    41. 
          
          
                      t = table
        
      42. 
      
        
    42. 
          
          
                      columns.map { |column| t[column.name].as Arel.sql column.alias }
        
      43. 
      
        
    43. 
          
          
                    end
        
      44. 
      
        
    44. 
          
          
                  end
        
      45. 
      
        
    45. 
          1
          
                  Column = Struct.new(:name, :alias)
        
      46. 
      
        
    46. 
          
          
                end
        
      47. 
      
        
    47. 
          
          
          
        
      48. 
      
        
    48. 
          1
          
                attr_reader :alias_tracker, :base_klass, :join_root
        
      49. 
      
        
    49. 
          
          
          
        
      50. 
      
        
    50. 
          1
          
                def self.make_tree(associations)
        
      51. 
      
        
    51. 
          82
          
                  hash = {}
        
      52. 
      
        
    52. 
          82
          
                  walk_tree associations, hash
        
      53. 
      
        
    53. 
          82
          
                  hash
        
      54. 
      
        
    54. 
          
          
                end
        
      55. 
      
        
    55. 
          
          
          
        
      56. 
      
        
    56. 
          1
          
                def self.walk_tree(associations, hash)
        
      57. 
      
        
    57. 
          82
          
                  case associations
        
      58. 
      
        
    58. 
          
          
                  when Symbol, String
        
      59. 
      
        
    59. 
          
          
                    hash[associations.to_sym] ||= {}
        
      60. 
      
        
    60. 
          
          
                  when Array
        
      61. 
      
        
    61. 
          82
          
                    associations.each do |assoc|
        
      62. 
      
        
    62. 
          
          
                      walk_tree assoc, hash
        
      63. 
      
        
    63. 
          
          
                    end
        
      64. 
      
        
    64. 
          
          
                  when Hash
        
      65. 
      
        
    65. 
          
          
                    associations.each do |k,v|
        
      66. 
      
        
    66. 
          
          
                      cache = hash[k] ||= {}
        
      67. 
      
        
    67. 
          
          
                      walk_tree v, cache
        
      68. 
      
        
    68. 
          
          
                    end
        
      69. 
      
        
    69. 
          
          
                  else
        
      70. 
      
        
    70. 
          
          
                    raise ConfigurationError, associations.inspect
        
      71. 
      
        
    71. 
          
          
                  end
        
      72. 
      
        
    72. 
          
          
                end
        
      73. 
      
        
    73. 
          
          
          
        
      74. 
      
        
    74. 
          
          
                # base is the base class on which operation is taking place.
        
      75. 
      
        
    75. 
          
          
                # associations is the list of associations which are joined using hash, symbol or array.
        
      76. 
      
        
    76. 
          
          
                # joins is the list of all string join commands and arel nodes.
        
      77. 
      
        
    77. 
          
          
                #
        
      78. 
      
        
    78. 
          
          
                #  Example :
        
      79. 
      
        
    79. 
          
          
                #
        
      80. 
      
        
    80. 
          
          
                #  class Physician < ActiveRecord::Base
        
      81. 
      
        
    81. 
          
          
                #    has_many :appointments
        
      82. 
      
        
    82. 
          
          
                #    has_many :patients, through: :appointments
        
      83. 
      
        
    83. 
          
          
                #  end
        
      84. 
      
        
    84. 
          
          
                #
        
      85. 
      
        
    85. 
          
          
                #  If I execute `@physician.patients.to_a` then
        
      86. 
      
        
    86. 
          
          
                #    base # => Physician
        
      87. 
      
        
    87. 
          
          
                #    associations # => []
        
      88. 
      
        
    88. 
          
          
                #    joins # =>  [#<Arel::Nodes::InnerJoin: ...]
        
      89. 
      
        
    89. 
          
          
                #
        
      90. 
      
        
    90. 
          
          
                #  However if I execute `Physician.joins(:appointments).to_a` then
        
      91. 
      
        
    91. 
          
          
                #    base # => Physician
        
      92. 
      
        
    92. 
          
          
                #    associations # => [:appointments]
        
      93. 
      
        
    93. 
          
          
                #    joins # =>  []
        
      94. 
      
        
    94. 
          
          
                #
        
      95. 
      
        
    95. 
          1
          
                def initialize(base, associations, joins)
        
      96. 
      
        
    96. 
          82
          
                  @alias_tracker = AliasTracker.create(base.connection, joins)
        
      97. 
      
        
    97. 
          82
          
                  @alias_tracker.aliased_table_for(base.table_name, base.table_name) # Updates the count for base.table_name to 1
        
      98. 
      
        
    98. 
          82
          
                  tree = self.class.make_tree associations
        
      99. 
      
        
    99. 
          82
          
                  @join_root = JoinBase.new base, build(tree, base)
        
      100. 
      
        
    100. 
          82
          
                  @join_root.children.each { |child| construct_tables! @join_root, child }
        
      101. 
      
        
    101. 
          
          
                end
        
      102. 
      
        
    102. 
          
          
          
        
      103. 
      
        
    103. 
          1
          
                def reflections
        
      104. 
      
        
    104. 
          41
          
                  join_root.drop(1).map!(&:reflection)
        
      105. 
      
        
    105. 
          
          
                end
        
      106. 
      
        
    106. 
          
          
          
        
      107. 
      
        
    107. 
          1
          
                def join_constraints(outer_joins)
        
      108. 
      
        
    108. 
          41
          
                  joins = join_root.children.flat_map { |child|
        
      109. 
      
        
    109. 
          
          
                    make_inner_joins join_root, child
        
      110. 
      
        
    110. 
          
          
                  }
        
      111. 
      
        
    111. 
          
          
          
        
      112. 
      
        
    112. 
          41
          
                  joins.concat outer_joins.flat_map { |oj|
        
      113. 
      
        
    113. 
          41
          
                    if join_root.match? oj.join_root
        
      114. 
      
        
    114. 
          41
          
                      walk join_root, oj.join_root
        
      115. 
      
        
    115. 
          
          
                    else
        
      116. 
      
        
    116. 
          
          
                      oj.join_root.children.flat_map { |child|
        
      117. 
      
        
    117. 
          
          
                        make_outer_joins oj.join_root, child
        
      118. 
      
        
    118. 
          
          
                      }
        
      119. 
      
        
    119. 
          
          
                    end
        
      120. 
      
        
    120. 
          
          
                  }
        
      121. 
      
        
    121. 
          
          
                end
        
      122. 
      
        
    122. 
          
          
          
        
      123. 
      
        
    123. 
          1
          
                def aliases
        
      124. 
      
        
    124. 
          
          
                  Aliases.new join_root.each_with_index.map { |join_part,i|
        
      125. 
      
        
    125. 
          
          
                    columns = join_part.column_names.each_with_index.map { |column_name,j|
        
      126. 
      
        
    126. 
          
          
                      Aliases::Column.new column_name, "t#{i}_r#{j}"
        
      127. 
      
        
    127. 
          
          
                    }
        
      128. 
      
        
    128. 
          
          
                    Aliases::Table.new(join_part, columns)
        
      129. 
      
        
    129. 
          
          
                  }
        
      130. 
      
        
    130. 
          
          
                end
        
      131. 
      
        
    131. 
          
          
          
        
      132. 
      
        
    132. 
          1
          
                def instantiate(result_set, aliases)
        
      133. 
      
        
    133. 
          
          
                  primary_key = aliases.column_alias(join_root, join_root.primary_key)
        
      134. 
      
        
    134. 
          
          
          
        
      135. 
      
        
    135. 
          
          
                  seen = Hash.new { |h,parent_klass|
        
      136. 
      
        
    136. 
          
          
                    h[parent_klass] = Hash.new { |i,parent_id|
        
      137. 
      
        
    137. 
          
          
                      i[parent_id] = Hash.new { |j,child_klass| j[child_klass] = {} }
        
      138. 
      
        
    138. 
          
          
                    }
        
      139. 
      
        
    139. 
          
          
                  }
        
      140. 
      
        
    140. 
          
          
          
        
      141. 
      
        
    141. 
          
          
                  model_cache = Hash.new { |h,klass| h[klass] = {} }
        
      142. 
      
        
    142. 
          
          
                  parents = model_cache[join_root]
        
      143. 
      
        
    143. 
          
          
                  column_aliases = aliases.column_aliases join_root
        
      144. 
      
        
    144. 
          
          
          
        
      145. 
      
        
    145. 
          
          
                  message_bus = ActiveSupport::Notifications.instrumenter
        
      146. 
      
        
    146. 
          
          
          
        
      147. 
      
        
    147. 
          
          
                  payload = {
        
      148. 
      
        
    148. 
          
          
                    record_count: result_set.length,
        
      149. 
      
        
    149. 
          
          
                    class_name: join_root.base_klass.name
        
      150. 
      
        
    150. 
          
          
                  }
        
      151. 
      
        
    151. 
          
          
          
        
      152. 
      
        
    152. 
          
          
                  message_bus.instrument('instantiation.active_record', payload) do
        
      153. 
      
        
    153. 
          
          
                    result_set.each { |row_hash|
        
      154. 
      
        
    154. 
          
          
                      parent_key = primary_key ? row_hash[primary_key] : row_hash
        
      155. 
      
        
    155. 
          
          
                      parent = parents[parent_key] ||= join_root.instantiate(row_hash, column_aliases)
        
      156. 
      
        
    156. 
          
          
                      construct(parent, join_root, row_hash, result_set, seen, model_cache, aliases)
        
      157. 
      
        
    157. 
          
          
                    }
        
      158. 
      
        
    158. 
          
          
                  end
        
      159. 
      
        
    159. 
          
          
          
        
      160. 
      
        
    160. 
          
          
                  parents.values
        
      161. 
      
        
    161. 
          
          
                end
        
      162. 
      
        
    162. 
          
          
          
        
      163. 
      
        
    163. 
          1
          
                private
        
      164. 
      
        
    164. 
          
          
          
        
      165. 
      
        
    165. 
          1
          
                def make_constraints(parent, child, tables, join_type)
        
      166. 
      
        
    166. 
          
          
                  chain         = child.reflection.chain
        
      167. 
      
        
    167. 
          
          
                  foreign_table = parent.table
        
      168. 
      
        
    168. 
          
          
                  foreign_klass = parent.base_klass
        
      169. 
      
        
    169. 
          
          
                  child.join_constraints(foreign_table, foreign_klass, child, join_type, tables, child.reflection.scope_chain, chain)
        
      170. 
      
        
    170. 
          
          
                end
        
      171. 
      
        
    171. 
          
          
          
        
      172. 
      
        
    172. 
          1
          
                def make_outer_joins(parent, child)
        
      173. 
      
        
    173. 
          
          
                  tables    = table_aliases_for(parent, child)
        
      174. 
      
        
    174. 
          
          
                  join_type = Arel::Nodes::OuterJoin
        
      175. 
      
        
    175. 
          
          
                  info      = make_constraints parent, child, tables, join_type
        
      176. 
      
        
    176. 
          
          
          
        
      177. 
      
        
    177. 
          
          
                  [info] + child.children.flat_map { |c| make_outer_joins(child, c) }
        
      178. 
      
        
    178. 
          
          
                end
        
      179. 
      
        
    179. 
          
          
          
        
      180. 
      
        
    180. 
          1
          
                def make_inner_joins(parent, child)
        
      181. 
      
        
    181. 
          
          
                  tables    = child.tables
        
      182. 
      
        
    182. 
          
          
                  join_type = Arel::Nodes::InnerJoin
        
      183. 
      
        
    183. 
          
          
                  info      = make_constraints parent, child, tables, join_type
        
      184. 
      
        
    184. 
          
          
          
        
      185. 
      
        
    185. 
          
          
                  [info] + child.children.flat_map { |c| make_inner_joins(child, c) }
        
      186. 
      
        
    186. 
          
          
                end
        
      187. 
      
        
    187. 
          
          
          
        
      188. 
      
        
    188. 
          1
          
                def table_aliases_for(parent, node)
        
      189. 
      
        
    189. 
          
          
                  node.reflection.chain.map { |reflection|
        
      190. 
      
        
    190. 
          
          
                    alias_tracker.aliased_table_for(
        
      191. 
      
        
    191. 
          
          
                      reflection.table_name,
        
      192. 
      
        
    192. 
          
          
                      table_alias_for(reflection, parent, reflection != node.reflection)
        
      193. 
      
        
    193. 
          
          
                    )
        
      194. 
      
        
    194. 
          
          
                  }
        
      195. 
      
        
    195. 
          
          
                end
        
      196. 
      
        
    196. 
          
          
          
        
      197. 
      
        
    197. 
          1
          
                def construct_tables!(parent, node)
        
      198. 
      
        
    198. 
          
          
                  node.tables = table_aliases_for(parent, node)
        
      199. 
      
        
    199. 
          
          
                  node.children.each { |child| construct_tables! node, child }
        
      200. 
      
        
    200. 
          
          
                end
        
      201. 
      
        
    201. 
          
          
          
        
      202. 
      
        
    202. 
          1
          
                def table_alias_for(reflection, parent, join)
        
      203. 
      
        
    203. 
          
          
                  name = "#{reflection.plural_name}_#{parent.table_name}"
        
      204. 
      
        
    204. 
          
          
                  name << "_join" if join
        
      205. 
      
        
    205. 
          
          
                  name
        
      206. 
      
        
    206. 
          
          
                end
        
      207. 
      
        
    207. 
          
          
          
        
      208. 
      
        
    208. 
          1
          
                def walk(left, right)
        
      209. 
      
        
    209. 
          41
          
                  intersection, missing = right.children.map { |node1|
        
      210. 
      
        
    210. 
          
          
                    [left.children.find { |node2| node1.match? node2 }, node1]
        
      211. 
      
        
    211. 
          
          
                  }.partition(&:first)
        
      212. 
      
        
    212. 
          
          
          
        
      213. 
      
        
    213. 
          41
          
                  ojs = missing.flat_map { |_,n| make_outer_joins left, n }
        
      214. 
      
        
    214. 
          41
          
                  intersection.flat_map { |l,r| walk l, r }.concat ojs
        
      215. 
      
        
    215. 
          
          
                end
        
      216. 
      
        
    216. 
          
          
          
        
      217. 
      
        
    217. 
          1
          
                def find_reflection(klass, name)
        
      218. 
      
        
    218. 
          
          
                  klass._reflect_on_association(name) or
        
      219. 
      
        
    219. 
          
          
                    raise ConfigurationError, "Association named '#{ name }' was not found on #{ klass.name }; perhaps you misspelled it?"
        
      220. 
      
        
    220. 
          
          
                end
        
      221. 
      
        
    221. 
          
          
          
        
      222. 
      
        
    222. 
          1
          
                def build(associations, base_klass)
        
      223. 
      
        
    223. 
          82
          
                  associations.map do |name, right|
        
      224. 
      
        
    224. 
          
          
                    reflection = find_reflection base_klass, name
        
      225. 
      
        
    225. 
          
          
                    reflection.check_validity!
        
      226. 
      
        
    226. 
          
          
                    reflection.check_eager_loadable!
        
      227. 
      
        
    227. 
          
          
          
        
      228. 
      
        
    228. 
          
          
                    if reflection.polymorphic?
        
      229. 
      
        
    229. 
          
          
                      raise EagerLoadPolymorphicError.new(reflection)
        
      230. 
      
        
    230. 
          
          
                    end
        
      231. 
      
        
    231. 
          
          
          
        
      232. 
      
        
    232. 
          
          
                    JoinAssociation.new reflection, build(right, reflection.klass)
        
      233. 
      
        
    233. 
          
          
                  end
        
      234. 
      
        
    234. 
          
          
                end
        
      235. 
      
        
    235. 
          
          
          
        
      236. 
      
        
    236. 
          1
          
                def construct(ar_parent, parent, row, rs, seen, model_cache, aliases)
        
      237. 
      
        
    237. 
          
          
                  return if ar_parent.nil?
        
      238. 
      
        
    238. 
          
          
                  primary_id  = ar_parent.id
        
      239. 
      
        
    239. 
          
          
          
        
      240. 
      
        
    240. 
          
          
                  parent.children.each do |node|
        
      241. 
      
        
    241. 
          
          
                    if node.reflection.collection?
        
      242. 
      
        
    242. 
          
          
                      other = ar_parent.association(node.reflection.name)
        
      243. 
      
        
    243. 
          
          
                      other.loaded!
        
      244. 
      
        
    244. 
          
          
                    else
        
      245. 
      
        
    245. 
          
          
                      if ar_parent.association_cache.key?(node.reflection.name)
        
      246. 
      
        
    246. 
          
          
                        model = ar_parent.association(node.reflection.name).target
        
      247. 
      
        
    247. 
          
          
                        construct(model, node, row, rs, seen, model_cache, aliases)
        
      248. 
      
        
    248. 
          
          
                        next
        
      249. 
      
        
    249. 
          
          
                      end
        
      250. 
      
        
    250. 
          
          
                    end
        
      251. 
      
        
    251. 
          
          
          
        
      252. 
      
        
    252. 
          
          
                    key = aliases.column_alias(node, node.primary_key)
        
      253. 
      
        
    253. 
          
          
                    id = row[key]
        
      254. 
      
        
    254. 
          
          
                    if id.nil?
        
      255. 
      
        
    255. 
          
          
                      nil_association = ar_parent.association(node.reflection.name)
        
      256. 
      
        
    256. 
          
          
                      nil_association.loaded!
        
      257. 
      
        
    257. 
          
          
                      next
        
      258. 
      
        
    258. 
          
          
                    end
        
      259. 
      
        
    259. 
          
          
          
        
      260. 
      
        
    260. 
          
          
                    model = seen[parent.base_klass][primary_id][node.base_klass][id]
        
      261. 
      
        
    261. 
          
          
          
        
      262. 
      
        
    262. 
          
          
                    if model
        
      263. 
      
        
    263. 
          
          
                      construct(model, node, row, rs, seen, model_cache, aliases)
        
      264. 
      
        
    264. 
          
          
                    else
        
      265. 
      
        
    265. 
          
          
                      model = construct_model(ar_parent, node, row, model_cache, id, aliases)
        
      266. 
      
        
    266. 
          
          
                      seen[parent.base_klass][primary_id][node.base_klass][id] = model
        
      267. 
      
        
    267. 
          
          
                      construct(model, node, row, rs, seen, model_cache, aliases)
        
      268. 
      
        
    268. 
          
          
                    end
        
      269. 
      
        
    269. 
          
          
                  end
        
      270. 
      
        
    270. 
          
          
                end
        
      271. 
      
        
    271. 
          
          
          
        
      272. 
      
        
    272. 
          1
          
                def construct_model(record, node, row, model_cache, id, aliases)
        
      273. 
      
        
    273. 
          
          
                  model = model_cache[node][id] ||= node.instantiate(row,
        
      274. 
      
        
    274. 
          
          
                                                                     aliases.column_aliases(node))
        
      275. 
      
        
    275. 
          
          
                  other = record.association(node.reflection.name)
        
      276. 
      
        
    276. 
          
          
          
        
      277. 
      
        
    277. 
          
          
                  if node.reflection.collection?
        
      278. 
      
        
    278. 
          
          
                    other.target.push(model)
        
      279. 
      
        
    279. 
          
          
                  else
        
      280. 
      
        
    280. 
          
          
                    other.target = model
        
      281. 
      
        
    281. 
          
          
                  end
        
      282. 
      
        
    282. 
          
          
          
        
      283. 
      
        
    283. 
          
          
                  other.set_inverse_instance(model)
        
      284. 
      
        
    284. 
          
          
                  model
        
      285. 
      
        
    285. 
          
          
                end
        
      286. 
      
        
    286. 
          
          
              end
        
      287.

            end

          module ActiveRecord

              class JoinDependency # :nodoc:
        
      4. 
      
        
    4. 
          
          
                # A JoinPart represents a part of a JoinDependency. It is inherited
        
      5. 
      
        
    5. 
          
          
                # by JoinBase and JoinAssociation. A JoinBase represents the Active Record which
        
      6. 
      
        
    6. 
          
          
                # everything else is being joined onto. A JoinAssociation represents an association which
        
      7. 
      
        
    7. 
          
          
                # is joining to the base. A JoinAssociation may result in more than one actual join
        
      8. 
      
        
    8. 
          
          
                # operations (for example a has_and_belongs_to_many JoinAssociation would result in
        
      9. 
      
        
    9. 
          
          
                # two; one for the join table and one for the target table).
        
      10. 
      
        
    10. 
          1
          
                class JoinPart # :nodoc:
        
      11. 
      
        
    11. 
          1
          
                  include Enumerable
        
      12. 
      
        
    12. 
          
          
          
        
      13. 
      
        
    13. 
          
          
                  # The Active Record class which this join part is associated 'about'; for a JoinBase
        
      14. 
      
        
    14. 
          
          
                  # this is the actual base model, for a JoinAssociation this is the target model of the
        
      15. 
      
        
    15. 
          
          
                  # association.
        
      16. 
      
        
    16. 
          1
          
                  attr_reader :base_klass, :children
        
      17. 
      
        
    17. 
          
          
          
        
      18. 
      
        
    18. 
          1
          
                  delegate :table_name, :column_names, :primary_key, :to => :base_klass
        
      19.

      22.

          82
          
                    @children = children

                  end
        
      24.

      25.

      27.

    31.

                  def each(&block)

                  def table

                  def aliased_table_name

                    raise NotImplementedError

      47.

      48. 
      
        
    48. 
          1
          
                  def extract_record(row, column_names_with_alias)
        
      49. 
      
        
    49. 
          
          
                    # This code is performance critical as it is called per row.
        
      50. 
      
        
    50. 
          
          
                    # see: https://github.com/rails/rails/pull/12185
        
      51. 
      
        
    51. 
          
          
                    hash = {}
        
      52. 
      
        
    52. 
          
          
          
        
      53. 
      
        
    53. 
          
          
                    index = 0
        
      54. 
      
        
    54. 
          
          
                    length = column_names_with_alias.length
        
      55. 
      
        
    55. 
          
          
          
        
      56. 
      
        
    56. 
          
          
                    while index < length
        
      57. 
      
        
    57. 
          
          
                      column_name, alias_name = column_names_with_alias[index]
        
      58. 
      
        
    58. 
          
          
                      hash[column_name] = row[alias_name]
        
      59. 
      
        
    59. 
          
          
                      index += 1
        
      60. 
      
        
    60. 
          
          
                    end
        
      61. 
      
        
    61. 
          
          
          
        
      62. 
      
        
    62. 
          
          
                    hash
        
      63. 
      
        
    63. 
          
          
                  end
        
      64. 
      
        
    64. 
          
          
          
        
      65. 
      
        
    65. 
          1
          
                  def instantiate(row, aliases)
        
      66. 
      
        
    66. 
          
          
                    base_klass.instantiate(extract_record(row, aliases))
        
      67. 
      
        
    67. 
          
          
                  end
        
      68. 
      
        
    68. 
          
          
                end
        
      69. 
      
        
    69. 
          
          
              end
        
      70. 
      
        
    70. 
          
          
            end
        
      71. 
      
        
    71. 
          
          
          end
        
      72.

    path/gems/activerecord-4.2.6/lib/active_record/associations/preloader.rb

    43.06 % covered

    72 relevant lines. 31 lines covered and 41 lines missed. 
        
      
      
        
    1. 
          1
          
          module ActiveRecord
        
      2. 
      
        
    2. 
          1
          
            module Associations
        
      3. 
      
        
    3. 
          
          
              # Implements the details of eager loading of Active Record associations.
        
      4. 
      
        
    4. 
          
          
              #
        
      5. 
      
        
    5. 
          
          
              # Suppose that you have the following two Active Record models:
        
      6. 
      
        
    6. 
          
          
              #
        
      7. 
      
        
    7. 
          
          
              #   class Author < ActiveRecord::Base
        
      8. 
      
        
    8. 
          
          
              #     # columns: name, age
        
      9. 
      
        
    9. 
          
          
              #     has_many :books
        
      10. 
      
        
    10. 
          
          
              #   end
        
      11. 
      
        
    11. 
          
          
              #
        
      12. 
      
        
    12. 
          
          
              #   class Book < ActiveRecord::Base
        
      13. 
      
        
    13. 
          
          
              #     # columns: title, sales, author_id
        
      14. 
      
        
    14. 
          
          
              #   end
        
      15. 
      
        
    15. 
          
          
              #
        
      16. 
      
        
    16. 
          
          
              # When you load an author with all associated books Active Record will make
        
      17. 
      
        
    17. 
          
          
              # multiple queries like this:
        
      18. 
      
        
    18. 
          
          
              #
        
      19. 
      
        
    19. 
          
          
              #   Author.includes(:books).where(name: ['bell hooks', 'Homer']).to_a
        
      20. 
      
        
    20. 
          
          
              #
        
      21. 
      
        
    21. 
          
          
              #   => SELECT `authors`.* FROM `authors` WHERE `name` IN ('bell hooks', 'Homer')
        
      22. 
      
        
    22. 
          
          
              #   => SELECT `books`.* FROM `books` WHERE `author_id` IN (2, 5)
        
      23. 
      
        
    23. 
          
          
              #
        
      24. 
      
        
    24. 
          
          
              # Active Record saves the ids of the records from the first query to use in
        
      25. 
      
        
    25. 
          
          
              # the second. Depending on the number of associations involved there can be
        
      26. 
      
        
    26. 
          
          
              # arbitrarily many SQL queries made.
        
      27. 
      
        
    27. 
          
          
              #
        
      28. 
      
        
    28. 
          
          
              # However, if there is a WHERE clause that spans across tables Active
        
      29. 
      
        
    29. 
          
          
              # Record will fall back to a slightly more resource-intensive single query:
        
      30. 
      
        
    30. 
          
          
              #
        
      31. 
      
        
    31. 
          
          
              #   Author.includes(:books).where(books: {title: 'Illiad'}).to_a
        
      32. 
      
        
    32. 
          
          
              #   => SELECT `authors`.`id` AS t0_r0, `authors`.`name` AS t0_r1, `authors`.`age` AS t0_r2,
        
      33. 
      
        
    33. 
          
          
              #             `books`.`id`   AS t1_r0, `books`.`title`  AS t1_r1, `books`.`sales` AS t1_r2
        
      34. 
      
        
    34. 
          
          
              #      FROM `authors`
        
      35. 
      
        
    35. 
          
          
              #      LEFT OUTER JOIN `books` ON `authors`.`id` =  `books`.`author_id`
        
      36. 
      
        
    36. 
          
          
              #      WHERE `books`.`title` = 'Illiad'
        
      37. 
      
        
    37. 
          
          
              #
        
      38. 
      
        
    38. 
          
          
              # This could result in many rows that contain redundant data and it performs poorly at scale
        
      39. 
      
        
    39. 
          
          
              # and is therefore only used when necessary.
        
      40. 
      
        
    40. 
          
          
              #
        
      41. 
      
        
    41. 
          1
          
              class Preloader #:nodoc:
        
      42. 
      
        
    42. 
          1
          
                extend ActiveSupport::Autoload
        
      43. 
      
        
    43. 
          
          
          
        
      44. 
      
        
    44. 
          1
          
                eager_autoload do
        
      45. 
      
        
    45. 
          1
          
                  autoload :Association,           'active_record/associations/preloader/association'
        
      46. 
      
        
    46. 
          1
          
                  autoload :SingularAssociation,   'active_record/associations/preloader/singular_association'
        
      47. 
      
        
    47. 
          1
          
                  autoload :CollectionAssociation, 'active_record/associations/preloader/collection_association'
        
      48. 
      
        
    48. 
          1
          
                  autoload :ThroughAssociation,    'active_record/associations/preloader/through_association'
        
      49. 
      
        
    49. 
          
          
          
        
      50. 
      
        
    50. 
          1
          
                  autoload :HasMany,             'active_record/associations/preloader/has_many'
        
      51. 
      
        
    51. 
          1
          
                  autoload :HasManyThrough,      'active_record/associations/preloader/has_many_through'
        
      52. 
      
        
    52. 
          1
          
                  autoload :HasOne,              'active_record/associations/preloader/has_one'
        
      53. 
      
        
    53. 
          1
          
                  autoload :HasOneThrough,       'active_record/associations/preloader/has_one_through'
        
      54. 
      
        
    54. 
          1
          
                  autoload :BelongsTo,           'active_record/associations/preloader/belongs_to'
        
      55. 
      
        
    55. 
          
          
                end
        
      56. 
      
        
    56. 
          
          
          
        
      57. 
      
        
    57. 
          
          
                # Eager loads the named associations for the given Active Record record(s).
        
      58. 
      
        
    58. 
          
          
                #
        
      59. 
      
        
    59. 
          
          
                # In this description, 'association name' shall refer to the name passed
        
      60. 
      
        
    60. 
          
          
                # to an association creation method. For example, a model that specifies
        
      61. 
      
        
    61. 
          
          
                # <tt>belongs_to :author</tt>, <tt>has_many :buyers</tt> has association
        
      62. 
      
        
    62. 
          
          
                # names +:author+ and +:buyers+.
        
      63. 
      
        
    63. 
          
          
                #
        
      64. 
      
        
    64. 
          
          
                # == Parameters
        
      65. 
      
        
    65. 
          
          
                # +records+ is an array of ActiveRecord::Base. This array needs not be flat,
        
      66. 
      
        
    66. 
          
          
                # i.e. +records+ itself may also contain arrays of records. In any case,
        
      67. 
      
        
    67. 
          
          
                # +preload_associations+ will preload the all associations records by
        
      68. 
      
        
    68. 
          
          
                # flattening +records+.
        
      69. 
      
        
    69. 
          
          
                #
        
      70. 
      
        
    70. 
          
          
                # +associations+ specifies one or more associations that you want to
        
      71. 
      
        
    71. 
          
          
                # preload. It may be:
        
      72. 
      
        
    72. 
          
          
                # - a Symbol or a String which specifies a single association name. For
        
      73. 
      
        
    73. 
          
          
                #   example, specifying +:books+ allows this method to preload all books
        
      74. 
      
        
    74. 
          
          
                #   for an Author.
        
      75. 
      
        
    75. 
          
          
                # - an Array which specifies multiple association names. This array
        
      76. 
      
        
    76. 
          
          
                #   is processed recursively. For example, specifying <tt>[:avatar, :books]</tt>
        
      77. 
      
        
    77. 
          
          
                #   allows this method to preload an author's avatar as well as all of his
        
      78. 
      
        
    78. 
          
          
                #   books.
        
      79. 
      
        
    79. 
          
          
                # - a Hash which specifies multiple association names, as well as
        
      80. 
      
        
    80. 
          
          
                #   association names for the to-be-preloaded association objects. For
        
      81. 
      
        
    81. 
          
          
                #   example, specifying <tt>{ author: :avatar }</tt> will preload a
        
      82. 
      
        
    82. 
          
          
                #   book's author, as well as that author's avatar.
        
      83. 
      
        
    83. 
          
          
                #
        
      84. 
      
        
    84. 
          
          
                # +:associations+ has the same format as the +:include+ option for
        
      85. 
      
        
    85. 
          
          
                # <tt>ActiveRecord::Base.find</tt>. So +associations+ could look like this:
        
      86. 
      
        
    86. 
          
          
                #
        
      87. 
      
        
    87. 
          
          
                #   :books
        
      88. 
      
        
    88. 
          
          
                #   [ :books, :author ]
        
      89. 
      
        
    89. 
          
          
                #   { author: :avatar }
        
      90. 
      
        
    90. 
          
          
                #   [ :books, { author: :avatar } ]
        
      91. 
      
        
    91. 
          
          
          
        
      92. 
      
        
    92. 
          1
          
                NULL_RELATION = Struct.new(:values, :bind_values).new({}, [])
        
      93. 
      
        
    93. 
          
          
          
        
      94. 
      
        
    94. 
          1
          
                def preload(records, associations, preload_scope = nil)
        
      95. 
      
        
    95. 
          
          
                  records       = Array.wrap(records).compact.uniq
        
      96. 
      
        
    96. 
          
          
                  associations  = Array.wrap(associations)
        
      97. 
      
        
    97. 
          
          
                  preload_scope = preload_scope || NULL_RELATION
        
      98. 
      
        
    98. 
          
          
          
        
      99. 
      
        
    99. 
          
          
                  if records.empty?
        
      100. 
      
        
    100. 
          
          
                    []
        
      101. 
      
        
    101. 
          
          
                  else
        
      102. 
      
        
    102. 
          
          
                    associations.flat_map { |association|
        
      103. 
      
        
    103. 
          
          
                      preloaders_on association, records, preload_scope
        
      104. 
      
        
    104. 
          
          
                    }
        
      105. 
      
        
    105. 
          
          
                  end
        
      106. 
      
        
    106. 
          
          
                end
        
      107. 
      
        
    107. 
          
          
          
        
      108. 
      
        
    108. 
          1
          
                private
        
      109. 
      
        
    109. 
          
          
          
        
      110. 
      
        
    110. 
          1
          
                def preloaders_on(association, records, scope)
        
      111. 
      
        
    111. 
          
          
                  case association
        
      112. 
      
        
    112. 
          
          
                  when Hash
        
      113. 
      
        
    113. 
          
          
                    preloaders_for_hash(association, records, scope)
        
      114. 
      
        
    114. 
          
          
                  when Symbol
        
      115. 
      
        
    115. 
          
          
                    preloaders_for_one(association, records, scope)
        
      116. 
      
        
    116. 
          
          
                  when String
        
      117. 
      
        
    117. 
          
          
                    preloaders_for_one(association.to_sym, records, scope)
        
      118. 
      
        
    118. 
          
          
                  else
        
      119. 
      
        
    119. 
          
          
                    raise ArgumentError, "#{association.inspect} was not recognised for preload"
        
      120. 
      
        
    120. 
          
          
                  end
        
      121. 
      
        
    121. 
          
          
                end
        
      122. 
      
        
    122. 
          
          
          
        
      123. 
      
        
    123. 
          1
          
                def preloaders_for_hash(association, records, scope)
        
      124. 
      
        
    124. 
          
          
                  association.flat_map { |parent, child|
        
      125. 
      
        
    125. 
          
          
                    loaders = preloaders_for_one parent, records, scope
        
      126. 
      
        
    126. 
          
          
          
        
      127. 
      
        
    127. 
          
          
                    recs = loaders.flat_map(&:preloaded_records).uniq
        
      128. 
      
        
    128. 
          
          
                    loaders.concat Array.wrap(child).flat_map { |assoc|
        
      129. 
      
        
    129. 
          
          
                      preloaders_on assoc, recs, scope
        
      130. 
      
        
    130. 
          
          
                    }
        
      131. 
      
        
    131. 
          
          
                    loaders
        
      132. 
      
        
    132. 
          
          
                  }
        
      133. 
      
        
    133. 
          
          
                end
        
      134. 
      
        
    134. 
          
          
          
        
      135. 
      
        
    135. 
          
          
                # Not all records have the same class, so group then preload group on the reflection
        
      136. 
      
        
    136. 
          
          
                # itself so that if various subclass share the same association then we do not split
        
      137. 
      
        
    137. 
          
          
                # them unnecessarily
        
      138. 
      
        
    138. 
          
          
                #
        
      139. 
      
        
    139. 
          
          
                # Additionally, polymorphic belongs_to associations can have multiple associated
        
      140. 
      
        
    140. 
          
          
                # classes, depending on the polymorphic_type field. So we group by the classes as
        
      141. 
      
        
    141. 
          
          
                # well.
        
      142. 
      
        
    142. 
          1
          
                def preloaders_for_one(association, records, scope)
        
      143. 
      
        
    143. 
          
          
                  grouped_records(association, records).flat_map do |reflection, klasses|
        
      144. 
      
        
    144. 
          
          
                    klasses.map do |rhs_klass, rs|
        
      145. 
      
        
    145. 
          
          
                      loader = preloader_for(reflection, rs, rhs_klass).new(rhs_klass, rs, reflection, scope)
        
      146. 
      
        
    146. 
          
          
                      loader.run self
        
      147. 
      
        
    147. 
          
          
                      loader
        
      148. 
      
        
    148. 
          
          
                    end
        
      149. 
      
        
    149. 
          
          
                  end
        
      150. 
      
        
    150. 
          
          
                end
        
      151. 
      
        
    151. 
          
          
          
        
      152. 
      
        
    152. 
          1
          
                def grouped_records(association, records)
        
      153. 
      
        
    153. 
          
          
                  h = {}
        
      154. 
      
        
    154. 
          
          
                  records.each do |record|
        
      155.

                    next unless record
        
      156. 
      
        
    156.

      157.

      159. 
      
        
    159.

      160. 
      
        
    160.

                def within_new_transaction(options = {})
        
      183. 
      
        
    183. 
          51
          
                  transaction = begin_transaction options
        
      184. 
      
        
    184. 
          51
          
                  yield
        
      185. 
      
        
    185. 
          
          
                rescue Exception => error
        
      186. 
      
        
    186. 
          2
          
                  rollback_transaction if transaction
        
      187. 
      
        
    187. 
          2
          
                  raise
        
      188. 
      
        
    188. 
          
          
                ensure
        
      189. 
      
        
    189. 
          51
          
                  unless error
        
      190. 
      
        
    190. 
          49
          
                    if Thread.current.status == 'aborting'
        
      191. 
      
        
    191. 
          
          
                      rollback_transaction if transaction
        
      192. 
      
        
    192. 
          
          
                    else
        
      193. 
      
        
    193. 
          49
          
                      begin
        
      194. 
      
        
    194. 
          49
          
                        commit_transaction
        
      195. 
      
        
    195. 
          
          
                      rescue Exception
        
      196. 
      
        
    196. 
          
          
                        transaction.rollback unless transaction.state.completed?
        
      197. 
      
        
    197. 
          
          
                        raise
        
      198. 
      
        
    198. 
          
          
                      end
        
      199. 
      
        
    199.

      200. 
      
        
    200.

      201.

              def self.expand(klass, table, column, value)

                queries = []

      56.

              def self.polymorphic_base_class_from_value(value)
        
      80. 
      
        
    80. 
          
          
                case value
        
      81. 
      
        
    81. 
          
          
                when Relation
        
      82. 
      
        
    82. 
          
          
                  value.klass.base_class
        
      83. 
      
        
    83. 
          
          
                when Array
        
      84. 
      
        
    84. 
          
          
                  val = value.compact.first
        
      85.

                  val.class.base_class if val.is_a?(Base)
        
      86. 
      
        
    86. 
          
          
                when Base
        
      87. 
      
        
    87. 
          
          
                  value.class.base_class
        
      88. 
      
        
    88.

      89. 
      
        
    89.

              def self.references(attributes)

                    key

      101.

      102. 
      
        
    102. 
          
          
              # Define how a class is converted to Arel nodes when passed to +where+.
        
      103. 
      
        
    103. 
          
          
              # The handler can be any object that responds to +call+, and will be used
        
      104. 
      
        
    104. 
          
          
              # for any value that +===+ the class given. For example:
        
      105. 
      
        
    105. 
          
          
              #
        
      106.

              def self.convert_value_to_association_ids(value, primary_key)
        
      137. 
      
        
    137. 
          
          
                case value
        
      138.

                when Relation

    141.

    142.

    145.

      146. 
      
        
    146.

      147. 
      
        
    147.

              def column_type(name, type_overrides = {})

    100. 
          
          
                type_overrides.fetch(name) do
        
      101.

              def hash_rows
        
      106. 
      
        
    106. 
          
          
                @hash_rows ||=
        
      107. 
      
        
    107. 
          
          
                  begin

    108. 
          
          
                    # We freeze the strings to prevent them getting duped when
        
      109. 
      
        
    109. 
          
          
                    # used as keys in ActiveRecord::Base's @attributes hash
        
      110. 
      
        
    110. 
          218

      111.

    112.

      113. 
      
        
    113. 
          
          
                      #  though elegant, the verbose way is much more efficient
        
      114. 
      
        
    114. 
          
          
                      #  both time and memory wise cause it avoids a big array allocation
        
      115. 
      
        
    115. 
          
          
                      #  this method is called a lot and needs to be micro optimised
        
      116. 
      
        
    116. 
          61
          
                      hash = {}
        
      117. 
      
        
    117. 
          
          
          
        
      118. 
      
        
    118. 
          61

    119. 
          61

    120. 
          
          
          
        
      121. 
      
        
    121. 
          61
          
                      while index < length
        
      122. 
      
        
    122. 
          229
          
                        hash[columns[index]] = row[index]
        
      123. 
      
        
    123. 
          229
          
                        index += 1
        
      124. 
      
        
    124.

    path/gems/activerecord-4.2.6/lib/active_record/statement_cache.rb

    82.0 % covered

    50 relevant lines. 41 lines covered and 9 lines missed. 
        
      
      
        
    1. 
          1
          
          module ActiveRecord
        
      2. 
      
        
    2. 
          
          
          
        
      3. 
      
        
    3. 
          
          
            # Statement cache is used to cache a single statement in order to avoid creating the AST again.
        
      4. 
      
        
    4. 
          
          
            # Initializing the cache is done by passing the statement in the create block:
        
      5. 
      
        
    5. 
          
          
            #
        
      6. 
      
        
    6. 
          
          
            #   cache = StatementCache.create(Book.connection) do |params|
        
      7. 
      
        
    7. 
          
          
            #     Book.where(name: "my book").where("author_id > 3")
        
      8. 
      
        
    8. 
          
          
            #   end
        
      9. 
      
        
    9. 
          
          
            #
        
      10. 
      
        
    10. 
          
          
            # The cached statement is executed by using the +execute+ method:
        
      11. 
      
        
    11. 
          
          
            #
        
      12. 
      
        
    12. 
          
          
            #   cache.execute([], Book, Book.connection)
        
      13. 
      
        
    13. 
          
          
            #
        
      14. 
      
        
    14. 
          
          
            # The relation returned by the block is cached, and for each +execute+ call the cached relation gets duped.
        
      15. 
      
        
    15. 
          
          
            # Database is queried when +to_a+ is called on the relation.
        
      16. 
      
        
    16. 
          
          
            #
        
      17. 
      
        
    17. 
          
          
            # If you want to cache the statement without the values you can use the +bind+ method of the
        
      18. 
      
        
    18. 
          
          
            # block parameter.
        
      19. 
      
        
    19. 
          
          
            #
        
      20. 
      
        
    20. 
          
          
            #   cache = StatementCache.create(Book.connection) do |params|
        
      21. 
      
        
    21. 
          
          
            #     Book.where(name: params.bind)

              class PartialQuery < Query # :nodoc:
        
      41. 
      
        
    41. 
          1
          
                def initialize values
        
      42. 
      
        
    42. 
          
          
                  @values = values
        
      43. 
      
        
    43. 
          
          
                  @indexes = values.each_with_index.find_all { |thing,i|
        
      44. 
      
        
    44. 
          
          
                    Arel::Nodes::BindParam === thing
        
      45. 
      
        
    45. 
          
          
                  }.map(&:last)

                def sql_for(binds, connection)
        
      49. 
      
        
    49. 
          
          
                  val = @values.dup
        
      50. 
      
        
    50. 
          
          
                  binds = binds.dup
        
      51. 
      
        
    51. 
          
          
                  @indexes.each { |i| val[i] = connection.quote(*binds.shift.reverse) }
        
      52. 
      
        
    52. 
          
          
                  val.join
        
      53. 
      
        
    53. 
          
          
                end
        
      54. 
      
        
    54. 
          
          
              end
        
      55.

              class Params # :nodoc:

              class BindMap # :nodoc:
        
      70. 
      
        
    70. 
          1
          
                def initialize(bind_values)
        
      71. 
      
        
    71. 
          4
          
                  @indexes   = []
        
      72. 
      
        
    72. 
          4
          
                  @bind_values = bind_values
        
      73. 
      
        
    73. 
          
          
          
        
      74. 
      
        
    74. 
          4
          
                  bind_values.each_with_index do |(_, value), i|
        
      75. 
      
        
    75. 
          5
          
                    if Substitute === value
        
      76. 
      
        
    76. 
          5
          
                      @indexes << i
        
      77. 
      
        
    77. 
          
          
                    end
        
      78. 
      
        
    78. 
          
          
                  end
        
      79. 
      
        
    79. 
          
          
                end
        
      80. 
      
        
    80. 
          
          
          
        
      81. 
      
        
    81. 
          1
          
                def bind(values)
        
      82. 
      
        
    82. 
          33
          
                  bvs = @bind_values.map { |pair| pair.dup }
        
      83. 
      
        
    83. 
          33
          
                  @indexes.each_with_index { |offset,i| bvs[offset][1] = values[i] }
        
      84. 
      
        
    84. 
          16
          
                  bvs
        
      85. 
      
        
    85. 
          
          
                end
        
      86. 
      
        
    86. 
          
          
              end
        
      87. 
      
        
    87. 
          
          
          
        
      88. 
      
        
    88. 
          1
          
              attr_reader :bind_map, :query_builder
        
      89. 
      
        
    89. 
          
          
          
        
      90. 
      
        
    90. 
          1
          
              def self.create(connection, block = Proc.new)
        
      91. 
      
        
    91. 
          4
          
                relation      = block.call Params.new
        
      92. 
      
        
    92. 
          4
          
                bind_map      = BindMap.new relation.bind_values
        
      93. 
      
        
    93. 
          4
          
                query_builder = connection.cacheable_query relation.arel
        
      94. 
      
        
    94. 
          4
          
                new query_builder, bind_map
        
      95. 
      
        
    95. 
          
          
              end
        
      96. 
      
        
    96. 
          
          
          
        
      97. 
      
        
    97. 
          1
          
              def initialize(query_builder, bind_map)
        
      98. 
      
        
    98. 
          4
          
                @query_builder = query_builder
        
      99. 
      
        
    99. 
          4
          
                @bind_map      = bind_map
        
      100. 
      
        
    100. 
          
          
              end
        
      101. 
      
        
    101. 
          
          
          
        
      102. 
      
        
    102. 
          1
          
              def execute(params, klass, connection)
        
      103. 
      
        
    103. 
          16
          
                bind_values = bind_map.bind params
        
      104. 
      
        
    104. 
          
          
          
        
      105. 
      
        
    105. 
          16
          
                sql = query_builder.sql_for bind_values, connection
        
      106. 
      
        
    106. 
          
          
          
        
      107. 
      
        
    107. 
          16
          
                klass.find_by_sql sql, bind_values
        
      108. 
      
        
    108. 
          
          
              end
        
      109. 
      
        
    109. 
          1
          
              alias :call :execute
        
      110. 
      
        
    110. 
          
          
            end
        
      111. 
      
        
    111. 
          
          
          end
        
      112.

          # encoding: utf-8
