          1
          
          module ActiveSupport #:nodoc:
        
      8. 
      
        
    8. 
          1
          
            module Multibyte #:nodoc:
        
      9. 
      
        
    9. 
          
          
              # Chars enables you to work transparently with UTF-8 encoding in the Ruby
        
      10. 
      
        
    10. 
          
          
              # String class without having extensive knowledge about the encoding. A
        
      11. 
      
        
    11. 
          
          
              # Chars object accepts a string upon initialization and proxies String
        
      12. 
      
        
    12. 
          
          
              # methods in an encoding safe manner. All the normal String methods are also
        
      13. 
      
        
    13. 
          
          
              # implemented on the proxy.
        
      14. 
      
        
    14. 
          
          
              #
        
      15. 
      
        
    15. 
          
          
              # String methods are proxied through the Chars object, and can be accessed
        
      16. 
      
        
    16. 
          
          
              # through the +mb_chars+ method. Methods which would normally return a
        
      17. 
      
        
    17. 
          
          
              # String object now return a Chars object so methods can be chained.
        
      18. 
      
        
    18. 
          
          
              #
        
      19. 
      
        
    19. 
          
          
              #   'The Perfect String  '.mb_chars.downcase.strip.normalize # => "the perfect string"
        
      20. 
      
        
    20. 
          
          
              #
        
      21. 
      
        
    21. 
          
          
              # Chars objects are perfectly interchangeable with String objects as long as
        
      22. 
      
        
    22. 
          
          
              # no explicit class checks are made. If certain methods do explicitly check
        
      23. 
      
        
    23. 
          
          
              # the class, call +to_s+ before you pass chars objects to them.
        
      24. 
      
        
    24. 
          
          
              #
        
      25. 
      
        
    25. 
          
          
              #   bad.explicit_checking_method 'T'.mb_chars.downcase.to_s
        
      26. 
      
        
    26. 
          
          
              #
        
      27. 
      
        
    27. 
          
          
              # The default Chars implementation assumes that the encoding of the string
        
      28. 
      
        
    28. 
          
          
              # is UTF-8, if you want to handle different encodings you can write your own
        
      29. 
      
        
    29. 
          
          
              # multibyte string handler and configure it through
        
      30. 
      
        
    30. 
          
          
              # ActiveSupport::Multibyte.proxy_class.
        
      31. 
      
        
    31. 
          
          
              #
        
      32. 
      
        
    32. 
          
          
              #   class CharsForUTF32
        
      33. 
      
        
    33. 
          
          
              #     def size
        
      34. 
      
        
    34. 
          
          
              #       @wrapped_string.size / 4
        
      35. 
      
        
    35. 
          
          
              #     end
        
      36. 
      
        
    36. 
          
          
              #
        
      37. 
      
        
    37. 
          
          
              #     def self.accepts?(string)
        
      38. 
      
        
    38. 
          
          
              #       string.length % 4 == 0
        
      39. 
      
        
    39. 
          
          
              #     end
        
      40. 
      
        
    40. 
          
          
              #   end
        
      41. 
      
        
    41. 
          
          
              #
        
      42. 
      
        
    42. 
          
          
              #   ActiveSupport::Multibyte.proxy_class = CharsForUTF32
        
      43. 
      
        
    43. 
          1
          
              class Chars
        
      44. 
      
        
    44. 
          1
          
                include Comparable
        
      45. 
      
        
    45. 
          1
          
                attr_reader :wrapped_string
        
      46. 
      
        
    46. 
          1
          
                alias to_s wrapped_string
        
      47. 
      
        
    47. 
          1
          
                alias to_str wrapped_string
        
      48. 
      
        
    48. 
          
          
          
        
      49. 
      
        
    49. 
          1
          
                delegate :<=>, :=~, :acts_like_string?, :to => :wrapped_string
        
      50. 
      
        
    50. 
          
          
          
        
      51. 
      
        
    51. 
          
          
                # Creates a new Chars instance by wrapping _string_.
        
      52. 
      
        
    52. 
          1
          
                def initialize(string)
        
      53. 
      
        
    53. 
          
          
                  @wrapped_string = string
        
      54. 
      
        
    54. 
          
          
                  @wrapped_string.force_encoding(Encoding::UTF_8) unless @wrapped_string.frozen?
        
      55. 
      
        
    55. 
          
          
                end
        
      56. 
      
        
    56. 
          
          
          
        
      57. 
      
        
    57. 
          
          
                # Forward all undefined methods to the wrapped string.
        
      58. 
      
        
    58. 
          1
          
                def method_missing(method, *args, &block)
        
      59. 
      
        
    59. 
          
          
                  result = @wrapped_string.__send__(method, *args, &block)
        
      60. 
      
        
    60. 
          
          
                  if method.to_s =~ /!$/
        
      61. 
      
        
    61. 
          
          
                    self if result
        
      62. 
      
        
    62. 
          
          
                  else
        
      63. 
      
        
    63. 
          
          
                    result.kind_of?(String) ? chars(result) : result
        
      64. 
      
        
    64. 
          
          
                  end
        
      65. 
      
        
    65. 
          
          
                end
        
      66. 
      
        
    66. 
          
          
          
        
      67. 
      
        
    67. 
          
          
                # Returns +true+ if _obj_ responds to the given method. Private methods
        
      68. 
      
        
    68. 
          
          
                # are included in the search only if the optional second parameter
        
      69. 
      
        
    69. 
          
          
                # evaluates to +true+.
        
      70. 
      
        
    70. 
          1
          
                def respond_to_missing?(method, include_private)
        
      71. 
      
        
    71. 
          
          
                  @wrapped_string.respond_to?(method, include_private)
        
      72. 
      
        
    72. 
          
          
                end
        
      73. 
      
        
    73. 
          
          
          
        
      74. 
      
        
    74. 
          
          
                # Returns +true+ when the proxy class can handle the string. Returns
        
      75. 
      
        
    75. 
          
          
                # +false+ otherwise.
        
      76. 
      
        
    76. 
          1
          
                def self.consumes?(string)
        
      77. 
      
        
    77. 
          
          
                  string.encoding == Encoding::UTF_8
        
      78. 
      
        
    78. 
          
          
                end
        
      79. 
      
        
    79. 
          
          
          
        
      80. 
      
        
    80. 
          
          
                # Works just like <tt>String#split</tt>, with the exception that the items
        
      81. 
      
        
    81. 
          
          
                # in the resulting list are Chars instances instead of String. This makes
        
      82. 
      
        
    82. 
          
          
                # chaining methods easier.
        
      83. 
      
        
    83. 
          
          
                #
        
      84. 
      
        
    84. 
          
          
                #   'Café périferôl'.mb_chars.split(/é/).map { |part| part.upcase.to_s } # => ["CAF", " P", "RIFERÔL"]
        
      85. 
      
        
    85. 
          1
          
                def split(*args)
        
      86. 
      
        
    86. 
          
          
                  @wrapped_string.split(*args).map { |i| self.class.new(i) }
        
      87. 
      
        
    87. 
          
          
                end
        
      88. 
      
        
    88. 
          
          
          
        
      89. 
      
        
    89. 
          
          
                # Works like <tt>String#slice!</tt>, but returns an instance of
        
      90. 
      
        
    90. 
          
          
                # Chars, or nil if the string was not modified.
        
      91. 
      
        
    91. 
          1
          
                def slice!(*args)
        
      92. 
      
        
    92. 
          
          
                  chars(@wrapped_string.slice!(*args))
        
      93. 
      
        
    93. 
          
          
                end
        
      94. 
      
        
    94. 
          
          
          
        
      95. 
      
        
    95. 
          
          
                # Reverses all characters in the string.
        
      96. 
      
        
    96. 
          
          
                #
        
      97. 
      
        
    97. 
          
          
                #   'Café'.mb_chars.reverse.to_s # => 'éfaC'
        
      98. 
      
        
    98. 
          1
          
                def reverse
        
      99. 
      
        
    99. 
          
          
                  chars(Unicode.unpack_graphemes(@wrapped_string).reverse.flatten.pack('U*'))
        
      100. 
      
        
    100. 
          
          
                end
        
      101. 
      
        
    101. 
          
          
          
        
      102. 
      
        
    102. 
          
          
                # Limits the byte size of the string to a number of bytes without breaking
        
      103. 
      
        
    103. 
          
          
                # characters. Usable when the storage for a string is limited for some
        
      104. 
      
        
    104. 
          
          
                # reason.
        
      105. 
      
        
    105. 
          
          
                #
        
      106. 
      
        
    106. 
          
          
                #   'こんにちは'.mb_chars.limit(7).to_s # => "こん"
        
      107. 
      
        
    107. 
          1
          
                def limit(limit)
        
      108. 
      
        
    108. 
          
          
                  slice(0...translate_offset(limit))
        
      109. 
      
        
    109. 
          
          
                end
        
      110. 
      
        
    110. 
          
          
          
        
      111. 
      
        
    111. 
          
          
                # Converts characters in the string to uppercase.
        
      112. 
      
        
    112. 
          
          
                #
        
      113. 
      
        
    113. 
          
          
                #   'Laurent, où sont les tests ?'.mb_chars.upcase.to_s # => "LAURENT, OÙ SONT LES TESTS ?"
        
      114. 
      
        
    114. 
          1
          
                def upcase
        
      115. 
      
        
    115. 
          
          
                  chars Unicode.upcase(@wrapped_string)
        
      116. 
      
        
    116. 
          
          
                end
        
      117. 
      
        
    117. 
          
          
          
        
      118. 
      
        
    118. 
          
          
                # Converts characters in the string to lowercase.
        
      119. 
      
        
    119. 
          
          
                #
        
      120. 
      
        
    120. 
          
          
                #   'VĚDA A VÝZKUM'.mb_chars.downcase.to_s # => "věda a výzkum"
        
      121. 
      
        
    121. 
          1
          
                def downcase
        
      122. 
      
        
    122. 
          
          
                  chars Unicode.downcase(@wrapped_string)
        
      123. 
      
        
    123. 
          
          
                end
        
      124. 
      
        
    124. 
          
          
          
        
      125. 
      
        
    125. 
          
          
                # Converts characters in the string to the opposite case.
        
      126. 
      
        
    126. 
          
          
                #
        
      127. 
      
        
    127. 
          
          
                #    'El Cañón".mb_chars.swapcase.to_s # => "eL cAÑÓN"
        
      128. 
      
        
    128. 
          1
          
                def swapcase
        
      129. 
      
        
    129. 
          
          
                  chars Unicode.swapcase(@wrapped_string)
        
      130. 
      
        
    130. 
          
          
                end
        
      131. 
      
        
    131. 
          
          
          
        
      132. 
      
        
    132. 
          
          
                # Converts the first character to uppercase and the remainder to lowercase.
        
      133. 
      
        
    133. 
          
          
                #
        
      134. 
      
        
    134. 
          
          
                #  'über'.mb_chars.capitalize.to_s # => "Über"
        
      135. 
      
        
    135. 
          1
          
                def capitalize
        
      136. 
      
        
    136. 
          
          
                  (slice(0) || chars('')).upcase + (slice(1..-1) || chars('')).downcase
        
      137. 
      
        
    137. 
          
          
                end
        
      138. 
      
        
    138. 
          
          
          
        
      139. 
      
        
    139. 
          
          
                # Capitalizes the first letter of every word, when possible.
        
      140. 
      
        
    140. 
          
          
                #
        
      141. 
      
        
    141. 
          
          
                #   "ÉL QUE SE ENTERÓ".mb_chars.titleize    # => "Él Que Se Enteró"
        
      142. 
      
        
    142. 
          
          
                #   "日本語".mb_chars.titleize                 # => "日本語"
        
      143. 
      
        
    143. 
          1
          
                def titleize
        
      144. 
      
        
    144. 
          
          
                  chars(downcase.to_s.gsub(/\b('?\S)/u) { Unicode.upcase($1)})
        
      145. 
      
        
    145. 
          
          
                end
        
      146. 
      
        
    146. 
          1
          
                alias_method :titlecase, :titleize
        
      147. 
      
        
    147. 
          
          
          
        
      148. 
      
        
    148. 
          
          
                # Returns the KC normalization of the string by default. NFKC is
        
      149. 
      
        
    149. 
          
          
                # considered the best normalization form for passing strings to databases
        
      150. 
      
        
    150. 
          
          
                # and validations.
        
      151. 
      
        
    151. 
          
          
                #
        
      152. 
      
        
    152. 
          
          
                # * <tt>form</tt> - The form you want to normalize in. Should be one of the following:
        
      153. 
      
        
    153. 
          
          
                #   <tt>:c</tt>, <tt>:kc</tt>, <tt>:d</tt>, or <tt>:kd</tt>. Default is
        
      154. 
      
        
    154. 
          
          
                #   ActiveSupport::Multibyte::Unicode.default_normalization_form
        
      155. 
      
        
    155. 
          1
          
                def normalize(form = nil)
        
      156. 
      
        
    156. 
          
          
                  chars(Unicode.normalize(@wrapped_string, form))
        
      157. 
      
        
    157. 
          
          
                end
        
      158. 
      
        
    158. 
          
          
          
        
      159. 
      
        
    159. 
          
          
                # Performs canonical decomposition on all the characters.
        
      160. 
      
        
    160. 
          
          
                #
        
      161. 
      
        
    161. 
          
          
                #   'é'.length                         # => 2
        
      162. 
      
        
    162. 
          
          
                #   'é'.mb_chars.decompose.to_s.length # => 3
        
      163. 
      
        
    163. 
          1
          
                def decompose
        
      164. 
      
        
    164. 
          
          
                  chars(Unicode.decompose(:canonical, @wrapped_string.codepoints.to_a).pack('U*'))
        
      165. 
      
        
    165. 
          
          
                end
        
      166. 
      
        
    166. 
          
          
          
        
      167. 
      
        
    167. 
          
          
                # Performs composition on all the characters.
        
      168. 
      
        
    168. 
          
          
                #
        
      169. 
      
        
    169. 
          
          
                #   'é'.length                       # => 3
        
      170. 
      
        
    170. 
          
          
                #   'é'.mb_chars.compose.to_s.length # => 2
        
      171. 
      
        
    171. 
          1
          
                def compose
        
      172. 
      
        
    172. 
          
          
                  chars(Unicode.compose(@wrapped_string.codepoints.to_a).pack('U*'))
        
      173. 
      
        
    173. 
          
          
                end
        
      174. 
      
        
    174. 
          
          
          
        
      175. 
      
        
    175. 
          
          
                # Returns the number of grapheme clusters in the string.
        
      176. 
      
        
    176. 
          
          
                #
        
      177. 
      
        
    177. 
          
          
                #   'क्षि'.mb_chars.length   # => 4
        
      178. 
      
        
    178. 
          
          
                #   'क्षि'.mb_chars.grapheme_length # => 3
        
      179. 
      
        
    179. 
          1
          
                def grapheme_length
        
      180. 
      
        
    180. 
          
          
                  Unicode.unpack_graphemes(@wrapped_string).length
        
      181. 
      
        
    181. 
          
          
                end
        
      182. 
      
        
    182. 
          
          
          
        
      183. 
      
        
    183. 
          
          
                # Replaces all ISO-8859-1 or CP1252 characters by their UTF-8 equivalent
        
      184. 
      
        
    184. 
          
          
                # resulting in a valid UTF-8 string.
        
      185. 
      
        
    185. 
          
          
                #
        
      186. 
      
        
    186. 
          
          
                # Passing +true+ will forcibly tidy all bytes, assuming that the string's
        
      187. 
      
        
    187. 
          
          
                # encoding is entirely CP1252 or ISO-8859-1.
        
      188. 
      
        
    188. 
          1
          
                def tidy_bytes(force = false)
        
      189. 
      
        
    189. 
          
          
                  chars(Unicode.tidy_bytes(@wrapped_string, force))
        
      190. 
      
        
    190. 
          
          
                end
        
      191. 
      
        
    191. 
          
          
          
        
      192. 
      
        
    192. 
          1
          
                def as_json(options = nil) #:nodoc:
        
      193. 
      
        
    193. 
          
          
                  to_s.as_json(options)
        
      194. 
      
        
    194. 
          
          
                end
        
      195. 
      
        
    195. 
          
          
          
        
      196. 
      
        
    196. 
          1
          
                %w(capitalize downcase reverse tidy_bytes upcase).each do |method|
        
      197. 
      
        
    197. 
          5
          
                  define_method("#{method}!") do |*args|
        
      198. 
      
        
    198. 
          
          
                    @wrapped_string = send(method, *args).to_s
        
      199. 
      
        
    199. 
          
          
                    self
        
      200. 
      
        
    200. 
          
          
                  end
        
      201. 
      
        
    201. 
          
          
                end
        
      202. 
      
        
    202. 
          
          
          
        
      203. 
      
        
    203. 
          1
          
                protected
        
      204. 
      
        
    204. 
          
          
          
        
      205. 
      
        
    205. 
          1
          
                  def translate_offset(byte_offset) #:nodoc:
        
      206. 
      
        
    206. 
          
          
                    return nil if byte_offset.nil?
        
      207. 
      
        
    207. 
          
          
                    return 0   if @wrapped_string == ''
        
      208. 
      
        
    208. 
          
          
          
        
      209. 
      
        
    209. 
          
          
                    begin
        
      210. 
      
        
    210. 
          
          
                      @wrapped_string.byteslice(0...byte_offset).unpack('U*').length
        
      211. 
      
        
    211. 
          
          
                    rescue ArgumentError
        
      212. 
      
        
    212. 
          
          
                      byte_offset -= 1
        
      213. 
      
        
    213. 
          
          
                      retry
        
      214. 
      
        
    214. 
          
          
                    end
        
      215. 
      
        
    215. 
          
          
                  end
        
      216. 
      
        
    216. 
          
          
          
        
      217. 
      
        
    217. 
          1

      218. 
      
        
    218. 
          
          
                    self.class.new(string)
        
      219. 
      
        
    219. 
          
          
                  end
        
      220. 
      
        
    220. 
          
          
              end
        
      221. 
      
        
    221.

                # plain Ruby (*.rb) or YAML files (*.yml). See #load_rb and #load_yml
        
      12. 
      
        
    12. 
          
          
                # for details.
        
      13. 
      
        
    13. 
          1
          
                def load_translations(*filenames)
        
      14. 
      
        
    14. 
          1
          
                  filenames = I18n.load_path if filenames.empty?
        
      15. 
      
        
    15. 
          42

          1
          
                def translate(locale, key, options = {})
        
      25. 
      
        
    25. 
          70
          
                  raise InvalidLocale.new(locale) unless locale
        
      26. 
      
        
    26. 
          70
          
                  entry = key && lookup(locale, key, options[:scope], options)
        
      27. 
      
        
    27. 
          
          
          
        
      28. 
      
        
    28. 
          70
          
                  if options.empty?
        
      29. 
      
        
    29. 
          38
          
                    entry = resolve(locale, key, entry, options)
        
      30. 
      
        
    30. 
          
          
                  else
        
      31. 
      
        
    31. 
          32
          
                    count, default = options.values_at(:count, :default)
        
      32. 
      
        
    32. 
          32
          
                    values = options.except(*RESERVED_KEYS)
        
      33. 
      
        
    33. 
          32
          
                    entry = entry.nil? && default ?
        
      34. 
      
        
    34. 
          
          
                      default(locale, key, default, options) : resolve(locale, key, entry, options)
        
      35. 
      
        
    35. 
          
          
                  end
        
      36. 
      
        
    36. 
          
          
          
        
      37. 
      
        
    37. 
          70
          
                  throw(:exception, I18n::MissingTranslation.new(locale, key, options)) if entry.nil?
        
      38. 
      
        
    38. 
          54
          
                  entry = entry.dup if entry.is_a?(String)
        
      39. 
      
        
    39. 
          
          
          
        
      40. 
      
        
    40. 
          54
          
                  entry = pluralize(locale, entry, count) if count
        
      41. 
      
        
    41. 
          54
          
                  entry = interpolate(locale, entry, values) if values
        
      42. 
      
        
    42. 
          54
          
                  entry
        
      43. 
      
        
    43. 
          
          
                end
        
      44.

      45.

                def exists?(locale, key)

                  lookup(locale, key) != nil
        
      47.

                end
        
      48.

      49. 
      
        
    49. 
          
          
                # Acts the same as +strftime+, but uses a localized version of the
        
      50. 
      
        
    50. 
          
          
                # format string. Takes a key from the date/time formats translations as
        
      51. 
      
        
    51. 
          
          
                # a format argument (<em>e.g.</em>, <tt>:short</tt> in <tt>:'date.formats'</tt>).
        
      52. 
      
        
    52. 
          1
          
                def localize(locale, object, format = :default, options = {})
        
      53. 
      
        
    53. 
          
          
                  raise ArgumentError, "Object must be a Date, DateTime or Time object. #{object.inspect} given." unless object.respond_to?(:strftime)
        
      54. 
      
        
    54. 
          
          
          
        
      55. 
      
        
    55. 
          
          
                  if Symbol === format
        
      56. 
      
        
    56. 
          
          
                    key  = format
        
      57. 
      
        
    57. 
          
          
                    type = object.respond_to?(:sec) ? 'time' : 'date'
        
      58. 
      
        
    58. 
          
          
                    options = options.merge(:raise => true, :object => object, :locale => locale)
        
      59. 
      
        
    59. 
          
          
                    format  = I18n.t(:"#{type}.formats.#{key}", options)
        
      60. 
      
        
    60. 
          
          
                  end
        
      61. 
      
        
    61. 
          
          
          
        
      62. 
      
        
    62. 
          
          
                  # format = resolve(locale, object, format, options)
        
      63. 
      
        
    63. 
          
          
                  format = format.to_s.gsub(/%[aAbBpP]/) do |match|
        
      64. 
      
        
    64. 
          
          
                    case match
        
      65. 
      
        
    65. 
          
          
                    when '%a' then I18n.t(:"date.abbr_day_names",                  :locale => locale, :format => format)[object.wday]
        
      66. 
      
        
    66. 
          
          
                    when '%A' then I18n.t(:"date.day_names",                       :locale => locale, :format => format)[object.wday]
        
      67. 
      
        
    67. 
          
          
                    when '%b' then I18n.t(:"date.abbr_month_names",                :locale => locale, :format => format)[object.mon]
        
      68. 
      
        
    68. 
          
          
                    when '%B' then I18n.t(:"date.month_names",                     :locale => locale, :format => format)[object.mon]
        
      69. 
      
        
    69. 
          
          
                    when '%p' then I18n.t(:"time.#{object.hour < 12 ? :am : :pm}", :locale => locale, :format => format).upcase if object.respond_to? :hour
        
      70. 
      
        
    70. 
          
          
                    when '%P' then I18n.t(:"time.#{object.hour < 12 ? :am : :pm}", :locale => locale, :format => format).downcase if object.respond_to? :hour
        
      71. 
      
        
    71. 
          
          
                    end
        
      72. 
      
        
    72. 
          
          
                  end
        
      73. 
      
        
    73. 
          
          
          
        
      74. 
      
        
    74. 
          
          
                  object.strftime(format)
        
      75. 
      
        
    75. 
          
          
                end
        
      76. 
      
        
    76. 
          
          
          
        
      77.

                  # The method which actually looks up for the translation in the store.

      92.

                  # Evaluates defaults.
        
      94. 
      
        
    94. 
          
          
                  # If given subject is an Array, it walks the array and returns the
        
      95. 
      
        
    95. 
          
          
                  # first translation that can be resolved. Otherwise it tries to resolve
        
      96. 
      
        
    96. 
          
          
                  # the translation directly.
        
      97. 
      
        
    97. 
          1
          
                  def default(locale, object, subject, options = {})
        
      98. 
      
        
    98. 
          48
          
                    options = options.dup.reject { |key, value| key == :default }
        
      99. 
      
        
    99. 
          12
          
                    case subject
        
      100. 
      
        
    100. 
          
          
                    when Array
        
      101. 
      
        
    101. 
          
          
                      subject.each do |item|
        
      102. 
      
        
    102. 
          28
          
                        result = resolve(locale, object, item, options) and return result
        
      103. 
      
        
    103. 
          12
          
                      end and nil
        
      104. 
      
        
    104. 
          
          
                    else
        
      105. 
      
        
    105. 
          
          
                      resolve(locale, object, subject, options)
        
      106. 
      
        
    106. 
          
          
                    end
        
      107. 
      
        
    107. 
          
          
                  end
        
      108. 
      
        
    108. 
          
          
          
        
      109. 
      
        
    109. 
          
          
                  # Resolves a translation.
        
      110. 
      
        
    110. 
          
          
                  # If the given subject is a Symbol, it will be translated with the
        
      111. 
      
        
    111. 
          
          
                  # given options. If it is a Proc then it will be evaluated. All other
        
      112. 
      
        
    112. 
          
          
                  # subjects will be returned directly.
        
      113. 
      
        
    113. 
          1
          
                  def resolve(locale, object, subject, options = {})
        
      114. 
      
        
    114. 
          86
          
                    return subject if options[:resolve] == false
        
      115. 
      
        
    115. 
          86
          
                    result = catch(:exception) do
        
      116. 
      
        
    116. 
          86
          
                      case subject
        
      117. 
      
        
    117. 
          
          
                      when Symbol
        
      118. 
      
        
    118. 
          20
          
                        I18n.translate(subject, options.merge(:locale => locale, :throw => true))
        
      119. 
      
        
    119. 
          
          
                      when Proc
        
      120. 
      
        
    120. 
          
          
                        date_or_time = options.delete(:object) || object
        
      121. 
      
        
    121. 
          
          
                        resolve(locale, object, subject.call(date_or_time, options))
        
      122. 
      
        
    122. 
          
          
                      else
        
      123. 
      
        
    123. 
          66
          
                        subject
        
      124. 
      
        
    124. 
          
          
                      end
        
      125. 
      
        
    125. 
          
          
                    end
        
      126. 
      
        
    126. 
          86
          
                    result unless result.is_a?(MissingTranslation)
        
      127. 
      
        
    127. 
          
          
                  end
        
      128. 
      
        
    128. 
          
          
          
        
      129. 
      
        
    129. 
          
          
                  # Picks a translation from a pluralized mnemonic subkey according to English
        
      130. 
      
        
    130. 
          
          
                  # pluralization rules :
        
      131. 
      
        
    131. 
          
          
                  # - It will pick the :one subkey if count is equal to 1.
        
      132. 
      
        
    132. 
          
          
                  # - It will pick the :other subkey otherwise.
        
      133. 
      
        
    133. 
          
          
                  # - It will pick the :zero subkey in the special case where count is
        
      134. 
      
        
    134. 
          
          
                  #   equal to 0 and there is a :zero subkey present. This behaviour is
        
      135. 
      
        
    135. 
          
          
                  #   not stand with regards to the CLDR pluralization rules.
        
      136. 
      
        
    136. 
          
          
                  # Other backends can implement more flexible or complex pluralization rules.
        
      137. 
      
        
    137. 
          1
          
                  def pluralize(locale, entry, count)
        
      138. 
      
        
    138. 
          8
          
                    return entry unless entry.is_a?(Hash) && count
        
      139. 
      
        
    139. 
          
          
          
        
      140. 
      
        
    140. 
          
          
                    key = :zero if count == 0 && entry.has_key?(:zero)
        
      141. 
      
        
    141. 
          
          
                    key ||= count == 1 ? :one : :other
        
      142. 
      
        
    142. 
          
          
                    raise InvalidPluralizationData.new(entry, count) unless entry.has_key?(key)
        
      143. 
      
        
    143. 
          
          
                    entry[key]
        
      144. 
      
        
    144. 
          
          
                  end
        
      145. 
      
        
    145. 
          
          
          
        
      146. 
      
        
    146. 
          
          
                  # Interpolates values into a given string.
        
      147. 
      
        
    147. 
          
          
                  #
        
      148. 
      
        
    148. 
          
          
                  #   interpolate "file %{file} opened by %%{user}", :file => 'test.txt', :user => 'Mr. X'
        
      149. 
      
        
    149. 
          
          
                  #   # => "file test.txt opened by %{user}"
        
      150. 
      
        
    150. 
          1
          
                  def interpolate(locale, string, values = {})
        
      151. 
      
        
    151. 
          16
          
                    if string.is_a?(::String) && !values.empty?
        
      152. 
      
        
    152. 
          16
          
                      I18n.interpolate(string, values)
        
      153. 
      
        
    153. 
          
          
                    else
        
      154. 
      
        
    154. 
          
          
                      string
        
      155. 
      
        
    155. 
          
          
                    end
        
      156. 
      
        
    156. 
          
          
                  end
        
      157. 
      
        
    157. 
          
          
          
        
      158. 
      
        
    158. 
          
          
                  # Loads a single translations file by delegating to #load_rb or
        
      159. 
      
        
    159. 
          
          
                  # #load_yml depending on the file extension and directly merges the
        
      160. 
      
        
    160. 
          
          
                  # data to the existing translations. Raises I18n::UnknownFileType
        
      161. 
      
        
    161. 
          
          
                  # for all other file extensions.
        
      162. 
      
        
    162. 
          1
          
                  def load_file(filename)
        
      163. 
      
        
    163. 
          41
          
                    type = File.extname(filename).tr('.', '').downcase
        
      164. 
      
        
    164. 
          41
          
                    raise UnknownFileType.new(type, filename) unless respond_to?(:"load_#{type}", true)
        
      165. 
      
        
    165. 
          41
          
                    data = send(:"load_#{type}", filename)
        
      166. 
      
        
    166. 
          41
          
                    unless data.is_a?(Hash)
        
      167. 
      
        
    167. 
          
          
                      raise InvalidLocaleData.new(filename, 'expects it to return a hash, but does not')
        
      168. 
      
        
    168. 
          
          
                    end
        
      169. 
      
        
    169. 
          82
          
                    data.each { |locale, d| store_translations(locale, d || {}) }
        
      170. 
      
        
    170. 
          
          
                  end
        
      171. 
      
        
    171. 
          
          
          
        
      172. 
      
        
    172. 
          
          
                  # Loads a plain Ruby translations file. eval'ing the file must yield
        
      173. 
      
        
    173. 
          
          
                  # a Hash containing translation data with locales as toplevel keys.
        
      174. 
      
        
    174. 
          1
          
                  def load_rb(filename)
        
      175. 
      
        
    175. 
          
          
                    eval(IO.read(filename), binding, filename)
        
      176. 
      
        
    176. 
          
          
                  end
        
      177. 
      
        
    177. 
          
          
          
        
      178. 
      
        
    178. 
          
          
                  # Loads a YAML translations file. The data must have locales as
        
      179. 
      
        
    179. 
          
          
                  # toplevel keys.
        
      180. 
      
        
    180. 
          1
          
                  def load_yml(filename)
        
      181. 
      
        
    181. 
          41
          
                    begin
        
      182. 
      
        
    182. 
          41
          
                      YAML.load_file(filename)
        
      183. 
      
        
    183. 
          
          
                    rescue TypeError, ScriptError, StandardError => e
        
      184. 
      
        
    184. 
          
          
                      raise InvalidLocaleData.new(filename, e.inspect)
        
      185. 
      
        
    185. 
          
          
                    end
        
      186. 
      
        
    186. 
          
          
                  end
        
      187. 
      
        
    187. 
          
          
              end
        
      188. 
      
        
    188. 
          
          
            end
        
      189. 
      
        
    189. 
          
          
          end

          module I18n

          1
          
            module Backend
        
      3. 
      
        
    3. 
          
          
              # A simple backend that reads translations from YAML files and stores them in
        
      4. 
      
        
    4. 
          
          
              # an in-memory hash. Relies on the Base backend.
        
      5. 
      
        
    5. 
          
          
              #
        
      6. 
      
        
    6. 
          
          
              # The implementation is provided by a Implementation module allowing to easily
        
      7. 
      
        
    7. 
          
          
              # extend Simple backend's behavior by including modules. E.g.:
        
      8. 
      
        
    8. 
          
          
              #
        
      9. 
      
        
    9. 
          
          
              # module I18n::Backend::Pluralization

    13.

      27. 
      
        
    27. 
          
          
                  # Stores translations for the given locale in memory.
        
      28. 
      
        
    28. 
          
          
                  # This uses a deep merge for the translations hash, so existing
        
      29. 
      
        
    29. 
          
          
                  # translations will be overwritten by new ones only at the deepest
        
      30. 
      
        
    30. 
          
          
                  # level of the hash.
        
      31. 
      
        
    31. 
          1
          
                  def store_translations(locale, data, options = {})
        
      32. 
      
        
    32. 
          41
          
                    locale = locale.to_sym
        
      33. 
      
        
    33. 
          41
          
                    translations[locale] ||= {}
        
      34. 
      
        
    34. 
          41
          
                    data = data.deep_symbolize_keys
        
      35. 
      
        
    35. 
          41
          
                    translations[locale].deep_merge!(data)
        
      36. 
      
        
    36. 
          
          
                  end
        
      37. 
      
        
    37. 
          
          
          
        
      38. 
      
        
    38. 
          
          
                  # Get available locales from the translations hash
        
      39. 
      
        
    39. 
          1
          
                  def available_locales
        
      40. 
      
        
    40. 
          1
          
                    init_translations unless initialized?

    41. 
          1
          
                    translations.inject([]) do |locales, (locale, data)|
        
      42. 
      
        
    42. 
          38

      43.

      44.

                    end
        
      45.

      46.

      47.

                  # Clean up translations hash and set initialized to false on reload!
        
      48.

          1
          
                  def reload!

    49. 
          
          
                    @initialized = false
        
      50. 
      
        
    50. 
          
          
                    @translations = nil
        
      51. 
      
        
    51. 
          
          
                    super
        
      52. 
      
        
    52. 
          
          
                  end
        
      53.

      59.

      60.

      61.

                  def translations
        
      62. 
      
        
    62. 
          153
          
                    @translations ||= {}
        
      63. 
      
        
    63. 
          
          
                  end
        
      64. 
      
        
    64. 
          
          
          
        
      65. 
      
        
    65. 
          
          
                  # Looks up a translation from the translations hash. Returns nil if
        
      66. 
      
        
    66. 
          
          
                  # eiher key is nil, or locale, scope or key do not exist as a key in the
        
      67. 
      
        
    67. 
          
          
                  # nested translations hash. Splits keys or scopes containing dots
        
      68. 
      
        
    68. 
          
          
                  # into multiple keys, i.e. <tt>currency.format</tt> is regarded the same as
        
      69. 
      
        
    69. 
          
          
                  # <tt>%w(currency format)</tt>.
        
      70. 
      
        
    70. 
          1
          
                  def lookup(locale, key, scope = [], options = {})
        
      71. 
      
        
    71. 
          70
          
                    init_translations unless initialized?
        
      72. 
      
        
    72. 
          70
          
                    keys = I18n.normalize_keys(locale, key, scope, options[:separator])
        
      73. 
      
        
    73. 
          
          
          
        
      74. 
      
        
    74. 
          70

          264

              def serving(env)

                if env["REQUEST_METHOD"] == "OPTIONS"

      62.

                end
        
      63.

                last_modified = F.mtime(@path).httpdate
        
      64.

      74. 
      
        
    74. 
          
          
                size = filesize
        
      75. 
      
        
    75. 
          
          
          
        
      76. 
      
        
    76. 
          
          
                ranges = Rack::Utils.byte_ranges(env, size)
        
      77. 
      
        
    77. 
          
          
                if ranges.nil? || ranges.length > 1
        
      78. 
      
        
    78. 
          
          
                  # No ranges, or multiple ranges (which we don't support):
        
      79. 
      
        
    79. 
          
          
                  # TODO: Support multiple byte-ranges
        
      80. 
      
        
    80. 
          
          
                  response[0] = 200
        
      81. 
      
        
    81. 
          
          
                  @range = 0..size-1
        
      82. 
      
        
    82. 
          
          
                elsif ranges.empty?
        
      83. 
      
        
    83. 
          
          
                  # Unsatisfiable. Return error, and file size:
        
      84. 
      
        
    84. 
          
          
                  response = fail(416, "Byte range unsatisfiable")
        
      85. 
      
        
    85. 
          
          
                  response[1]["Content-Range"] = "bytes */#{size}"
        
      86. 
      
        
    86. 
          
          
                  return response
        
      87. 
      
        
    87. 
          
          
                else
        
      88. 
      
        
    88. 
          
          
                  # Partial content:
        
      89. 
      
        
    89. 
          
          
                  @range = ranges[0]
        
      90. 
      
        
    90. 
          
          
                  response[0] = 206
        
      91. 
      
        
    91. 
          
          
                  response[1]["Content-Range"] = "bytes #{@range.begin}-#{@range.end}/#{size}"
        
      92. 
      
        
    92. 
          
          
                  size = @range.end - @range.begin + 1
        
      93. 
      
        
    93. 
          
          
                end
        
      94. 
      
        
    94. 
          
          
          
        
      95. 
      
        
    95. 
          
          
                response[2] = [response_body] unless response_body.nil?
        
      96. 
      
        
    96. 
          
          
          
        
      97. 
      
        
    97. 
          
          
                response[1][CONTENT_LENGTH] = size.to_s
        
      98. 
      
        
    98. 
          
          
                response
        
      99. 
      
        
    99. 
          
          
              end
        
      100. 
      
        
    100. 
          
          
          
        
      101. 
      
        
    101. 
          1
          
              def each
        
      102. 
      
        
    102. 
          
          
                F.open(@path, "rb") do |file|
        
      103. 
      
        
    103. 
          
          
                  file.seek(@range.begin)
        
      104. 
      
        
    104. 
          
          
                  remaining_len = @range.end-@range.begin+1
        
      105. 
      
        
    105. 
          
          
                  while remaining_len > 0
        
      106. 
      
        
    106. 
          
          
                    part = file.read([8192, remaining_len].min)
        
      107. 
      
        
    107. 
          
          
                    break unless part
        
      108. 
      
        
    108. 
          
          
                    remaining_len -= part.length
        
      109. 
      
        
    109. 
          
          
          
        
      110. 
      
        
    110. 
          
          
                    yield part
        
      111. 
      
        
    111. 
          
          
                  end
        
      112. 
      
        
    112. 
          
          
                end
        
      113. 
      
        
    113. 
          
          
              end
        
      114. 
      
        
    114. 
          
          
          
        
      115. 
      
        
    115. 
          1
          
              private
        
      116. 
      
        
    116. 
          
          
          
        
      117. 
      
        
    117. 
          1
          
              def fail(status, body, headers = {})
        
      118. 
      
        
    118. 
          
          
                body += "\n"
        
      119. 
      
        
    119. 
          
          
                [
        
      120. 
      
        
    120. 
          
          
                  status,
        
      121. 
      
        
    121. 
          
          
                  {
        
      122. 
      
        
    122. 
          
          
                    CONTENT_TYPE   => "text/plain",
        
      123. 
      
        
    123. 
          
          
                    CONTENT_LENGTH => body.size.to_s,
        
      124. 
      
        
    124. 
          
          
                    "X-Cascade" => "pass"
        
      125. 
      
        
    125. 
          
          
                  }.merge!(headers),
        
      126. 
      
        
    126. 
          
          
                  [body]
        
      127. 
      
        
    127. 
          
          
                ]
        
      128. 
      
        
    128. 
          
          
              end
        
      129. 
      
        
    129. 
          
          
          
        
      130. 
      
        
    130. 
          
          
              # The MIME type for the contents of the file located at @path
        
      131. 
      
        
    131. 
          1
          
              def mime_type
        
      132. 
      
        
    132. 
          
          
                Mime.mime_type(F.extname(@path), @default_mime)
        
      133. 
      
        
    133. 
          
          
              end
        
      134. 
      
        
    134. 
          
          
          
        
      135. 
      
        
    135. 
          1
          
              def filesize
        
      136. 
      
        
    136. 
          
          
                # If response_body is present, use its size.
        
      137. 
      
        
    137. 
          
          
                return Rack::Utils.bytesize(response_body) if response_body
        
      138. 
      
        
    138. 
          
          
          
        
      139. 
      
        
    139. 
          
          
                #   We check via File::size? whether this file provides size info
        
      140. 
      
        
    140. 
          
          
                #   via stat (e.g. /proc files often don't), otherwise we have to
        
      141. 
      
        
    141. 
          
          
                #   figure it out by reading the whole file into memory.
        
      142. 
      
        
    142. 
          
          
                F.size?(@path) || Utils.bytesize(F.read(@path))
        
      143. 
      
        
    143. 
          
          
              end
        
      144. 
      
        
    144. 
          
          
          
        
      145. 
      
        
    145. 
          
          
              # By default, the response body for file requests is nil.
        
      146. 
      
        
    146. 
          
          
              # In this case, the response body will be generated later
        
      147. 
      
        
    147. 
          
          
              # from the file at @path
        
      148. 
      
        
    148. 
          1
          
              def response_body
        
      149. 
      
        
    149. 
          
          
                nil
        
      150. 
      
        
    150. 
          
          
              end
        
      151. 
      
        
    151. 
          
          
            end
        
      152. 
      
        
    152. 
          
          
          end
        
      153.

          module Rack
        
      5. 
      
        
    5. 
          
          
            # Rack::Lint validates your application and the requests and
        
      6. 
      
        
    6. 
          
          
            # responses according to the Rack spec.
        
      7.

            class Lint
        
      9.

          1
          
              def initialize(app)
        
      10.

                @app = app

    11. 
          
          
                @content_length = nil

              end
        
      13. 
      
        
    13. 
          
          
          
        
      14. 
      
        
    14. 
          
          
              # :stopdoc:
        
      15.

              class LintError < RuntimeError; end
        
      17.

          1
          
              module Assertion

          1
          
                def assert(message, &block)
        
      19. 
      
        
    19. 
          
          
                  unless block.call
        
      20. 
      
        
    20. 
          
          
                    raise LintError, message

                  end

                end

      24. 
      
        
    24. 
          1
          
              include Assertion
        
      25. 
      
        
    25. 
          
          
          
        
      26. 
      
        
    26. 
          
          
              ## This specification aims to formalize the Rack protocol.  You
        
      27. 
      
        
    27. 
          
          
              ## can (and should) use Rack::Lint to enforce it.
        
      28. 
      
        
    28. 
          
          
              ##
        
      29. 
      
        
    29. 
          
          
              ## When you develop middleware, be sure to add a Lint before and
        
      30. 
      
        
    30. 
          
          
              ## after to catch all mistakes.
        
      31. 
      
        
    31. 
          
          
          
        
      32. 
      
        
    32. 
          
          
              ## = Rack applications
        
      33. 
      
        
    33. 
          
          
          
        
      34. 
      
        
    34. 
          
          
              ## A Rack application is a Ruby object (not a class) that
        
      35. 
      
        
    35. 
          
          
              ## responds to +call+.
        
      36. 
      
        
    36. 
          1
          
              def call(env=nil)
        
      37. 
      
        
    37. 
          
          
                dup._call(env)
        
      38. 
      
        
    38. 
          
          
              end
        
      39. 
      
        
    39. 
          
          
          
        
      40. 
      
        
    40. 
          1
          
              def _call(env)
        
      41. 
      
        
    41. 
          
          
                ## It takes exactly one argument, the *environment*
        
      42. 
      
        
    42. 
          
          
                assert("No env given") { env }
        
      43. 
      
        
    43. 
          
          
                check_env env
        
      44. 
      
        
    44. 
          
          
          
        
      45. 
      
        
    45. 
          
          
                env['rack.input'] = InputWrapper.new(env['rack.input'])
        
      46. 
      
        
    46. 
          
          
                env['rack.errors'] = ErrorWrapper.new(env['rack.errors'])
        
      47. 
      
        
    47. 
          
          
          
        
      48. 
      
        
    48. 
          
          
                ## and returns an Array of exactly three values:
        
      49. 
      
        
    49. 
          
          
                status, headers, @body = @app.call(env)
        
      50. 
      
        
    50. 
          
          
                ## The *status*,
        
      51. 
      
        
    51. 
          
          
                check_status status
        
      52. 
      
        
    52. 
          
          
                ## the *headers*,
        
      53. 
      
        
    53. 
          
          
                check_headers headers
        
      54. 
      
        
    54. 
          
          
          
        
      55. 
      
        
    55. 
          
          
                check_hijack_response headers, env
        
      56. 
      
        
    56. 
          
          
          
        
      57. 
      
        
    57. 
          
          
                ## and the *body*.
        
      58. 
      
        
    58. 
          
          
                check_content_type status, headers
        
      59. 
      
        
    59. 
          
          
                check_content_length status, headers
        
      60. 
      
        
    60. 
          
          
                @head_request = env[REQUEST_METHOD] == "HEAD"
        
      61. 
      
        
    61. 
          
          
                [status, headers, self]
        
      62. 
      
        
    62. 
          
          
              end
        
      63. 
      
        
    63. 
          
          
          
        
      64. 
      
        
    64. 
          
          
              ## == The Environment
        
      65. 
      
        
    65. 
          1
          
              def check_env(env)
        
      66. 
      
        
    66. 
          
          
                ## The environment must be an instance of Hash that includes
        
      67. 
      
        
    67. 
          
          
                ## CGI-like headers.  The application is free to modify the
        
      68. 
      
        
    68. 
          
          
                ## environment.
        
      69. 
      
        
    69. 
          
          
                assert("env #{env.inspect} is not a Hash, but #{env.class}") {
        
      70. 
      
        
    70. 
          
          
                  env.kind_of? Hash
        
      71. 
      
        
    71. 
          
          
                }
        
      72. 
      
        
    72. 
          
          
          
        
      73. 
      
        
    73. 
          
          
                ##
        
      74. 
      
        
    74. 
          
          
                ## The environment is required to include these variables
        
      75. 
      
        
    75. 
          
          
                ## (adopted from PEP333), except when they'd be empty, but see
        
      76. 
      
        
    76. 
          
          
                ## below.
        
      77. 
      
        
    77. 
          
          
          
        
      78. 
      
        
    78. 
          
          
                ## <tt>REQUEST_METHOD</tt>:: The HTTP request method, such as
        
      79. 
      
        
    79. 
          
          
                ##                           "GET" or "POST". This cannot ever
        
      80. 
      
        
    80. 
          
          
                ##                           be an empty string, and so is
        
      81. 
      
        
    81. 
          
          
                ##                           always required.
        
      82. 
      
        
    82. 
          
          
          
        
      83. 
      
        
    83. 
          
          
                ## <tt>SCRIPT_NAME</tt>:: The initial portion of the request
        
      84. 
      
        
    84. 
          
          
                ##                        URL's "path" that corresponds to the
        
      85. 
      
        
    85. 
          
          
                ##                        application object, so that the
        
      86. 
      
        
    86. 
          
          
                ##                        application knows its virtual
        
      87. 
      
        
    87. 
          
          
                ##                        "location". This may be an empty
        
      88. 
      
        
    88. 
          
          
                ##                        string, if the application corresponds
        
      89. 
      
        
    89. 
          
          
                ##                        to the "root" of the server.
        
      90. 
      
        
    90. 
          
          
          
        
      91. 
      
        
    91. 
          
          
                ## <tt>PATH_INFO</tt>:: The remainder of the request URL's
        
      92. 
      
        
    92. 
          
          
                ##                      "path", designating the virtual
        
      93. 
      
        
    93. 
          
          
                ##                      "location" of the request's target
        
      94. 
      
        
    94. 
          
          
                ##                      within the application. This may be an
        
      95. 
      
        
    95. 
          
          
                ##                      empty string, if the request URL targets
        
      96. 
      
        
    96. 
          
          
                ##                      the application root and does not have a
        
      97. 
      
        
    97. 
          
          
                ##                      trailing slash. This value may be
        
      98. 
      
        
    98. 
          
          
                ##                      percent-encoded when I originating from
        
      99. 
      
        
    99. 
          
          
                ##                      a URL.
        
      100. 
      
        
    100. 
          
          
          
        
      101. 
      
        
    101. 
          
          
                ## <tt>QUERY_STRING</tt>:: The portion of the request URL that
        
      102. 
      
        
    102. 
          
          
                ##                         follows the <tt>?</tt>, if any. May be
        
      103. 
      
        
    103. 
          
          
                ##                         empty, but is always required!
        
      104. 
      
        
    104. 
          
          
          
        
      105. 
      
        
    105. 
          
          
                ## <tt>SERVER_NAME</tt>, <tt>SERVER_PORT</tt>::
        
      106. 
      
        
    106. 
          
          
                ##                        When combined with <tt>SCRIPT_NAME</tt> and
        
      107. 
      
        
    107. 
          
          
                ##                        <tt>PATH_INFO</tt>, these variables can be
        
      108. 
      
        
    108. 
          
          
                ##                        used to complete the URL. Note, however,
        
      109. 
      
        
    109. 
          
          
                ##                        that <tt>HTTP_HOST</tt>, if present,
        
      110. 
      
        
    110. 
          
          
                ##                        should be used in preference to
        
      111. 
      
        
    111. 
          
          
                ##                        <tt>SERVER_NAME</tt> for reconstructing
        
      112. 
      
        
    112. 
          
          
                ##                        the request URL.
        
      113. 
      
        
    113. 
          
          
                ##                        <tt>SERVER_NAME</tt> and <tt>SERVER_PORT</tt>
        
      114. 
      
        
    114. 
          
          
                ##                        can never be empty strings, and so
        
      115. 
      
        
    115. 
          
          
                ##                        are always required.
        
      116. 
      
        
    116. 
          
          
          
        
      117. 
      
        
    117. 
          
          
                ## <tt>HTTP_</tt> Variables:: Variables corresponding to the
        
      118. 
      
        
    118. 
          
          
                ##                            client-supplied HTTP request
        
      119. 
      
        
    119. 
          
          
                ##                            headers (i.e., variables whose
        
      120. 
      
        
    120. 
          
          
                ##                            names begin with <tt>HTTP_</tt>). The
        
      121. 
      
        
    121. 
          
          
                ##                            presence or absence of these
        
      122. 
      
        
    122. 
          
          
                ##                            variables should correspond with
        
      123. 
      
        
    123. 
          
          
                ##                            the presence or absence of the
        
      124. 
      
        
    124. 
          
          
                ##                            appropriate HTTP header in the
        
      125. 
      
        
    125. 
          
          
                ##                            request. See
        
      126. 
      
        
    126. 
          
          
                ##                            <a href="https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3875#section-4.1.18">
        
      127. 
      
        
    127. 
          
          
                ##                            RFC3875 section 4.1.18</a> for
        
      128. 
      
        
    128. 
          
          
                ##                            specific behavior.
        
      129. 
      
        
    129. 
          
          
          
        
      130. 
      
        
    130. 
          
          
                ## In addition to this, the Rack environment must include these
        
      131. 
      
        
    131. 
          
          
                ## Rack-specific variables:
        
      132. 
      
        
    132. 
          
          
          
        
      133. 
      
        
    133. 
          
          
                ## <tt>rack.version</tt>:: The Array representing this version of Rack
        
      134. 
      
        
    134. 
          
          
                ##                         See Rack::VERSION, that corresponds to
        
      135. 
      
        
    135. 
          
          
                ##                         the version of this SPEC.
        
      136. 
      
        
    136. 
          
          
          
        
      137. 
      
        
    137. 
          
          
                ## <tt>rack.url_scheme</tt>:: +http+ or +https+, depending on the
        
      138. 
      
        
    138. 
          
          
                ##                            request URL.
        
      139. 
      
        
    139. 
          
          
          
        
      140. 
      
        
    140. 
          
          
                ## <tt>rack.input</tt>:: See below, the input stream.
        
      141. 
      
        
    141. 
          
          
          
        
      142. 
      
        
    142. 
          
          
                ## <tt>rack.errors</tt>:: See below, the error stream.
        
      143. 
      
        
    143. 
          
          
          
        
      144. 
      
        
    144. 
          
          
                ## <tt>rack.multithread</tt>:: true if the application object may be
        
      145. 
      
        
    145. 
          
          
                ##                             simultaneously invoked by another thread
        
      146. 
      
        
    146. 
          
          
                ##                             in the same process, false otherwise.
        
      147. 
      
        
    147. 
          
          
          
        
      148. 
      
        
    148. 
          
          
                ## <tt>rack.multiprocess</tt>:: true if an equivalent application object
        
      149. 
      
        
    149. 
          
          
                ##                              may be simultaneously invoked by another
        
      150. 
      
        
    150. 
          
          
                ##                              process, false otherwise.
        
      151. 
      
        
    151. 
          
          
          
        
      152. 
      
        
    152. 
          
          
                ## <tt>rack.run_once</tt>:: true if the server expects
        
      153. 
      
        
    153. 
          
          
                ##                          (but does not guarantee!) that the
        
      154. 
      
        
    154. 
          
          
                ##                          application will only be invoked this one
        
      155. 
      
        
    155. 
          
          
                ##                          time during the life of its containing
        
      156. 
      
        
    156. 
          
          
                ##                          process. Normally, this will only be true
        
      157. 
      
        
    157. 
          
          
                ##                          for a server based on CGI
        
      158. 
      
        
    158. 
          
          
                ##                          (or something similar).
        
      159. 
      
        
    159. 
          
          
          
        
      160. 
      
        
    160. 
          
          
                ## <tt>rack.hijack?</tt>:: present and true if the server supports
        
      161. 
      
        
    161. 
          
          
                ##                         connection hijacking. See below, hijacking.
        
      162. 
      
        
    162. 
          
          
          
        
      163. 
      
        
    163. 
          
          
                ## <tt>rack.hijack</tt>:: an object responding to #call that must be
        
      164. 
      
        
    164. 
          
          
                ##                        called at least once before using
        
      165. 
      
        
    165. 
          
          
                ##                        rack.hijack_io.
        
      166. 
      
        
    166. 
          
          
                ##                        It is recommended #call return rack.hijack_io
        
      167. 
      
        
    167. 
          
          
                ##                        as well as setting it in env if necessary.
        
      168. 
      
        
    168. 
          
          
          
        
      169. 
      
        
    169. 
          
          
                ## <tt>rack.hijack_io</tt>:: if rack.hijack? is true, and rack.hijack
        
      170. 
      
        
    170. 
          
          
                ##                           has received #call, this will contain
        
      171. 
      
        
    171. 
          
          
                ##                           an object resembling an IO. See hijacking.
        
      172. 
      
        
    172. 
          
          
          
        
      173. 
      
        
    173. 
          
          
                ## Additional environment specifications have approved to
        
      174. 
      
        
    174. 
          
          
                ## standardized middleware APIs.  None of these are required to
        
      175. 
      
        
    175. 
          
          
                ## be implemented by the server.
        
      176. 
      
        
    176. 
          
          
          
        
      177. 
      
        
    177. 
          
          
                ## <tt>rack.session</tt>:: A hash like interface for storing
        
      178. 
      
        
    178. 
          
          
                ##                         request session data.
        
      179. 
      
        
    179. 
          
          
                ##                         The store must implement:
        
      180. 
      
        
    180. 
          
          
                if session = env['rack.session']
        
      181. 
      
        
    181. 
          
          
                  ##                         store(key, value)         (aliased as []=);
        
      182. 
      
        
    182. 
          
          
                  assert("session #{session.inspect} must respond to store and []=") {
        
      183. 
      
        
    183. 
          
          
                    session.respond_to?(:store) && session.respond_to?(:[]=)
        
      184. 
      
        
    184. 
          
          
                  }
        
      185. 
      
        
    185. 
          
          
          
        
      186. 
      
        
    186. 
          
          
                  ##                         fetch(key, default = nil) (aliased as []);
        
      187. 
      
        
    187. 
          
          
                  assert("session #{session.inspect} must respond to fetch and []") {
        
      188. 
      
        
    188. 
          
          
                    session.respond_to?(:fetch) && session.respond_to?(:[])
        
      189. 
      
        
    189. 
          
          
                  }
        
      190. 
      
        
    190. 
          
          
          
        
      191. 
      
        
    191. 
          
          
                  ##                         delete(key);
        
      192. 
      
        
    192. 
          
          
                  assert("session #{session.inspect} must respond to delete") {
        
      193. 
      
        
    193. 
          
          
                    session.respond_to?(:delete)
        
      194. 
      
        
    194. 
          
          
                  }
        
      195. 
      
        
    195. 
          
          
          
        
      196. 
      
        
    196.
