                  ##                         clear;
        
      197. 
      
        
    197. 
          
          
                  assert("session #{session.inspect} must respond to clear") {
        
      198. 
      
        
    198. 
          
          
                    session.respond_to?(:clear)
        
      199. 
      
        
    199. 
          
          
                  }
        
      200. 
      
        
    200. 
          
          
                end
        
      201. 
      
        
    201. 
          
          
          
        
      202. 
      
        
    202. 
          
          
                ## <tt>rack.logger</tt>:: A common object interface for logging messages.
        
      203. 
      
        
    203. 
          
          
                ##                        The object must implement:
        
      204. 
      
        
    204. 
          
          
                if logger = env['rack.logger']
        
      205. 
      
        
    205. 
          
          
                  ##                         info(message, &block)
        
      206. 
      
        
    206. 
          
          
                  assert("logger #{logger.inspect} must respond to info") {
        
      207. 
      
        
    207. 
          
          
                    logger.respond_to?(:info)
        
      208. 
      
        
    208. 
          
          
                  }
        
      209. 
      
        
    209. 
          
          
          
        
      210. 
      
        
    210. 
          
          
                  ##                         debug(message, &block)
        
      211. 
      
        
    211. 
          
          
                  assert("logger #{logger.inspect} must respond to debug") {
        
      212. 
      
        
    212. 
          
          
                    logger.respond_to?(:debug)
        
      213. 
      
        
    213. 
          
          
                  }
        
      214. 
      
        
    214. 
          
          
          
        
      215. 
      
        
    215. 
          
          
                  ##                         warn(message, &block)
        
      216. 
      
        
    216. 
          
          
                  assert("logger #{logger.inspect} must respond to warn") {
        
      217. 
      
        
    217. 
          
          
                    logger.respond_to?(:warn)
        
      218. 
      
        
    218. 
          
          
                  }
        
      219. 
      
        
    219. 
          
          
          
        
      220. 
      
        
    220. 
          
          
                  ##                         error(message, &block)
        
      221. 
      
        
    221. 
          
          
                  assert("logger #{logger.inspect} must respond to error") {
        
      222. 
      
        
    222. 
          
          
                    logger.respond_to?(:error)
        
      223. 
      
        
    223. 
          
          
                  }
        
      224. 
      
        
    224. 
          
          
          
        
      225. 
      
        
    225. 
          
          
                  ##                         fatal(message, &block)
        
      226. 
      
        
    226. 
          
          
                  assert("logger #{logger.inspect} must respond to fatal") {
        
      227. 
      
        
    227. 
          
          
                    logger.respond_to?(:fatal)
        
      228. 
      
        
    228. 
          
          
                  }
        
      229. 
      
        
    229. 
          
          
                end
        
      230. 
      
        
    230. 
          
          
          
        
      231. 
      
        
    231. 
          
          
                ## <tt>rack.multipart.buffer_size</tt>:: An Integer hint to the multipart parser as to what chunk size to use for reads and writes.
        
      232. 
      
        
    232. 
          
          
                if bufsize = env['rack.multipart.buffer_size']
        
      233. 
      
        
    233. 
          
          
                  assert("rack.multipart.buffer_size must be an Integer > 0 if specified") {
        
      234. 
      
        
    234. 
          
          
                    bufsize.is_a?(Integer) && bufsize > 0
        
      235. 
      
        
    235. 
          
          
                  }
        
      236. 
      
        
    236. 
          
          
                end
        
      237. 
      
        
    237. 
          
          
          
        
      238. 
      
        
    238. 
          
          
                ## <tt>rack.multipart.tempfile_factory</tt>:: An object responding to #call with two arguments, the filename and content_type given for the multipart form field, and returning an IO-like object that responds to #<< and optionally #rewind. This factory will be used to instantiate the tempfile for each multipart form file upload field, rather than the default class of Tempfile.
        
      239. 
      
        
    239. 
          
          
                if tempfile_factory = env['rack.multipart.tempfile_factory']
        
      240. 
      
        
    240. 
          
          
                  assert("rack.multipart.tempfile_factory must respond to #call") { tempfile_factory.respond_to?(:call) }
        
      241. 
      
        
    241. 
          
          
                  env['rack.multipart.tempfile_factory'] = lambda do |filename, content_type|
        
      242. 
      
        
    242. 
          
          
                    io = tempfile_factory.call(filename, content_type)
        
      243. 
      
        
    243. 
          
          
                    assert("rack.multipart.tempfile_factory return value must respond to #<<") { io.respond_to?(:<<) }
        
      244. 
      
        
    244. 
          
          
                    io
        
      245. 
      
        
    245. 
          
          
                  end
        
      246. 
      
        
    246. 
          
          
                end
        
      247. 
      
        
    247. 
          
          
          
        
      248. 
      
        
    248. 
          
          
                ## The server or the application can store their own data in the
        
      249. 
      
        
    249. 
          
          
                ## environment, too.  The keys must contain at least one dot,
        
      250. 
      
        
    250. 
          
          
                ## and should be prefixed uniquely.  The prefix <tt>rack.</tt>
        
      251. 
      
        
    251. 
          
          
                ## is reserved for use with the Rack core distribution and other
        
      252. 
      
        
    252. 
          
          
                ## accepted specifications and must not be used otherwise.
        
      253. 
      
        
    253. 
          
          
                ##
        
      254. 
      
        
    254. 
          
          
          
        
      255. 
      
        
    255. 
          
          
                %w[REQUEST_METHOD SERVER_NAME SERVER_PORT
        
      256. 
      
        
    256. 
          
          
                   QUERY_STRING
        
      257. 
      
        
    257. 
          
          
                   rack.version rack.input rack.errors
        
      258. 
      
        
    258. 
          
          
                   rack.multithread rack.multiprocess rack.run_once].each { |header|
        
      259. 
      
        
    259. 
          
          
                  assert("env missing required key #{header}") { env.include? header }
        
      260. 
      
        
    260. 
          
          
                }
        
      261. 
      
        
    261. 
          
          
          
        
      262. 
      
        
    262. 
          
          
                ## The environment must not contain the keys
        
      263. 
      
        
    263. 
          
          
                ## <tt>HTTP_CONTENT_TYPE</tt> or <tt>HTTP_CONTENT_LENGTH</tt>
        
      264. 
      
        
    264. 
          
          
                ## (use the versions without <tt>HTTP_</tt>).
        
      265. 
      
        
    265. 
          
          
                %w[HTTP_CONTENT_TYPE HTTP_CONTENT_LENGTH].each { |header|
        
      266. 
      
        
    266. 
          
          
                  assert("env contains #{header}, must use #{header[5,-1]}") {
        
      267. 
      
        
    267. 
          
          
                    not env.include? header
        
      268. 
      
        
    268. 
          
          
                  }
        
      269. 
      
        
    269. 
          
          
                }
        
      270. 
      
        
    270. 
          
          
          
        
      271. 
      
        
    271. 
          
          
                ## The CGI keys (named without a period) must have String values.
        
      272. 
      
        
    272. 
          
          
                env.each { |key, value|
        
      273. 
      
        
    273. 
          
          
                  next  if key.include? "."   # Skip extensions
        
      274. 
      
        
    274. 
          
          
                  assert("env variable #{key} has non-string value #{value.inspect}") {
        
      275. 
      
        
    275. 
          
          
                    value.kind_of? String
        
      276. 
      
        
    276. 
          
          
                  }
        
      277. 
      
        
    277. 
          
          
                }
        
      278. 
      
        
    278. 
          
          
          
        
      279. 
      
        
    279. 
          
          
                ## There are the following restrictions:
        
      280. 
      
        
    280. 
          
          
          
        
      281. 
      
        
    281. 
          
          
                ## * <tt>rack.version</tt> must be an array of Integers.
        
      282. 
      
        
    282. 
          
          
                assert("rack.version must be an Array, was #{env["rack.version"].class}") {
        
      283. 
      
        
    283. 
          
          
                  env["rack.version"].kind_of? Array
        
      284. 
      
        
    284. 
          
          
                }
        
      285. 
      
        
    285. 
          
          
                ## * <tt>rack.url_scheme</tt> must either be +http+ or +https+.
        
      286. 
      
        
    286. 
          
          
                assert("rack.url_scheme unknown: #{env["rack.url_scheme"].inspect}") {
        
      287. 
      
        
    287. 
          
          
                  %w[http https].include? env["rack.url_scheme"]
        
      288. 
      
        
    288. 
          
          
                }
        
      289. 
      
        
    289. 
          
          
          
        
      290. 
      
        
    290. 
          
          
                ## * There must be a valid input stream in <tt>rack.input</tt>.
        
      291. 
      
        
    291. 
          
          
                check_input env["rack.input"]
        
      292. 
      
        
    292. 
          
          
                ## * There must be a valid error stream in <tt>rack.errors</tt>.
        
      293. 
      
        
    293. 
          
          
                check_error env["rack.errors"]
        
      294. 
      
        
    294. 
          
          
                ## * There may be a valid hijack stream in <tt>rack.hijack_io</tt>
        
      295. 
      
        
    295. 
          
          
                check_hijack env
        
      296. 
      
        
    296. 
          
          
          
        
      297. 
      
        
    297. 
          
          
                ## * The <tt>REQUEST_METHOD</tt> must be a valid token.
        
      298. 
      
        
    298. 
          
          
                assert("REQUEST_METHOD unknown: #{env[REQUEST_METHOD]}") {
        
      299. 
      
        
    299. 
          
          
                  env["REQUEST_METHOD"] =~ /\A[0-9A-Za-z!\#$%&'*+.^_`|~-]+\z/
        
      300. 
      
        
    300. 
          
          
                }
        
      301. 
      
        
    301. 
          
          
          
        
      302. 
      
        
    302. 
          
          
                ## * The <tt>SCRIPT_NAME</tt>, if non-empty, must start with <tt>/</tt>
        
      303. 
      
        
    303. 
          
          
                assert("SCRIPT_NAME must start with /") {
        
      304. 
      
        
    304. 
          
          
                  !env.include?("SCRIPT_NAME") ||
        
      305. 
      
        
    305. 
          
          
                  env["SCRIPT_NAME"] == "" ||
        
      306. 
      
        
    306. 
          
          
                  env["SCRIPT_NAME"] =~ /\A\//
        
      307. 
      
        
    307. 
          
          
                }
        
      308. 
      
        
    308. 
          
          
                ## * The <tt>PATH_INFO</tt>, if non-empty, must start with <tt>/</tt>
        
      309. 
      
        
    309. 
          
          
                assert("PATH_INFO must start with /") {
        
      310. 
      
        
    310. 
          
          
                  !env.include?("PATH_INFO") ||
        
      311. 
      
        
    311. 
          
          
                  env["PATH_INFO"] == "" ||
        
      312. 
      
        
    312. 
          
          
                  env["PATH_INFO"] =~ /\A\//
        
      313. 
      
        
    313. 
          
          
                }
        
      314. 
      
        
    314. 
          
          
                ## * The <tt>CONTENT_LENGTH</tt>, if given, must consist of digits only.
        
      315. 
      
        
    315. 
          
          
                assert("Invalid CONTENT_LENGTH: #{env["CONTENT_LENGTH"]}") {
        
      316. 
      
        
    316. 
          
          
                  !env.include?("CONTENT_LENGTH") || env["CONTENT_LENGTH"] =~ /\A\d+\z/
        
      317. 
      
        
    317. 
          
          
                }
        
      318. 
      
        
    318. 
          
          
          
        
      319. 
      
        
    319. 
          
          
                ## * One of <tt>SCRIPT_NAME</tt> or <tt>PATH_INFO</tt> must be
        
      320. 
      
        
    320. 
          
          
                ##   set.  <tt>PATH_INFO</tt> should be <tt>/</tt> if
        
      321. 
      
        
    321. 
          
          
                ##   <tt>SCRIPT_NAME</tt> is empty.
        
      322. 
      
        
    322. 
          
          
                assert("One of SCRIPT_NAME or PATH_INFO must be set (make PATH_INFO '/' if SCRIPT_NAME is empty)") {
        
      323. 
      
        
    323. 
          
          
                  env["SCRIPT_NAME"] || env["PATH_INFO"]
        
      324. 
      
        
    324. 
          
          
                }
        
      325. 
      
        
    325. 
          
          
                ##   <tt>SCRIPT_NAME</tt> never should be <tt>/</tt>, but instead be empty.
        
      326. 
      
        
    326. 
          
          
                assert("SCRIPT_NAME cannot be '/', make it '' and PATH_INFO '/'") {
        
      327. 
      
        
    327. 
          
          
                  env["SCRIPT_NAME"] != "/"
        
      328. 
      
        
    328. 
          
          
                }
        
      329. 
      
        
    329. 
          
          
              end
        
      330. 
      
        
    330. 
          
          
          
        
      331. 
      
        
    331. 
          
          
              ## === The Input Stream
        
      332. 
      
        
    332. 
          
          
              ##
        
      333. 
      
        
    333. 
          
          
              ## The input stream is an IO-like object which contains the raw HTTP
        
      334. 
      
        
    334. 
          
          
              ## POST data.
        
      335. 
      
        
    335. 
          1
          
              def check_input(input)
        
      336. 
      
        
    336. 
          
          
                ## When applicable, its external encoding must be "ASCII-8BIT" and it
        
      337. 
      
        
    337. 
          
          
                ## must be opened in binary mode, for Ruby 1.9 compatibility.
        
      338. 
      
        
    338. 
          
          
                assert("rack.input #{input} does not have ASCII-8BIT as its external encoding") {
        
      339. 
      
        
    339. 
          
          
                  input.external_encoding.name == "ASCII-8BIT"
        
      340. 
      
        
    340. 
          
          
                } if input.respond_to?(:external_encoding)
        
      341. 
      
        
    341. 
          
          
                assert("rack.input #{input} is not opened in binary mode") {
        
      342. 
      
        
    342. 
          
          
                  input.binmode?
        
      343. 
      
        
    343. 
          
          
                } if input.respond_to?(:binmode?)
        
      344. 
      
        
    344. 
          
          
          
        
      345. 
      
        
    345. 
          
          
                ## The input stream must respond to +gets+, +each+, +read+ and +rewind+.
        
      346. 
      
        
    346. 
          
          
                [:gets, :each, :read, :rewind].each { |method|
        
      347. 
      
        
    347. 
          
          
                  assert("rack.input #{input} does not respond to ##{method}") {
        
      348. 
      
        
    348. 
          
          
                    input.respond_to? method
        
      349. 
      
        
    349. 
          
          
                  }
        
      350. 
      
        
    350. 
          
          
                }
        
      351. 
      
        
    351. 
          
          
              end
        
      352. 
      
        
    352. 
          
          
          
        
      353. 
      
        
    353. 
          1
          
              class InputWrapper
        
      354. 
      
        
    354. 
          1
          
                include Assertion
        
      355. 
      
        
    355. 
          
          
          
        
      356. 
      
        
    356. 
          1
          
                def initialize(input)
        
      357. 
      
        
    357. 
          
          
                  @input = input
        
      358. 
      
        
    358. 
          
          
                end
        
      359. 
      
        
    359. 
          
          
          
        
      360. 
      
        
    360. 
          
          
                ## * +gets+ must be called without arguments and return a string,
        
      361. 
      
        
    361. 
          
          
                ##   or +nil+ on EOF.
        
      362. 
      
        
    362. 
          1
          
                def gets(*args)
        
      363. 
      
        
    363. 
          
          
                  assert("rack.input#gets called with arguments") { args.size == 0 }
        
      364. 
      
        
    364. 
          
          
                  v = @input.gets
        
      365. 
      
        
    365. 
          
          
                  assert("rack.input#gets didn't return a String") {
        
      366. 
      
        
    366. 
          
          
                    v.nil? or v.kind_of? String
        
      367. 
      
        
    367. 
          
          
                  }
        
      368. 
      
        
    368. 
          
          
                  v
        
      369. 
      
        
    369. 
          
          
                end
        
      370. 
      
        
    370. 
          
          
          
        
      371. 
      
        
    371. 
          
          
                ## * +read+ behaves like IO#read.
        
      372. 
      
        
    372. 
          
          
                ##   Its signature is <tt>read([length, [buffer]])</tt>.
        
      373. 
      
        
    373. 
          
          
                ##
        
      374. 
      
        
    374. 
          
          
                ##   If given, +length+ must be a non-negative Integer (>= 0) or +nil+,
        
      375. 
      
        
    375. 
          
          
                ##   and +buffer+ must be a String and may not be nil.
        
      376. 
      
        
    376. 
          
          
                ##
        
      377. 
      
        
    377. 
          
          
                ##   If +length+ is given and not nil, then this method reads at most
        
      378. 
      
        
    378. 
          
          
                ##   +length+ bytes from the input stream.
        
      379. 
      
        
    379. 
          
          
                ##
        
      380. 
      
        
    380. 
          
          
                ##   If +length+ is not given or nil, then this method reads
        
      381. 
      
        
    381. 
          
          
                ##   all data until EOF.
        
      382. 
      
        
    382. 
          
          
                ##
        
      383. 
      
        
    383. 
          
          
                ##   When EOF is reached, this method returns nil if +length+ is given
        
      384. 
      
        
    384. 
          
          
                ##   and not nil, or "" if +length+ is not given or is nil.
        
      385. 
      
        
    385. 
          
          
                ##
        
      386. 
      
        
    386. 
          
          
                ##   If +buffer+ is given, then the read data will be placed
        
      387. 
      
        
    387. 
          
          
                ##   into +buffer+ instead of a newly created String object.
        
      388. 
      
        
    388. 
          1
          
                def read(*args)
        
      389. 
      
        
    389. 
          
          
                  assert("rack.input#read called with too many arguments") {
        
      390. 
      
        
    390. 
          
          
                    args.size <= 2
        
      391. 
      
        
    391. 
          
          
                  }
        
      392. 
      
        
    392. 
          
          
                  if args.size >= 1
        
      393. 
      
        
    393. 
          
          
                    assert("rack.input#read called with non-integer and non-nil length") {
        
      394. 
      
        
    394. 
          
          
                      args.first.kind_of?(Integer) || args.first.nil?
        
      395. 
      
        
    395. 
          
          
                    }
        
      396. 
      
        
    396. 
          
          
                    assert("rack.input#read called with a negative length") {
        
      397. 
      
        
    397. 
          
          
                      args.first.nil? || args.first >= 0
        
      398. 
      
        
    398. 
          
          
                    }
        
      399. 
      
        
    399. 
          
          
                  end
        
      400. 
      
        
    400. 
          
          
                  if args.size >= 2
        
      401. 
      
        
    401. 
          
          
                    assert("rack.input#read called with non-String buffer") {
        
      402. 
      
        
    402. 
          
          
                      args[1].kind_of?(String)
        
      403. 
      
        
    403. 
          
          
                    }
        
      404. 
      
        
    404. 
          
          
                  end
        
      405. 
      
        
    405. 
          
          
          
        
      406. 
      
        
    406. 
          
          
                  v = @input.read(*args)
        
      407. 
      
        
    407. 
          
          
          
        
      408. 
      
        
    408. 
          
          
                  assert("rack.input#read didn't return nil or a String") {
        
      409. 
      
        
    409. 
          
          
                    v.nil? or v.kind_of? String
        
      410. 
      
        
    410. 
          
          
                  }
        
      411. 
      
        
    411. 
          
          
                  if args[0].nil?
        
      412. 
      
        
    412. 
          
          
                    assert("rack.input#read(nil) returned nil on EOF") {
        
      413. 
      
        
    413. 
          
          
                      !v.nil?
        
      414. 
      
        
    414. 
          
          
                    }
        
      415. 
      
        
    415. 
          
          
                  end
        
      416. 
      
        
    416. 
          
          
          
        
      417. 
      
        
    417. 
          
          
                  v
        
      418. 
      
        
    418. 
          
          
                end
        
      419. 
      
        
    419. 
          
          
          
        
      420. 
      
        
    420. 
          
          
                ## * +each+ must be called without arguments and only yield Strings.
        
      421. 
      
        
    421. 
          1
          
                def each(*args)
        
      422. 
      
        
    422. 
          
          
                  assert("rack.input#each called with arguments") { args.size == 0 }
        
      423. 
      
        
    423. 
          
          
                  @input.each { |line|
        
      424. 
      
        
    424. 
          
          
                    assert("rack.input#each didn't yield a String") {
        
      425. 
      
        
    425. 
          
          
                      line.kind_of? String
        
      426. 
      
        
    426. 
          
          
                    }
        
      427. 
      
        
    427. 
          
          
                    yield line
        
      428. 
      
        
    428. 
          
          
                  }
        
      429. 
      
        
    429. 
          
          
                end
        
      430. 
      
        
    430. 
          
          
          
        
      431. 
      
        
    431. 
          
          
                ## * +rewind+ must be called without arguments. It rewinds the input
        
      432. 
      
        
    432. 
          
          
                ##   stream back to the beginning. It must not raise Errno::ESPIPE:
        
      433. 
      
        
    433. 
          
          
                ##   that is, it may not be a pipe or a socket. Therefore, handler
        
      434. 
      
        
    434. 
          
          
                ##   developers must buffer the input data into some rewindable object
        
      435. 
      
        
    435. 
          
          
                ##   if the underlying input stream is not rewindable.
        
      436. 
      
        
    436. 
          1
          
                def rewind(*args)
        
      437. 
      
        
    437. 
          
          
                  assert("rack.input#rewind called with arguments") { args.size == 0 }
        
      438. 
      
        
    438. 
          
          
                  assert("rack.input#rewind raised Errno::ESPIPE") {
        
      439. 
      
        
    439. 
          
          
                    begin
        
      440. 
      
        
    440. 
          
          
                      @input.rewind
        
      441. 
      
        
    441. 
          
          
                      true
        
      442. 
      
        
    442. 
          
          
                    rescue Errno::ESPIPE
        
      443. 
      
        
    443. 
          
          
                      false
        
      444. 
      
        
    444. 
          
          
                    end
        
      445. 
      
        
    445. 
          
          
                  }
        
      446. 
      
        
    446. 
          
          
                end
        
      447. 
      
        
    447. 
          
          
          
        
      448. 
      
        
    448. 
          
          
                ## * +close+ must never be called on the input stream.
        
      449. 
      
        
    449. 
          1
          
                def close(*args)
        
      450. 
      
        
    450. 
          
          
                  assert("rack.input#close must not be called") { false }
        
      451. 
      
        
    451. 
          
          
                end
        
      452. 
      
        
    452. 
          
          
              end
        
      453. 
      
        
    453. 
          
          
          
        
      454. 
      
        
    454. 
          
          
              ## === The Error Stream
        
      455. 
      
        
    455. 
          1
          
              def check_error(error)
        
      456. 
      
        
    456. 
          
          
                ## The error stream must respond to +puts+, +write+ and +flush+.
        
      457. 
      
        
    457. 
          
          
                [:puts, :write, :flush].each { |method|
        
      458. 
      
        
    458. 
          
          
                  assert("rack.error #{error} does not respond to ##{method}") {
        
      459. 
      
        
    459. 
          
          
                    error.respond_to? method
        
      460. 
      
        
    460. 
          
          
                  }
        
      461. 
      
        
    461. 
          
          
                }
        
      462. 
      
        
    462. 
          
          
              end
        
      463. 
      
        
    463. 
          
          
          
        
      464. 
      
        
    464. 
          1
          
              class ErrorWrapper
        
      465. 
      
        
    465. 
          1
          
                include Assertion
        
      466. 
      
        
    466. 
          
          
          
        
      467. 
      
        
    467. 
          1
          
                def initialize(error)
        
      468. 
      
        
    468. 
          
          
                  @error = error
        
      469. 
      
        
    469. 
          
          
                end
        
      470. 
      
        
    470. 
          
          
          
        
      471. 
      
        
    471. 
          
          
                ## * +puts+ must be called with a single argument that responds to +to_s+.
        
      472. 
      
        
    472. 
          1
          
                def puts(str)
        
      473. 
      
        
    473. 
          
          
                  @error.puts str
        
      474. 
      
        
    474. 
          
          
                end
        
      475. 
      
        
    475. 
          
          
          
        
      476. 
      
        
    476. 
          
          
                ## * +write+ must be called with a single argument that is a String.
        
      477. 
      
        
    477. 
          1
          
                def write(str)
        
      478. 
      
        
    478. 
          
          
                  assert("rack.errors#write not called with a String") { str.kind_of? String }
        
      479. 
      
        
    479. 
          
          
                  @error.write str
        
      480. 
      
        
    480. 
          
          
                end
        
      481. 
      
        
    481. 
          
          
          
        
      482. 
      
        
    482. 
          
          
                ## * +flush+ must be called without arguments and must be called
        
      483. 
      
        
    483. 
          
          
                ##   in order to make the error appear for sure.
        
      484. 
      
        
    484. 
          1
          
                def flush
        
      485. 
      
        
    485. 
          
          
                  @error.flush
        
      486. 
      
        
    486. 
          
          
                end
        
      487. 
      
        
    487. 
          
          
          
        
      488. 
      
        
    488. 
          
          
                ## * +close+ must never be called on the error stream.
        
      489. 
      
        
    489. 
          1
          
                def close(*args)
        
      490. 
      
        
    490. 
          
          
                  assert("rack.errors#close must not be called") { false }
        
      491. 
      
        
    491. 
          
          
                end
        
      492. 
      
        
    492. 
          
          
              end
        
      493. 
      
        
    493. 
          
          
          
        
      494. 
      
        
    494. 
          1
          
              class HijackWrapper
        
      495. 
      
        
    495. 
          1
          
                include Assertion
        
      496. 
      
        
    496. 
          1
          
                extend Forwardable
        
      497. 
      
        
    497. 
          
          
          
        
      498. 
      
        
    498. 
          1
          
                REQUIRED_METHODS = [
        
      499. 
      
        
    499. 
          
          
                  :read, :write, :read_nonblock, :write_nonblock, :flush, :close,
        
      500. 
      
        
    500. 
          
          
                  :close_read, :close_write, :closed?
        
      501. 
      
        
    501. 
          
          
                ]
        
      502. 
      
        
    502. 
          
          
          
        
      503. 
      
        
    503. 
          1
          
                def_delegators :@io, *REQUIRED_METHODS
        
      504. 
      
        
    504. 
          
          
          
        
      505. 
      
        
    505. 
          1
          
                def initialize(io)
        
      506. 
      
        
    506. 
          
          
                  @io = io
        
      507. 
      
        
    507. 
          
          
                  REQUIRED_METHODS.each do |meth|
        
      508. 
      
        
    508. 
          
          
                    assert("rack.hijack_io must respond to #{meth}") { io.respond_to? meth }
        
      509. 
      
        
    509. 
          
          
                  end
        
      510. 
      
        
    510. 
          
          
                end
        
      511. 
      
        
    511. 
          
          
              end
        
      512. 
      
        
    512. 
          
          
          
        
      513. 
      
        
    513. 
          
          
              ## === Hijacking
        
      514. 
      
        
    514. 
          
          
              #
        
      515. 
      
        
    515. 
          
          
              # AUTHORS: n.b. The trailing whitespace between paragraphs is important and
        
      516. 
      
        
    516. 
          
          
              # should not be removed. The whitespace creates paragraphs in the RDoc
        
      517. 
      
        
    517. 
          
          
              # output.
        
      518. 
      
        
    518. 
          
          
              #
        
      519. 
      
        
    519. 
          
          
              ## ==== Request (before status)
        
      520. 
      
        
    520. 
          1
          
              def check_hijack(env)
        
      521. 
      
        
    521. 
          
          
                if env['rack.hijack?']
        
      522. 
      
        
    522. 
          
          
                  ## If rack.hijack? is true then rack.hijack must respond to #call.
        
      523. 
      
        
    523. 
          
          
                  original_hijack = env['rack.hijack']
        
      524. 
      
        
    524. 
          
          
                  assert("rack.hijack must respond to call") { original_hijack.respond_to?(:call) }
        
      525. 
      
        
    525. 
          
          
                  env['rack.hijack'] = proc do
        
      526. 
      
        
    526. 
          
          
                    ## rack.hijack must return the io that will also be assigned (or is
        
      527. 
      
        
    527. 
          
          
                    ## already present, in rack.hijack_io.
        
      528. 
      
        
    528. 
          
          
                    io = original_hijack.call
        
      529. 
      
        
    529. 
          
          
                    HijackWrapper.new(io)
        
      530. 
      
        
    530. 
          
          
                    ##
        
      531. 
      
        
    531. 
          
          
                    ## rack.hijack_io must respond to:
        
      532. 
      
        
    532. 
          
          
                    ## <tt>read, write, read_nonblock, write_nonblock, flush, close,
        
      533. 
      
        
    533. 
          
          
                    ## close_read, close_write, closed?</tt>
        
      534. 
      
        
    534. 
          
          
                    ##
        
      535. 
      
        
    535. 
          
          
                    ## The semantics of these IO methods must be a best effort match to
        
      536. 
      
        
    536. 
          
          
                    ## those of a normal ruby IO or Socket object, using standard
        
      537. 
      
        
    537. 
          
          
                    ## arguments and raising standard exceptions. Servers are encouraged
        
      538. 
      
        
    538. 
          
          
                    ## to simply pass on real IO objects, although it is recognized that
        
      539. 
      
        
    539. 
          
          
                    ## this approach is not directly compatible with SPDY and HTTP 2.0.
        
      540. 
      
        
    540. 
          
          
                    ##
        
      541. 
      
        
    541. 
          
          
                    ## IO provided in rack.hijack_io should preference the
        
      542. 
      
        
    542. 
          
          
                    ## IO::WaitReadable and IO::WaitWritable APIs wherever supported.
        
      543. 
      
        
    543. 
          
          
                    ##
        
      544. 
      
        
    544. 
          
          
                    ## There is a deliberate lack of full specification around
        
      545. 
      
        
    545. 
          
          
                    ## rack.hijack_io, as semantics will change from server to server.
        
      546. 
      
        
    546. 
          
          
                    ## Users are encouraged to utilize this API with a knowledge of their
        
      547. 
      
        
    547. 
          
          
                    ## server choice, and servers may extend the functionality of
        
      548. 
      
        
    548. 
          
          
                    ## hijack_io to provide additional features to users. The purpose of
        
      549. 
      
        
    549. 
          
          
                    ## rack.hijack is for Rack to "get out of the way", as such, Rack only
        
      550. 
      
        
    550. 
          
          
                    ## provides the minimum of specification and support.
        
      551. 
      
        
    551. 
          
          
                    env['rack.hijack_io'] = HijackWrapper.new(env['rack.hijack_io'])
        
      552. 
      
        
    552. 
          
          
                    io
        
      553. 
      
        
    553. 
          
          
                  end
        
      554. 
      
        
    554. 
          
          
                else
        
      555. 
      
        
    555. 
          
          
                  ##
        
      556. 
      
        
    556. 
          
          
                  ## If rack.hijack? is false, then rack.hijack should not be set.
        
      557. 
      
        
    557. 
          
          
                  assert("rack.hijack? is false, but rack.hijack is present") { env['rack.hijack'].nil? }
        
      558. 
      
        
    558. 
          
          
                  ##
        
      559. 
      
        
    559. 
          
          
                  ## If rack.hijack? is false, then rack.hijack_io should not be set.
        
      560. 
      
        
    560. 
          
          
                  assert("rack.hijack? is false, but rack.hijack_io is present") { env['rack.hijack_io'].nil? }
        
      561. 
      
        
    561. 
          
          
                end
        
      562. 
      
        
    562. 
          
          
              end
        
      563. 
      
        
    563. 
          
          
          
        
      564. 
      
        
    564. 
          
          
              ## ==== Response (after headers)
        
      565. 
      
        
    565. 
          
          
              ## It is also possible to hijack a response after the status and headers
        
      566. 
      
        
    566. 
          
          
              ## have been sent.
        
      567. 
      
        
    567. 
          1
          
              def check_hijack_response(headers, env)
        
      568. 
      
        
    568. 
          
          
          
        
      569. 
      
        
    569. 
          
          
                # this check uses headers like a hash, but the spec only requires
        
      570. 
      
        
    570. 
          
          
                # headers respond to #each
        
      571. 
      
        
    571. 
          
          
                headers = Rack::Utils::HeaderHash.new(headers)
        
      572. 
      
        
    572. 
          
          
          
        
      573. 
      
        
    573. 
          
          
                ## In order to do this, an application may set the special header
        
      574. 
      
        
    574. 
          
          
                ## <tt>rack.hijack</tt> to an object that responds to <tt>call</tt>
        
      575. 
      
        
    575. 
          
          
                ## accepting an argument that conforms to the <tt>rack.hijack_io</tt>
        
      576. 
      
        
    576. 
          
          
                ## protocol.
        
      577. 
      
        
    577. 
          
          
                ##
        
      578. 
      
        
    578. 
          
          
                ## After the headers have been sent, and this hijack callback has been
        
      579. 
      
        
    579. 
          
          
                ## called, the application is now responsible for the remaining lifecycle
        
      580. 
      
        
    580. 
          
          
                ## of the IO. The application is also responsible for maintaining HTTP
        
      581. 
      
        
    581. 
          
          
                ## semantics. Of specific note, in almost all cases in the current SPEC,
        
      582. 
      
        
    582. 
          
          
                ## applications will have wanted to specify the header Connection:close in
        
      583. 
      
        
    583. 
          
          
                ## HTTP/1.1, and not Connection:keep-alive, as there is no protocol for
        
      584. 
      
        
    584. 
          
          
                ## returning hijacked sockets to the web server. For that purpose, use the
        
      585. 
      
        
    585. 
          
          
                ## body streaming API instead (progressively yielding strings via each).
        
      586. 
      
        
    586. 
          
          
                ##
        
      587. 
      
        
    587. 
          
          
                ## Servers must ignore the <tt>body</tt> part of the response tuple when
        
      588. 
      
        
    588. 
          
          
                ## the <tt>rack.hijack</tt> response API is in use.
        
      589. 
      
        
    589. 
          
          
          
        
      590. 
      
        
    590. 
          
          
                if env['rack.hijack?'] && headers['rack.hijack']
        
      591. 
      
        
    591. 
          
          
                  assert('rack.hijack header must respond to #call') {
        
      592. 
      
        
    592. 
          
          
                    headers['rack.hijack'].respond_to? :call
        
      593. 
      
        
    593. 
          
          
                  }
        
      594. 
      
        
    594. 
          
          
                  original_hijack = headers['rack.hijack']
        
      595. 
      
        
    595. 
          
          
                  headers['rack.hijack'] = proc do |io|
        
      596. 
      
        
    596. 
          
          
                    original_hijack.call HijackWrapper.new(io)
        
      597. 
      
        
    597. 
          
          
                  end
        
      598. 
      
        
    598. 
          
          
                else
        
      599. 
      
        
    599. 
          
          
                  ##
        
      600. 
      
        
    600. 
          
          
                  ## The special response header <tt>rack.hijack</tt> must only be set
        
      601. 
      
        
    601. 
          
          
                  ## if the request env has <tt>rack.hijack?</tt> <tt>true</tt>.
        
      602. 
      
        
    602. 
          
          
                  assert('rack.hijack header must not be present if server does not support hijacking') {
        
      603. 
      
        
    603. 
          
          
                    headers['rack.hijack'].nil?
        
      604. 
      
        
    604. 
          
          
                  }
        
      605. 
      
        
    605. 
          
          
                end
        
      606. 
      
        
    606. 
          
          
              end
        
      607. 
      
        
    607. 
          
          
              ## ==== Conventions
        
      608. 
      
        
    608. 
          
          
              ## * Middleware should not use hijack unless it is handling the whole
        
      609. 
      
        
    609. 
          
          
              ##   response.
        
      610. 
      
        
    610. 
          
          
              ## * Middleware may wrap the IO object for the response pattern.
        
      611. 
      
        
    611. 
          
          
              ## * Middleware should not wrap the IO object for the request pattern. The
        
      612. 
      
        
    612. 
          
          
              ##   request pattern is intended to provide the hijacker with "raw tcp".
        
      613. 
      
        
    613. 
          
          
          
        
      614. 
      
        
    614. 
          
          
              ## == The Response
        
      615. 
      
        
    615. 
          
          
          
        
      616. 
      
        
    616. 
          
          
              ## === The Status
        
      617. 
      
        
    617. 
          1
          
              def check_status(status)
        
      618. 
      
        
    618. 
          
          
                ## This is an HTTP status. When parsed as integer (+to_i+), it must be
        
      619. 
      
        
    619. 
          
          
                ## greater than or equal to 100.
        
      620. 
      
        
    620. 
          
          
                assert("Status must be >=100 seen as integer") { status.to_i >= 100 }
        
      621. 
      
        
    621. 
          
          
              end
        
      622. 
      
        
    622. 
          
          
          
        
      623. 
      
        
    623. 
          
          
              ## === The Headers
        
      624. 
      
        
    624. 
          1
          
              def check_headers(header)
        
      625. 
      
        
    625. 
          
          
                ## The header must respond to +each+, and yield values of key and value.
        
      626. 
      
        
    626. 
          
          
                assert("headers object should respond to #each, but doesn't (got #{header.class} as headers)") {
        
      627. 
      
        
    627. 
          
          
                   header.respond_to? :each
        
      628. 
      
        
    628. 
          
          
                }
        
      629. 
      
        
    629. 
          
          
                header.each { |key, value|
        
      630. 
      
        
    630. 
          
          
                  ## Special headers starting "rack." are for communicating with the
        
      631. 
      
        
    631. 
          
          
                  ## server, and must not be sent back to the client.
        
      632. 
      
        
    632. 
          
          
                  next if key =~ /^rack\..+$/
        
      633. 
      
        
    633. 
          
          
          
        
      634. 
      
        
    634. 
          
          
                  ## The header keys must be Strings.
        
      635. 
      
        
    635. 
          
          
                  assert("header key must be a string, was #{key.class}") {
        
      636. 
      
        
    636. 
          
          
                    key.kind_of? String
        
      637. 
      
        
    637. 
          
          
                  }
        
      638. 
      
        
    638. 
          
          
                  ## The header must not contain a +Status+ key.
        
      639. 
      
        
    639. 
          
          
                  assert("header must not contain Status") { key.downcase != "status" }
        
      640. 
      
        
    640. 
          
          
                  ## The header must conform to RFC7230 token specification, i.e. cannot
        
      641. 
      
        
    641. 
          
          
                  ## contain non-printable ASCII, DQUOTE or "(),/:;<=>?@[\]{}".
        
      642. 
      
        
    642. 
          
          
                  assert("invalid header name: #{key}") { key !~ /[\(\),\/:;<=>\?@\[\\\]{}[:cntrl:]]/ }
        
      643. 
      
        
    643. 
          
          
          
        
      644. 
      
        
    644. 
          
          
                  ## The values of the header must be Strings,
        
      645. 
      
        
    645. 
          
          
                  assert("a header value must be a String, but the value of " +
        
      646. 
      
        
    646. 
          
          
                    "'#{key}' is a #{value.class}") { value.kind_of? String }
        
      647. 
      
        
    647. 
          
          
                  ## consisting of lines (for multiple header values, e.g. multiple
        
      648. 
      
        
    648. 
          
          
                  ## <tt>Set-Cookie</tt> values) separated by "\\n".
        
      649. 
      
        
    649. 
          
          
                  value.split("\n").each { |item|
        
      650. 
      
        
    650. 
          
          
                    ## The lines must not contain characters below 037.
        
      651. 
      
        
    651. 
          
          
                    assert("invalid header value #{key}: #{item.inspect}") {
        
      652. 
      
        
    652. 
          
          
                      item !~ /[\000-\037]/
        
      653. 
      
        
    653. 
          
          
                    }
        
      654. 
      
        
    654. 
          
          
                  }
        
      655. 
      
        
    655. 
          
          
                }
        
      656. 
      
        
    656. 
          
          
              end
        
      657. 
      
        
    657. 
          
          
          
        
      658. 
      
        
    658. 
          
          
              ## === The Content-Type
        
      659. 
      
        
    659. 
          1
          
              def check_content_type(status, headers)
        
      660. 
      
        
    660. 
          
          
                headers.each { |key, value|
        
      661. 
      
        
    661. 
          
          
                  ## There must not be a <tt>Content-Type</tt>, when the +Status+ is 1xx,
        
      662. 
      
        
    662. 
          
          
                  ## 204, 205 or 304.
        
      663. 
      
        
    663. 
          
          
                  if key.downcase == "content-type"
        
      664. 
      
        
    664. 
          
          
                    assert("Content-Type header found in #{status} response, not allowed") {
        
      665. 
      
        
    665. 
          
          
                      not Rack::Utils::STATUS_WITH_NO_ENTITY_BODY.include? status.to_i
        
      666. 
      
        
    666. 
          
          
                    }
        
      667. 
      
        
    667. 
          
          
                    return
        
      668. 
      
        
    668. 
          
          
                  end
        
      669. 
      
        
    669. 
          
          
                }
        
      670. 
      
        
    670. 
          
          
              end
        
      671. 
      
        
    671. 
          
          
          
        
      672. 
      
        
    672. 
          
          
              ## === The Content-Length
        
      673. 
      
        
    673. 
          1
          
              def check_content_length(status, headers)
        
      674. 
      
        
    674. 
          
          
                headers.each { |key, value|
        
      675. 
      
        
    675. 
          
          
                  if key.downcase == 'content-length'
        
      676. 
      
        
    676. 
          
          
                    ## There must not be a <tt>Content-Length</tt> header when the
        
      677. 
      
        
    677. 
          
          
                    ## +Status+ is 1xx, 204, 205 or 304.
        
      678. 
      
        
    678. 
          
          
                    assert("Content-Length header found in #{status} response, not allowed") {
        
      679. 
      
        
    679. 
          
          
                      not Rack::Utils::STATUS_WITH_NO_ENTITY_BODY.include? status.to_i
        
      680. 
      
        
    680. 
          
          
                    }
        
      681. 
      
        
    681. 
          
          
                    @content_length = value
        
      682. 
      
        
    682. 
          
          
                  end
        
      683. 
      
        
    683. 
          
          
                }
        
      684. 
      
        
    684. 
          
          
              end
        
      685. 
      
        
    685. 
          
          
          
        
      686. 
      
        
    686. 
          1
          
              def verify_content_length(bytes)
        
      687. 
      
        
    687. 
          
          
                if @head_request
        
      688. 
      
        
    688. 
          
          
                  assert("Response body was given for HEAD request, but should be empty") {
        
      689. 
      
        
    689. 
          
          
                    bytes == 0
        
      690. 
      
        
    690. 
          
          
                  }
        
      691. 
      
        
    691. 
          
          
                elsif @content_length
        
      692. 
      
        
    692. 
          
          
                  assert("Content-Length header was #{@content_length}, but should be #{bytes}") {
        
      693. 
      
        
    693. 
          
          
                    @content_length == bytes.to_s
        
      694. 
      
        
    694. 
          
          
                  }
        
      695. 
      
        
    695. 
          
          
                end
        
      696. 
      
        
    696. 
          
          
              end
        
      697. 
      
        
    697. 
          
          
          
        
      698. 
      
        
    698. 
          
          
              ## === The Body
        
      699. 
      
        
    699. 
          1
          
              def each
        
      700. 
      
        
    700. 
          
          
                @closed = false
        
      701. 
      
        
    701. 
          
          
                bytes = 0
        
      702. 
      
        
    702. 
          
          
          
        
      703. 
      
        
    703. 
          
          
                ## The Body must respond to +each+
        
      704. 
      
        
    704. 
          
          
                assert("Response body must respond to each") do
        
      705. 
      
        
    705. 
          
          
                  @body.respond_to?(:each)
        
      706. 
      
        
    706. 
          
          
                end
        
      707. 
      
        
    707. 
          
          
          
        
      708. 
      
        
    708. 
          
          
                @body.each { |part|
        
      709. 
      
        
    709. 
          
          
                  ## and must only yield String values.
        
      710. 
      
        
    710. 
          
          
                  assert("Body yielded non-string value #{part.inspect}") {
        
      711. 
      
        
    711. 
          
          
                    part.kind_of? String
        
      712. 
      
        
    712. 
          
          
                  }
        
      713. 
      
        
    713. 
          
          
                  bytes += Rack::Utils.bytesize(part)
        
      714. 
      
        
    714. 
          
          
                  yield part
        
      715. 
      
        
    715. 
          
          
                }
        
      716. 
      
        
    716. 
          
          
                verify_content_length(bytes)
        
      717. 
      
        
    717. 
          
          
          
        
      718. 
      
        
    718. 
          
          
                ##
        
      719. 
      
        
    719. 
          
          
                ## The Body itself should not be an instance of String, as this will
        
      720. 
      
        
    720. 
          
          
                ## break in Ruby 1.9.
        
      721. 
      
        
    721. 
          
          
                ##
        
      722. 
      
        
    722. 
          
          
                ## If the Body responds to +close+, it will be called after iteration. If
        
      723. 
      
        
    723. 
          
          
                ## the body is replaced by a middleware after action, the original body
        
      724. 
      
        
    724. 
          
          
                ## must be closed first, if it responds to close.
        
      725. 
      
        
    725. 
          
          
                # XXX howto: assert("Body has not been closed") { @closed }
        
      726. 
      
        
    726. 
          
          
          
        
      727. 
      
        
    727. 
          
          
          
        
      728. 
      
        
    728. 
          
          
                ##
        
      729. 
      
        
    729. 
          
          
                ## If the Body responds to +to_path+, it must return a String
        
      730. 
      
        
    730. 
          
          
                ## identifying the location of a file whose contents are identical
        
      731. 
      
        
    731. 
          
          
                ## to that produced by calling +each+; this may be used by the
        
      732. 
      
        
    732. 
          
          
                ## server as an alternative, possibly more efficient way to
        
      733. 
      
        
    733. 
          
          
                ## transport the response.
        
      734. 
      
        
    734. 
          
          
          
        
      735. 
      
        
    735. 
          
          
                if @body.respond_to?(:to_path)
        
      736. 
      
        
    736. 
          
          
                  assert("The file identified by body.to_path does not exist") {
        
      737. 
      
        
    737. 
          
          
                    ::File.exist? @body.to_path
        
      738. 
      
        
    738. 
          
          
                  }
        
      739. 
      
        
    739. 
          
          
                end
        
      740. 
      
        
    740. 
          
          
          
        
      741. 
      
        
    741. 
          
          
                ##
        
      742. 
      
        
    742. 
          
          
                ## The Body commonly is an Array of Strings, the application
        
      743. 
      
        
    743. 
          
          
                ## instance itself, or a File-like object.
        
      744. 
      
        
    744. 
          
          
              end
        
      745. 
      
        
    745. 
          
          
          
        
      746. 
      
        
    746. 
          1
          
              def close
        
      747. 
      
        
    747. 
          
          
                @closed = true
        
      748. 
      
        
    748. 
          
          
                @body.close  if @body.respond_to?(:close)
        
      749. 
      
        
    749. 
          
          
              end
        
      750. 
      
        
    750. 
          
          
          
        
      751. 
      
        
    751. 
          
          
              # :startdoc:
        
      752. 
      
        
    752. 
          
          
          
        
      753. 
      
        
    753. 
          
          
            end
        
      754. 
      
        
    754. 
          
          
          end
        
      755. 
      
        
    755. 
          
          
          
        
      756. 
      
        
    756. 
          
          
          ## == Thanks
        
      757. 
      
        
    757. 
          
          
          ## Some parts of this specification are adopted from PEP333: Python
        
      758. 
      
        
    758. 
          
          
          ## Web Server Gateway Interface
        
      759. 
      
        
    759. 
          
          
          ## v1.0 (http://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0333/). I'd like to thank
        
      760. 
      
        
    760. 
          
          
          ## everyone involved in that effort.
        
      761.

    path/gems/rack-1.6.4/lib/rack/mime.rb

    72.73 % covered

    11 relevant lines. 8 lines covered and 3 lines missed. 
        
      
      
        
    1. 
          1
          
          module Rack
        
      2. 
      
        
    2. 
          1
          
            module Mime
        
      3. 
      
        
    3. 
          
          
              # Returns String with mime type if found, otherwise use +fallback+.
        
      4. 
      
        
    4. 
          
          
              # +ext+ should be filename extension in the '.ext' format that
        
      5. 
      
        
    5. 
          
          
              #       File.extname(file) returns.
        
      6. 
      
        
    6. 
          
          
              # +fallback+ may be any object
        
      7. 
      
        
    7. 
          
          
              #
        
      8. 
      
        
    8. 
          
          
              # Also see the documentation for MIME_TYPES
        
      9. 
      
        
    9. 
          
          
              #
        
      10. 
      
        
    10. 
          
          
              # Usage:
        
      11. 
      
        
    11. 
          
          
              #     Rack::Mime.mime_type('.foo')
        
      12. 
      
        
    12. 
          
          
              #
        
      13. 
      
        
    13. 
          
          
              # This is a shortcut for:
        
      14. 
      
        
    14. 
          
          
              #     Rack::Mime::MIME_TYPES.fetch('.foo', 'application/octet-stream')
        
      15. 
      
        
    15. 
          
          
          
        
      16. 
      
        
    16. 
          1
          
              def mime_type(ext, fallback='application/octet-stream')
        
      17. 
      
        
    17. 
          9
          
                MIME_TYPES.fetch(ext.to_s.downcase, fallback)
        
      18. 
      
        
    18. 
          
          
              end
        
      19. 
      
        
    19. 
          1
          
              module_function :mime_type
        
      20. 
      
        
    20. 
          
          
          
        
      21. 
      
        
    21. 
          
          
              # Returns true if the given value is a mime match for the given mime match
        
      22. 
      
        
    22. 
          
          
              # specification, false otherwise.
        
      23. 
      
        
    23. 
          
          
              #
        
      24. 
      
        
    24. 
          
          
              #    Rack::Mime.match?('text/html', 'text/*') => true
        
      25. 
      
        
    25. 
          
          
              #    Rack::Mime.match?('text/plain', '*') => true
        
      26. 
      
        
    26. 
          
          
              #    Rack::Mime.match?('text/html', 'application/json') => false
        
      27. 
      
        
    27. 
          
          
          
        
      28. 
      
        
    28. 
          1
          
              def match?(value, matcher)
        
      29. 
      
        
    29. 
          
          
                v1, v2 = value.split('/', 2)
        
      30. 
      
        
    30. 
          
          
                m1, m2 = matcher.split('/', 2)
        
      31. 
      
        
    31. 
          
          
          
        
      32. 
      
        
    32. 
          
          
                (m1 == '*' || v1 == m1) && (m2.nil? || m2 == '*' || m2 == v2)
        
      33. 
      
        
    33. 
          
          
              end
        
      34. 
      
        
    34. 
          1
          
              module_function :match?
        
      35. 
      
        
    35. 
          
          
          
        
      36. 
      
        
    36. 
          
          
              # List of most common mime-types, selected various sources
        
      37. 
      
        
    37. 
          
          
              # according to their usefulness in a webserving scope for Ruby
        
      38. 
      
        
    38. 
          
          
              # users.
        
      39. 
      
        
    39. 
          
          
              #
        
      40. 
      
        
    40. 
          
          
              # To amend this list with your local mime.types list you can use:
        
      41. 
      
        
    41. 
          
          
              #
        
      42. 
      
        
    42. 
          
          
              #     require 'webrick/httputils'
        
      43. 
      
        
    43. 
          
          
              #     list = WEBrick::HTTPUtils.load_mime_types('/etc/mime.types')
        
      44. 
      
        
    44. 
          
          
              #     Rack::Mime::MIME_TYPES.merge!(list)
        
      45. 
      
        
    45. 
          
          
              #
        
      46. 
      
        
    46. 
          
          
              # N.B. On Ubuntu the mime.types file does not include the leading period, so
        
      47. 
      
        
    47. 
          
          
              # users may need to modify the data before merging into the hash.
        
      48. 
      
        
    48. 
          
          
              #
        
      49. 
      
        
    49. 
          
          
              # To add the list mongrel provides, use:
        
      50. 
      
        
    50. 
          
          
              #
        
      51. 
      
        
    51. 
          
          
              #     require 'mongrel/handlers'
        
      52. 
      
        
    52. 
          
          
              #     Rack::Mime::MIME_TYPES.merge!(Mongrel::DirHandler::MIME_TYPES)
        
      53. 
      
        
    53. 
          
          
          
        
      54. 
      
        
    54. 
          1

          module Rack
        
      9. 
      
        
    9. 
          
          
            # Rack::MockRequest helps testing your Rack application without
        
      10. 
      
        
    10. 
          
          
            # actually using HTTP.
        
      11. 
      
        
    11. 
          
          
            #
        
      12. 
      
        
    12. 
          
          
            # After performing a request on a URL with get/post/put/patch/delete, it
        
      13. 
      
        
    13. 
          
          
            # returns a MockResponse with useful helper methods for effective
        
      14. 
      
        
    14. 
          
          
            # testing.
        
      15. 
      
        
    15. 
          
          
            #
        
      16. 
      
        
    16. 
          
          
            # You can pass a hash with additional configuration to the
        
      17. 
      
        
    17. 
          
          
            # get/post/put/patch/delete.
        
      18. 
      
        
    18. 
          
          
            # <tt>:input</tt>:: A String or IO-like to be used as rack.input.
        
      19. 
      
        
    19. 
          
          
            # <tt>:fatal</tt>:: Raise a FatalWarning if the app writes to rack.errors.
        
      20. 
      
        
    20. 
          
          
            # <tt>:lint</tt>:: If true, wrap the application in a Rack::Lint.
        
      21. 
      
        
    21. 
          
          
          
        
      22. 
      
        
    22. 
          1
          
            class MockRequest
        
      23.

          1
          
              class FatalWarning < RuntimeError

    24. 
          
          
              end

                def puts(warning)
        
      28. 
      
        
    28. 
          
          
                  raise FatalWarning, warning

    29. 
          
          
                end

    30.

              def options(uri, opts={}) request("OPTIONS", uri, opts) end
