              def request(method="GET", uri="", opts={})
        
      65. 
      
        
    65. 
          
          
                env = self.class.env_for(uri, opts.merge(:method => method))
        
      66. 
      
        
    66. 
          
          
          
        
      67. 
      
        
    67. 
          
          
                if opts[:lint]
        
      68. 
      
        
    68. 
          
          
                  app = Rack::Lint.new(@app)
        
      69. 
      
        
    69. 
          
          
                else
        
      70. 
      
        
    70. 
          
          
                  app = @app
        
      71. 
      
        
    71. 
          
          
                end
        
      72. 
      
        
    72. 
          
          
          
        
      73. 
      
        
    73. 
          
          
                errors = env["rack.errors"]
        
      74. 
      
        
    74. 
          
          
                status, headers, body  = app.call(env)
        
      75. 
      
        
    75. 
          
          
                MockResponse.new(status, headers, body, errors)
        
      76. 
      
        
    76. 
          
          
              ensure
        
      77. 
      
        
    77. 
          
          
                body.close if body.respond_to?(:close)
        
      78. 
      
        
    78. 
          
          
              end
        
      79. 
      
        
    79. 
          
          
          
        
      80. 
      
        
    80. 
          
          
              # For historical reasons, we're pinning to RFC 2396. It's easier for users
        
      81. 
      
        
    81. 
          
          
              # and we get support from ruby 1.8 to 2.2 using this method.
        
      82. 
      
        
    82. 
          1
          
              def self.parse_uri_rfc2396(uri)
        
      83. 
      
        
    83. 
          9
          
                @parser ||= defined?(URI::RFC2396_Parser) ? URI::RFC2396_Parser.new : URI
        
      84. 
      
        
    84. 
          9
          
                @parser.parse(uri)
        
      85. 
      
        
    85. 
          
          
              end
        
      86. 
      
        
    86. 
          
          
          
        
      87. 
      
        
    87. 
          
          
              # Return the Rack environment used for a request to +uri+.
        
      88. 
      
        
    88. 
          1
          
              def self.env_for(uri="", opts={})
        
      89. 
      
        
    89. 
          9
          
                uri = parse_uri_rfc2396(uri)
        
      90. 
      
        
    90. 
          9
          
                uri.path = "/#{uri.path}" unless uri.path[0] == ?/
        
      91. 
      
        
    91. 
          
          
          
        
      92. 
      
        
    92. 
          9
          
                env = DEFAULT_ENV.dup
        
      93. 
      
        
    93. 
          
          
          
        
      94. 
      
        
    94. 
          9
          
                env[REQUEST_METHOD] = opts[:method] ? opts[:method].to_s.upcase : "GET"
        
      95. 
      
        
    95. 
          9
          
                env["SERVER_NAME"] = uri.host || "example.org"
        
      96. 
      
        
    96. 
          9
          
                env["SERVER_PORT"] = uri.port ? uri.port.to_s : "80"
        
      97. 
      
        
    97. 
          9
          
                env[QUERY_STRING] = uri.query.to_s
        
      98. 
      
        
    98. 
          9
          
                env[PATH_INFO] = (!uri.path || uri.path.empty?) ? "/" : uri.path
        
      99. 
      
        
    99. 
          9
          
                env["rack.url_scheme"] = uri.scheme || "http"
        
      100. 
      
        
    100. 
          9
          
                env["HTTPS"] = env["rack.url_scheme"] == "https" ? "on" : "off"
        
      101. 
      
        
    101. 
          
          
          
        
      102. 
      
        
    102. 
          9
          
                env[SCRIPT_NAME] = opts[:script_name] || ""
        
      103. 
      
        
    103. 
          
          
          
        
      104. 
      
        
    104. 
          9
          
                if opts[:fatal]
        
      105. 
      
        
    105. 
          
          
                  env["rack.errors"] = FatalWarner.new
        
      106. 
      
        
    106. 
          
          
                else
        
      107. 
      
        
    107. 
          9
          
                  env["rack.errors"] = StringIO.new
        
      108. 
      
        
    108. 
          
          
                end
        
      109. 
      
        
    109. 
          
          
          
        
      110. 
      
        
    110. 
          9
          
                if params = opts[:params]
        
      111. 
      
        
    111. 
          
          
                  if env[REQUEST_METHOD] == "GET"
        
      112. 
      
        
    112. 
          
          
                    params = Utils.parse_nested_query(params) if params.is_a?(String)
        
      113. 
      
        
    113. 
          
          
                    params.update(Utils.parse_nested_query(env[QUERY_STRING]))
        
      114. 
      
        
    114. 
          
          
                    env[QUERY_STRING] = Utils.build_nested_query(params)
        
      115. 
      
        
    115. 
          
          
                  elsif !opts.has_key?(:input)
        
      116. 
      
        
    116. 
          
          
                    opts["CONTENT_TYPE"] = "application/x-www-form-urlencoded"
        
      117. 
      
        
    117. 
          
          
                    if params.is_a?(Hash)
        
      118. 
      
        
    118. 
          
          
                      if data = Utils::Multipart.build_multipart(params)
        
      119. 
      
        
    119. 
          
          
                        opts[:input] = data
        
      120. 
      
        
    120. 
          
          
                        opts["CONTENT_LENGTH"] ||= data.length.to_s
        
      121. 
      
        
    121. 
          
          
                        opts["CONTENT_TYPE"] = "multipart/form-data; boundary=#{Utils::Multipart::MULTIPART_BOUNDARY}"
        
      122. 
      
        
    122. 
          
          
                      else
        
      123. 
      
        
    123. 
          
          
                        opts[:input] = Utils.build_nested_query(params)
        
      124. 
      
        
    124. 
          
          
                      end
        
      125. 
      
        
    125. 
          
          
                    else
        
      126. 
      
        
    126. 
          
          
                      opts[:input] = params
        
      127. 
      
        
    127. 
          
          
                    end
        
      128. 
      
        
    128. 
          
          
                  end
        
      129. 
      
        
    129. 
          
          
                end
        
      130. 
      
        
    130. 
          
          
          
        
      131. 
      
        
    131. 
          9
          
                empty_str = ""
        
      132. 
      
        
    132. 
          9
          
                empty_str.force_encoding("ASCII-8BIT") if empty_str.respond_to? :force_encoding
        
      133. 
      
        
    133. 
          9
          
                opts[:input] ||= empty_str
        
      134. 
      
        
    134. 
          9
          
                if String === opts[:input]
        
      135. 
      
        
    135. 
          9
          
                  rack_input = StringIO.new(opts[:input])
        
      136. 
      
        
    136. 
          
          
                else
        
      137. 
      
        
    137. 
          
          
                  rack_input = opts[:input]
        
      138. 
      
        
    138. 
          
          
                end
        
      139. 
      
        
    139. 
          
          
          
        
      140. 
      
        
    140. 
          9
          
                rack_input.set_encoding(Encoding::BINARY) if rack_input.respond_to?(:set_encoding)
        
      141.

                env['rack.input'] = rack_input
        
      142.

            # Rack::MockResponse provides useful helpers for testing your apps.
        
      154.

            class MockResponse < Rack::Response

              def initialize(status, headers, body, errors=StringIO.new(""))

              def =~(other)

              def body
        
      181. 
      
        
    181. 
          
          
                # FIXME: apparently users of MockResponse expect the return value of
        
      182. 
      
        
    182. 
          
          
                # MockResponse#body to be a string.  However, the real response object
        
      183. 
      
        
    183. 
          
          
                # returns the body as a list.
        
      184. 
      
        
    184. 
          
          
                #
        
      185. 
      
        
    185. 
          
          
                # See spec_showstatus.rb:
        
      186. 
      
        
    186. 
          
          
                #
        
      187. 
      
        
    187. 
          
          
                #   should "not replace existing messages" do
        
      188. 
      
        
    188. 
          
          
                #     ...
        
      189. 
      
        
    189. 
          
          
                #     res.body.should == "foo!"
        
      190. 
      
        
    190. 
          
          
                #   end
        
      191. 
      
        
    191. 
          4
          
                super.join
        
      192. 
      
        
    192. 
          
          
              end
        
      193. 
      
        
    193. 
          
          
          
        
      194. 
      
        
    194. 
          1
          
              def empty?

                [201, 204, 205, 304].include? status
        
      196. 
      
        
    196. 
          
          
              end
        
      197. 
      
        
    197. 
          
          
            end
        
      198.

          end

                def self.create(env)

                def initialize(boundary, io, content_length, env, tempfile, bufsize)
        
      29. 
      
        
    29. 
          
          
                  @buf            = ""
        
      30. 
      
        
    30. 
          
          
          
        
      31. 
      
        
    31. 
          
          
                  if @buf.respond_to? :force_encoding
        
      32. 
      
        
    32. 
          
          
                    @buf.force_encoding Encoding::ASCII_8BIT
        
      33. 
      
        
    33. 
          
          
                  end
        
      34. 
      
        
    34. 
          
          
          
        
      35. 
      
        
    35. 
          
          
                  @params         = Utils::KeySpaceConstrainedParams.new
        
      36. 
      
        
    36. 
          
          
                  @boundary       = "--#{boundary}"
        
      37. 
      
        
    37. 
          
          
                  @io             = io
        
      38. 
      
        
    38. 
          
          
                  @content_length = content_length
        
      39. 
      
        
    39. 
          
          
                  @boundary_size  = Utils.bytesize(@boundary) + EOL.size
        
      40. 
      
        
    40. 
          
          
                  @env = env
        
      41. 
      
        
    41. 
          
          
                  @tempfile       = tempfile
        
      42. 
      
        
    42. 
          
          
                  @bufsize        = bufsize
        
      43. 
      
        
    43. 
          
          
          
        
      44. 
      
        
    44. 
          
          
                  if @content_length
        
      45. 
      
        
    45. 
          
          
                    @content_length -= @boundary_size
        
      46. 
      
        
    46. 
          
          
                  end
        
      47. 
      
        
    47. 
          
          
          
        
      48. 
      
        
    48. 
          
          
                  @rx = /(?:#{EOL})?#{Regexp.quote(@boundary)}(#{EOL}|--)/n
        
      49. 
      
        
    49. 
          
          
                  @full_boundary = @boundary + EOL
        
      50. 
      
        
    50. 
          
          
                end
        
      51. 
      
        
    51. 
          
          
          
        
      52.

          1
          
                def parse
        
      53. 
      
        
    53. 
          
          
                  fast_forward_to_first_boundary
        
      54. 
      
        
    54. 
          
          
          
        
      55. 
      
        
    55. 
          
          
                  opened_files = 0
        
      56. 
      
        
    56. 
          
          
                  loop do
        
      57. 
      
        
    57. 
          
          
          
        
      58. 
      
        
    58. 
          
          
                    head, filename, content_type, name, body =
        
      59. 
      
        
    59. 
          
          
                      get_current_head_and_filename_and_content_type_and_name_and_body
        
      60. 
      
        
    60. 
          
          
          
        
      61. 
      
        
    61. 
          
          
                    if Utils.multipart_part_limit > 0
        
      62. 
      
        
    62. 
          
          
                      opened_files += 1 if filename
        
      63. 
      
        
    63. 
          
          
                      raise MultipartPartLimitError, 'Maximum file multiparts in content reached' if opened_files >= Utils.multipart_part_limit
        
      64. 
      
        
    64. 
          
          
                    end
        
      65. 
      
        
    65. 
          
          
          
        
      66. 
      
        
    66. 
          
          
                    # Save the rest.
        
      67. 
      
        
    67. 
          
          
                    if i = @buf.index(rx)
        
      68. 
      
        
    68. 
          
          
                      body << @buf.slice!(0, i)
        
      69. 
      
        
    69. 
          
          
                      @buf.slice!(0, @boundary_size+2)
        
      70. 
      
        
    70. 
          
          
          
        
      71. 
      
        
    71. 
          
          
                      @content_length = -1  if $1 == "--"
        
      72. 
      
        
    72. 
          
          
                    end
        
      73. 
      
        
    73. 
          
          
          
        
      74. 
      
        
    74. 
          
          
                    get_data(filename, body, content_type, name, head) do |data|
        
      75. 
      
        
    75. 
          
          
                      tag_multipart_encoding(filename, content_type, name, data)
        
      76. 
      
        
    76. 
          
          
          
        
      77. 
      
        
    77. 
          
          
                      Utils.normalize_params(@params, name, data)
        
      78. 
      
        
    78. 
          
          
                    end
        
      79. 
      
        
    79. 
          
          
          
        
      80. 
      
        
    80. 
          
          
                    # break if we're at the end of a buffer, but not if it is the end of a field
        
      81. 
      
        
    81. 
          
          
                    break if (@buf.empty? && $1 != EOL) || @content_length == -1
        
      82. 
      
        
    82. 
          
          
                  end
        
      83. 
      
        
    83. 
          
          
          
        
      84. 
      
        
    84. 
          
          
                  @io.rewind
        
      85. 
      
        
    85. 
          
          
          
        
      86. 
      
        
    86. 
          
          
                  @params.to_params_hash
        
      87. 
      
        
    87. 
          
          
                end
        
      88. 
      
        
    88. 
          
          
          
        
      89.

                private
        
      90.

          1
          
                def full_boundary; @full_boundary; end
        
      91. 
      
        
    91. 
          
          
          
        
      92.

          1
          
                def rx; @rx; end
        
      93.

      94.

          1
          
                def fast_forward_to_first_boundary
        
      95. 
      
        
    95. 
          
          
                  loop do
        
      96. 
      
        
    96. 
          
          
                    content = @io.read(@bufsize)
        
      97. 
      
        
    97. 
          
          
                    raise EOFError, "bad content body" unless content
        
      98. 
      
        
    98. 
          
          
                    @buf << content
        
      99. 
      
        
    99. 
          
          
          
        
      100. 
      
        
    100. 
          
          
                    while @buf.gsub!(/\A([^\n]*\n)/, '')
        
      101. 
      
        
    101. 
          
          
                      read_buffer = $1
        
      102. 
      
        
    102. 
          
          
                      return if read_buffer == full_boundary
        
      103. 
      
        
    103. 
          
          
                    end
        
      104. 
      
        
    104. 
          
          
          
        
      105. 
      
        
    105. 
          
          
                    raise EOFError, "bad content body" if Utils.bytesize(@buf) >= @bufsize
        
      106. 
      
        
    106. 
          
          
                  end
        
      107. 
      
        
    107. 
          
          
                end
        
      108. 
      
        
    108. 
          
          
          
        
      109. 
      
        
    109. 
          1
          
                def get_current_head_and_filename_and_content_type_and_name_and_body
        
      110. 
      
        
    110. 
          
          
                  head = nil
        
      111. 
      
        
    111. 
          
          
                  body = ''
        
      112. 
      
        
    112. 
          
          
          
        
      113. 
      
        
    113. 
          
          
                  if body.respond_to? :force_encoding
        
      114. 
      
        
    114. 
          
          
                    body.force_encoding Encoding::ASCII_8BIT
        
      115. 
      
        
    115. 
          
          
                  end
        
      116. 
      
        
    116. 
          
          
          
        
      117. 
      
        
    117. 
          
          
                  filename = content_type = name = nil
        
      118. 
      
        
    118. 
          
          
          
        
      119. 
      
        
    119. 
          
          
                  until head && @buf =~ rx
        
      120. 
      
        
    120. 
          
          
                    if !head && i = @buf.index(EOL+EOL)
        
      121. 
      
        
    121. 
          
          
                      head = @buf.slice!(0, i+2) # First \r\n
        
      122. 
      
        
    122. 
          
          
          
        
      123. 
      
        
    123. 
          
          
                      @buf.slice!(0, 2)          # Second \r\n
        
      124. 
      
        
    124. 
          
          
          
        
      125. 
      
        
    125. 
          
          
                      content_type = head[MULTIPART_CONTENT_TYPE, 1]
        
      126. 
      
        
    126. 
          
          
                      name = head[MULTIPART_CONTENT_DISPOSITION, 1] || head[MULTIPART_CONTENT_ID, 1]
        
      127. 
      
        
    127. 
          
          
          
        
      128. 
      
        
    128. 
          
          
                      filename = get_filename(head)
        
      129. 
      
        
    129. 
          
          
          
        
      130. 
      
        
    130. 
          
          
                      if name.nil? || name.empty? && filename
        
      131. 
      
        
    131. 
          
          
                        name = filename
        
      132. 
      
        
    132. 
          
          
                      end
        
      133. 
      
        
    133. 
          
          
          
        
      134. 
      
        
    134. 
          
          
                      if filename
        
      135. 
      
        
    135. 
          
          
                        (@env['rack.tempfiles'] ||= []) << body = @tempfile.call(filename, content_type)
        
      136. 
      
        
    136. 
          
          
                        body.binmode  if body.respond_to?(:binmode)
        
      137. 
      
        
    137. 
          
          
                      end
        
      138. 
      
        
    138. 
          
          
          
        
      139. 
      
        
    139. 
          
          
                      next
        
      140. 
      
        
    140. 
          
          
                    end
        
      141. 
      
        
    141. 
          
          
          
        
      142. 
      
        
    142. 
          
          
                    # Save the read body part.
        
      143. 
      
        
    143. 
          
          
                    if head && (@boundary_size+4 < @buf.size)
        
      144. 
      
        
    144. 
          
          
                      body << @buf.slice!(0, @buf.size - (@boundary_size+4))
        
      145. 
      
        
    145. 
          
          
                    end
        
      146. 
      
        
    146. 
          
          
          
        
      147. 
      
        
    147. 
          
          
                    content = @io.read(@content_length && @bufsize >= @content_length ? @content_length : @bufsize)
        
      148. 
      
        
    148. 
          
          
                    raise EOFError, "bad content body"  if content.nil? || content.empty?
        
      149. 
      
        
    149. 
          
          
          
        
      150. 
      
        
    150. 
          
          
                    @buf << content
        
      151. 
      
        
    151. 
          
          
                    @content_length -= content.size if @content_length
        
      152. 
      
        
    152. 
          
          
                  end
        
      153. 
      
        
    153. 
          
          
          
        
      154. 
      
        
    154. 
          
          
                  [head, filename, content_type, name, body]
        
      155. 
      
        
    155. 
          
          
                end
        
      156. 
      
        
    156. 
          
          
          
        
      157. 
      
        
    157. 
          1
          
                def get_filename(head)
        
      158. 
      
        
    158. 
          
          
                  filename = nil
        
      159. 
      
        
    159. 
          
          
                  case head
        
      160. 
      
        
    160. 
          
          
                  when RFC2183
        
      161. 
      
        
    161. 
          
          
                    filename = Hash[head.scan(DISPPARM)]['filename']
        
      162. 
      
        
    162. 
          
          
                    filename = $1 if filename and filename =~ /^"(.*)"$/
        
      163. 
      
        
    163. 
          
          
                  when BROKEN_QUOTED, BROKEN_UNQUOTED
        
      164. 
      
        
    164. 
          
          
                    filename = $1
        
      165. 
      
        
    165. 
          
          
                  end
        
      166. 
      
        
    166. 
          
          
          
        
      167. 
      
        
    167. 
          
          
                  return unless filename
        
      168. 
      
        
    168. 
          
          
          
        
      169. 
      
        
    169. 
          
          
                  if filename.scan(/%.?.?/).all? { |s| s =~ /%[0-9a-fA-F]{2}/ }
        
      170. 
      
        
    170. 
          
          
                    filename = Utils.unescape(filename)
        
      171. 
      
        
    171. 
          
          
                  end
        
      172. 
      
        
    172. 
          
          
          
        
      173. 
      
        
    173. 
          
          
                  scrub_filename filename
        
      174. 
      
        
    174. 
          
          
          
        
      175. 
      
        
    175. 
          
          
                  if filename !~ /\\[^\\"]/
        
      176. 
      
        
    176. 
          
          
                    filename = filename.gsub(/\\(.)/, '\1')
        
      177. 
      
        
    177. 
          
          
                  end
        
      178. 
      
        
    178. 
          
          
                  filename
        
      179. 
      
        
    179. 
          
          
                end
        
      180. 
      
        
    180. 
          
          
          
        
      181. 
      
        
    181. 
          1
          
                if "<3".respond_to? :valid_encoding?
        
      182. 
      
        
    182. 
          1
          
                  def scrub_filename(filename)
        
      183. 
      
        
    183. 
          
          
                    unless filename.valid_encoding?
        
      184. 
      
        
    184. 
          
          
                      # FIXME: this force_encoding is for Ruby 2.0 and 1.9 support.
        
      185. 
      
        
    185. 
          
          
                      # We can remove it after they are dropped
        
      186. 
      
        
    186. 
          
          
                      filename.force_encoding(Encoding::ASCII_8BIT)
        
      187. 
      
        
    187. 
          
          
                      filename.encode!(:invalid => :replace, :undef => :replace)
        
      188. 
      
        
    188. 
          
          
                    end
        
      189. 
      
        
    189. 
          
          
                  end
        
      190. 
      
        
    190. 
          
          
          
        
      191. 
      
        
    191. 
          1
          
                  CHARSET    = "charset"
        
      192. 
      
        
    192. 
          1
          
                  TEXT_PLAIN = "text/plain"
        
      193. 
      
        
    193. 
          
          
          
        
      194. 
      
        
    194. 
          1
          
                  def tag_multipart_encoding(filename, content_type, name, body)
        
      195. 
      
        
    195. 
          
          
                    name.force_encoding Encoding::UTF_8
        
      196. 
      
        
    196. 
          
          
          
        
      197. 
      
        
    197. 
          
          
                    return if filename
        
      198. 
      
        
    198. 
          
          
          
        
      199. 
      
        
    199. 
          
          
                    encoding = Encoding::UTF_8
        
      200. 
      
        
    200. 
          
          
          
        
      201. 
      
        
    201. 
          
          
                    if content_type
        
      202. 
      
        
    202. 
          
          
                      list         = content_type.split(';')
        
      203. 
      
        
    203. 
          
          
                      type_subtype = list.first
        
      204. 
      
        
    204. 
          
          
                      type_subtype.strip!
        
      205. 
      
        
    205. 
          
          
                      if TEXT_PLAIN == type_subtype
        
      206. 
      
        
    206. 
          
          
                        rest         = list.drop 1
        
      207. 
      
        
    207. 
          
          
                        rest.each do |param|
        
      208. 
      
        
    208. 
          
          
                          k,v = param.split('=', 2)
        
      209. 
      
        
    209. 
          
          
                          k.strip!
        
      210. 
      
        
    210. 
          
          
                          v.strip!
        
      211. 
      
        
    211. 
          
          
                          encoding = Encoding.find v if k == CHARSET
        
      212. 
      
        
    212. 
          
          
                        end
        
      213. 
      
        
    213. 
          
          
                      end
        
      214. 
      
        
    214. 
          
          
                    end
        
      215. 
      
        
    215. 
          
          
          
        
      216. 
      
        
    216. 
          
          
                    name.force_encoding encoding
        
      217. 
      
        
    217. 
          
          
                    body.force_encoding encoding
        
      218. 
      
        
    218. 
          
          
                  end
        
      219. 
      
        
    219. 
          
          
                else
        
      220. 
      
        
    220. 
          
          
                  def scrub_filename(filename)
        
      221. 
      
        
    221. 
          
          
                  end
        
      222. 
      
        
    222. 
          
          
                  def tag_multipart_encoding(filename, content_type, name, body)
        
      223. 
      
        
    223. 
          
          
                  end
        
      224. 
      
        
    224. 
          
          
                end
        
      225. 
      
        
    225. 
          
          
          
        
      226. 
      
        
    226. 
          1
          
                def get_data(filename, body, content_type, name, head)
        
      227. 
      
        
    227. 
          
          
                  data = body
        
      228. 
      
        
    228. 
          
          
                  if filename == ""
        
      229. 
      
        
    229. 
          
          
                    # filename is blank which means no file has been selected
        
      230. 
      
        
    230. 
          
          
                    return
        
      231. 
      
        
    231. 
          
          
                  elsif filename
        
      232. 
      
        
    232. 
          
          
                    body.rewind if body.respond_to?(:rewind)
        
      233. 
      
        
    233. 
          
          
          
        
      234. 
      
        
    234. 
          
          
                    # Take the basename of the upload's original filename.
        
      235. 
      
        
    235. 
          
          
                    # This handles the full Windows paths given by Internet Explorer
        
      236. 
      
        
    236. 
          
          
                    # (and perhaps other broken user agents) without affecting
        
      237. 
      
        
    237. 
          
          
                    # those which give the lone filename.
        
      238. 
      
        
    238. 
          
          
                    filename = filename.split(/[\/\\]/).last
        
      239. 
      
        
    239. 
          
          
          
        
      240. 
      
        
    240. 
          
          
                    data = {:filename => filename, :type => content_type,
        
      241. 
      
        
    241. 
          
          
                            :name => name, :tempfile => body, :head => head}
        
      242. 
      
        
    242. 
          
          
                  elsif !filename && content_type && body.is_a?(IO)
        
      243. 
      
        
    243. 
          
          
                    body.rewind
        
      244. 
      
        
    244. 
          
          
          
        
      245. 
      
        
    245. 
          
          
                    # Generic multipart cases, not coming from a form
        
      246. 
      
        
    246. 
          
          
                    data = {:type => content_type,
        
      247. 
      
        
    247. 
          
          
                            :name => name, :tempfile => body, :head => head}
        
      248. 
      
        
    248. 
          
          
                  end
        
      249. 
      
        
    249. 
          
          
          
        
      250. 
      
        
    250. 
          
          
                  yield data
        
      251. 
      
        
    251. 
          
          
                end
        
      252. 
      
        
    252. 
          
          
              end
        
      253. 
      
        
    253. 
          
          
            end
        
      254. 
      
        
    254. 
          
          
          end
        
      255.

                  def load!
        
      151. 
      
        
    151. 
          9
          
                    @id, session = @store.send(:load_session, @env)
        
      152.

          9
          
                    @data = stringify_keys(session)
        
      153.

          9
          
                    @loaded = true

          1
          
                  def stringify_keys(other)
        
      157. 
      
        
    157. 
          12
          
                    hash = {}
        
      158. 
      
        
    158. 
          12
          
                    other.each do |key, value|
        
      159. 
      
        
    159. 
          12
          
                      hash[key.to_s] = value
        
      160. 
      
        
    160. 
          
          
                    end
        
      161. 
      
        
    161. 
          12
          
                    hash
        
      162. 
      
        
    162. 
          
          
                  end
        
      163. 
      
        
    163. 
          
          
                end
        
      164. 
      
        
    164. 
          
          
          
        
      165. 
      
        
    165. 
          
          
                # ID sets up a basic framework for implementing an id based sessioning
        
      166. 
      
        
    166. 
          
          
                # service. Cookies sent to the client for maintaining sessions will only
        
      167. 
      
        
    167. 
          
          
                # contain an id reference. Only #get_session and #set_session are
        
      168. 
      
        
    168. 
          
          
                # required to be overwritten.
        
      169. 
      
        
    169. 
          
          
                #
        
      170. 
      
        
    170. 
          
          
                # All parameters are optional.
        
      171. 
      
        
    171. 
          
          
                # * :key determines the name of the cookie, by default it is
        
      172. 
      
        
    172. 
          
          
                #   'rack.session'
        
      173. 
      
        
    173. 
          
          
                # * :path, :domain, :expire_after, :secure, and :httponly set the related
        
      174. 
      
        
    174. 
          
          
                #   cookie options as by Rack::Response#add_cookie
        
      175. 
      
        
    175. 
          
          
                # * :skip will not a set a cookie in the response nor update the session state
        
      176. 
      
        
    176. 
          
          
                # * :defer will not set a cookie in the response but still update the session
        
      177. 
      
        
    177. 
          
          
                #   state if it is used with a backend
        
      178. 
      
        
    178. 
          
          
                # * :renew (implementation dependent) will prompt the generation of a new
        
      179. 
      
        
    179. 
          
          
                #   session id, and migration of data to be referenced at the new id. If
        
      180. 
      
        
    180. 
          
          
                #   :defer is set, it will be overridden and the cookie will be set.
        
      181. 
      
        
    181. 
          
          
                # * :sidbits sets the number of bits in length that a generated session
        
      182. 
      
        
    182. 
          
          
                #   id will be.
        
      183. 
      
        
    183. 
          
          
                #
        
      184. 
      
        
    184. 
          
          
                # These options can be set on a per request basis, at the location of
        
      185. 
      
        
    185. 
          
          
                # env['rack.session.options']. Additionally the id of the session can be
        
      186. 
      
        
    186. 
          
          
                # found within the options hash at the key :id. It is highly not
        
      187. 
      
        
    187. 
          
          
                # recommended to change its value.
        
      188. 
      
        
    188. 
          
          
                #
        
      189. 
      
        
    189. 
          
          
                # Is Rack::Utils::Context compatible.
        
      190. 
      
        
    190. 
          
          
                #
        
      191. 
      
        
    191. 
          
          
                # Not included by default; you must require 'rack/session/abstract/id'
        
      192. 
      
        
    192. 
          
          
                # to use.
        
      193. 
      
        
    193. 
          
          
          
        
      194. 
      
        
    194. 
          1
          
                class ID
        
      195. 
      
        
    195. 
          1
          
                  DEFAULT_OPTIONS = {

                  def initialize_sid
        
      232. 
      
        
    232. 
          9
          
                    @sidbits = @default_options[:sidbits]
        
      233. 
      
        
    233. 
          9
          
                    @sid_secure = @default_options[:secure_random]
        
      234. 
      
        
    234. 
          9
          
                    @sid_length = @sidbits / 4
        
      235. 
      
        
    235. 
          
          
                  end
        
      236. 
      
        
    236. 
          
          
          
        
      237. 
      
        
    237. 
          
          
                  # Generate a new session id using Ruby #rand.  The size of the
        
      238. 
      
        
    238. 
          
          
                  # session id is controlled by the :sidbits option.
        
      239. 
      
        
    239. 
          
          
                  # Monkey patch this to use custom methods for session id generation.
        
      240. 
      
        
    240. 
          
          
          
        
      241. 
      
        
    241. 
          1
          
                  def generate_sid(secure = @sid_secure)
        
      242. 
      
        
    242. 
          9
          
                    if secure
        
      243. 
      
        
    243. 
          9
          
                      secure.hex(@sid_length)
        
      244. 
      
        
    244. 
          
          
                    else
        
      245. 
      
        
    245. 
          
          
                      "%0#{@sid_length}x" % Kernel.rand(2**@sidbits - 1)
        
      246. 
      
        
    246. 
          
          
                    end
        
      247. 
      
        
    247. 
          
          
                  rescue NotImplementedError
        
      248. 
      
        
    248. 
          
          
                    generate_sid(false)
        
      249. 
      
        
    249. 
          
          
                  end

    292. 
          
          
                  # Session should be committed if it was loaded, any of specific options like :renew, :drop
        
      293. 
      
        
    293. 
          
          
                  # or :expire_after was given and the security permissions match. Skips if skip is given.
        
      294.

                  def commit_session?(env, session, options)
        
      296. 
      
        
    296. 
          9
          
                    if options[:skip]
        
      297. 
      
        
    297. 
          
          
                      false
        
      298. 
      
        
    298. 
          
          
                    else
        
      299. 
      
        
    299. 
          9

      300. 
      
        
    300. 
          9
          
                      has_session && security_matches?(env, options)
        
      301. 
      
        
    301. 
          
          
                    end
        
      302. 
      
        
    302. 
          
          
                  end
        
      303.

                  def loaded_session?(session)
        
      305.

          18
          
                    !session.is_a?(session_class) || session.loaded?

    306.

                  def forced_session_update?(session, options)
        
      309. 
      
        
    309. 
          
          
                    force_options?(options) && session && !session.empty?
        
      310. 
      
        
    310. 
          
          
                  end
        
      311. 
      
        
    311. 
          
          
          
        
      312.

                  def force_options?(options)
        
      313. 
      
        
    313. 
          
          
                    options.values_at(:max_age, :renew, :drop, :defer, :expire_after).any?
        
      314. 
      
        
    314. 
          
          
                  end
        
      315. 
      
        
    315. 
          
          
          
        
      316. 
      
        
    316. 
          1
          
                  def security_matches?(env, options)
        
      317. 
      
        
    317. 
          9
          
                    return true unless options[:secure]
        
      318. 
      
        
    318. 
          
          
                    request = Rack::Request.new(env)
        
      319. 
      
        
    319.

      320.

      321. 
      
        
    321. 
          
          
          
        
      322. 
      
        
    322. 
          
          
                  # Acquires the session from the environment and the session id from
        
      323. 
      
        
    323. 
          
          
                  # the session options and passes them to #set_session. If successful
        
      324. 
      
        
    324. 
          
          
                  # and the :defer option is not true, a cookie will be added to the
        
      325. 
      
        
    325. 
          
          
                  # response with the session's id.
        
      326. 
      
        
    326. 
          
          
          
        
      327. 
      
        
    327. 
          1
          
                  def commit_session(env, status, headers, body)
        
      328. 
      
        
    328. 
          9
          
                    session = env[ENV_SESSION_KEY]
        
      329. 
      
        
    329. 
          9
          
                    options = session.options
        
      330. 
      
        
    330. 
          
          
          
        
      331. 
      
        
    331. 
          9
          
                    if options[:drop] || options[:renew]
        
      332. 
      
        
    332. 
          
          
                      session_id = destroy_session(env, session.id || generate_sid, options)
        
      333. 
      
        
    333. 
          
          
                      return [status, headers, body] unless session_id
        
      334. 
      
        
    334. 
          
          
                    end
        
      335. 
      
        
    335. 
          
          
          
        
      336. 
      
        
    336. 
          9
          
                    return [status, headers, body] unless commit_session?(env, session, options)
        
      337. 
      
        
    337. 
          
          
          
        
      338. 
      
        
    338. 
          9
          
                    session.send(:load!) unless loaded_session?(session)
        
      339. 
      
        
    339. 
          9
          
                    session_id ||= session.id
        
      340. 
      
        
    340. 
          48
          
                    session_data = session.to_hash.delete_if { |k,v| v.nil? }
        
      341. 
      
        
    341. 
          
          
          
        
      342. 
      
        
    342. 
          9
          
                    if not data = set_session(env, session_id, session_data, options)
        
      343. 
      
        
    343. 
          
          
                      env["rack.errors"].puts("Warning! #{self.class.name} failed to save session. Content dropped.")
        
      344. 
      
        
    344. 
          
          
                    elsif options[:defer] and not options[:renew]
        
      345. 
      
        
    345. 
          
          
                      env["rack.errors"].puts("Deferring cookie for #{session_id}") if $VERBOSE
        
      346. 
      
        
    346. 
          
          
                    else
        
      347. 
      
        
    347. 
          9
          
                      cookie = Hash.new
        
      348. 
      
        
    348. 
          9
          
                      cookie[:value] = data
        
      349. 
      
        
    349. 
          9
          
                      cookie[:expires] = Time.now + options[:expire_after] if options[:expire_after]
        
      350. 
      
        
    350. 
          9
          
                      cookie[:expires] = Time.now + options[:max_age] if options[:max_age]
        
      351. 
      
        
    351. 
          9
          
                      set_cookie(env, headers, cookie.merge!(options))
        
      352. 
      
        
    352. 
          
          
                    end
        
      353. 
      
        
    353. 
          
          
          
        
      354. 
      
        
    354. 
          9
          
                    [status, headers, body]
        
      355. 
      
        
    355. 
          
          
                  end
        
      356. 
      
        
    356. 
          
          
          
        
      357. 
      
        
    357. 
          
          
                  # Sets the cookie back to the client with session id. We skip the cookie
        
      358. 
      
        
    358. 
          
          
                  # setting if the value didn't change (sid is the same) or expires was given.
        
      359. 
      
        
    359. 
          
          
          
        
      360. 
      
        
    360. 
          1
          
                  def set_cookie(env, headers, cookie)
        
      361. 
      
        
    361. 
          9
          
                    request = Rack::Request.new(env)
        
      362. 
      
        
    362. 
          9
          
                    if request.cookies[@key] != cookie[:value] || cookie[:expires]
        
      363. 
      
        
    363. 
          9
          
                      Utils.set_cookie_header!(headers, @key, cookie)
        
      364. 
      
        
    364. 
          
          
                    end
        
      365. 
      
        
    365. 
          
          
                  end
        
      366. 
      
        
    366. 
          
          
          
        
      367.

      374. 
      
        
    374.

      375.

                  # should occur within.
        
      377.

      7. 
      
        
    7. 
          1
          
          module Rack
        
      8. 
      
        
    8. 
          
          
          
        
      9. 
      
        
    9. 
          1
          
            module Session
        
      10. 
      
        
    10. 
          
          
          
        
      11. 
      
        
    11. 
          
          
              # Rack::Session::Cookie provides simple cookie based session management.
        
      12. 
      
        
    12. 
          
          
              # By default, the session is a Ruby Hash stored as base64 encoded marshalled
        
      13. 
      
        
    13. 
          
          
              # data set to :key (default: rack.session).  The object that encodes the
        
      14. 
      
        
    14. 
          
          
              # session data is configurable and must respond to +encode+ and +decode+.
        
      15. 
      
        
    15. 
          
          
              # Both methods must take a string and return a string.
        
      16. 
      
        
    16. 
          
          
              #
        
      17. 
      
        
    17. 
          
          
              # When the secret key is set, cookie data is checked for data integrity.
        
      18. 
      
        
    18. 
          
          
              # The old secret key is also accepted and allows graceful secret rotation.
        
      19. 
      
        
    19. 
          
          
              #
        
      20. 
      
        
    20. 
          
          
              # Example:
        
      21. 
      
        
    21. 
          
          
              #
        
      22. 
      
        
    22. 
          
          
              #     use Rack::Session::Cookie, :key => 'rack.session',
        
      23. 
      
        
    23. 
          
          
              #                                :domain => 'foo.com',
        
      24. 
      
        
    24. 
          
          
              #                                :path => '/',
        
      25. 
      
        
    25. 
          
          
              #                                :expire_after => 2592000,
        
      26. 
      
        
    26. 
          
          
              #                                :secret => 'change_me',
        
      27. 
      
        
    27. 
          
          
              #                                :old_secret => 'also_change_me'
        
      28. 
      
        
    28. 
          
          
              #
        
      29. 
      
        
    29. 
          
          
              #     All parameters are optional.
        
      30. 
      
        
    30. 
          
          
              #
        
      31. 
      
        
    31. 
          
          
              # Example of a cookie with no encoding:
        
      32. 
      
        
    32. 
          
          
              #
        
      33. 
      
        
    33. 
          
          
              #   Rack::Session::Cookie.new(application, {
        
      34. 
      
        
    34. 
          
          
              #     :coder => Rack::Session::Cookie::Identity.new
        
      35. 
      
        
    35. 
          
          
              #   })
        
      36. 
      
        
    36. 
          
          
              #
        
      37. 
      
        
    37. 
          
          
              # Example of a cookie with custom encoding:
        
      38. 
      
        
    38. 
          
          
              #
        
      39. 
      
        
    39. 
          
          
              #   Rack::Session::Cookie.new(application, {
        
      40. 
      
        
    40. 
          
          
              #     :coder => Class.new {
        
      41. 
      
        
    41. 
          
          
              #       def encode(str); str.reverse; end
        
      42. 
      
        
    42. 
          
          
              #       def decode(str); str.reverse; end
        
      43. 
      
        
    43. 
          
          
              #     }.new
        
      44. 
      
        
    44. 
          
          
              #   })
        
      45. 
      
        
    45. 
          
          
              #
        
      46. 
      
        
    46. 
          
          
          
        
      47. 
      
        
    47. 
          1
          
              class Cookie < Abstract::ID
        
      48. 
      
        
    48. 
          
          
                # Encode session cookies as Base64
        
      49. 
      
        
    49. 
          1
          
                class Base64
        
      50. 
      
        
    50. 
          1
          
                  def encode(str)
        
      51. 
      
        
    51. 
          9
          
                    [str].pack('m')
        
      52. 
      
        
    52. 
          
          
                  end
        
      53. 
      
        
    53. 
          
          
          
        
      54. 
      
        
    54. 
          1
          
                  def decode(str)
        
      55. 
      
        
    55. 
          
          
                    str.unpack('m').first
        
      56. 
      
        
    56. 
          
          
                  end
        
      57. 
      
        
    57. 
          
          
          
        
      58. 
      
        
    58. 
          
          
                  # Encode session cookies as Marshaled Base64 data
        
      59. 
      
        
    59. 
          1
          
                  class Marshal < Base64
        
      60. 
      
        
    60. 
          1
          
                    def encode(str)
        
      61. 
      
        
    61. 
          9

                def initialize(app, options={})

          9

      108. 
      
        
    108. 
          
          
                  SECURITY WARNING: No secret option provided to Rack::Session::Cookie.
        
      109. 
      
        
    109. 
          
          
                  This poses a security threat. It is strongly recommended that you
        
      110. 
      
        
    110. 
          
          
                  provide a secret to prevent exploits that may be possible from crafted
        
      111. 
      
        
    111. 
          
          
                  cookies. This will not be supported in future versions of Rack, and
        
      112. 
      
        
    112. 
          
          
                  future versions will even invalidate your existing user cookies.
        
      113.

                def unpacked_cookie_data(env)
        
      133. 
      
        
    133. 
          18
          
                  env["rack.session.unpacked_cookie_data"] ||= begin
        
      134. 
      
        
    134. 
          9
          
                    request = Rack::Request.new(env)
        
      135. 
      
        
    135. 
          9
          
                    session_data = request.cookies[@key]
        
      136. 
      
        
    136. 
          
          
          
        
      137. 
      
        
    137. 
          9
          
                    if @secrets.size > 0 && session_data
        
      138. 
      
        
    138. 
          
          
                      digest, session_data = session_data.reverse.split("--", 2)
        
      139. 
      
        
    139. 
          
          
                      digest.reverse! if digest
        
      140. 
      
        
    140. 
          
          
                      session_data.reverse! if session_data
        
      141. 
      
        
    141. 
          
          
                      session_data = nil unless digest_match?(session_data, digest)
        
      142. 
      
        
    142. 
          
          
                    end
        
      143. 
      
        
    143. 
          
          
          
        
      144. 
      
        
    144. 
          9

      145. 
      
        
    145.

      146. 
      
        
    146. 
          
          
                end
        
      147. 
      
        
    147.

                def persistent_session_id!(data, sid=nil)
        
      149. 
      
        
    149. 
          9
          
                  data ||= {}
        
      150. 
      
        
    150. 
          9
          
                  data["session_id"] ||= sid || generate_sid
        
      151. 
      
        
    151. 
          9
          
                  data
        
      152. 
      
        
    152. 
          
          
                end
        
      153. 
      
        
    153. 
          
          
          
        
      154. 
      
        
    154. 
          1
          
                def set_session(env, session_id, session, options)
        
      155. 
      
        
    155. 
          9
          
                  session = session.merge("session_id" => session_id)
        
      156. 
      
        
    156. 
          9
          
                  session_data = coder.encode(session)
        
      157. 
      
        
    157. 
          
          
          
        
      158. 
      
        
    158. 
          9
          
                  if @secrets.first
        
      159. 
      
        
    159. 
          9
          
                    session_data << "--#{generate_hmac(session_data, @secrets.first)}"
        
      160. 
      
        
    160. 
          
          
                  end
        
      161. 
      
        
    161. 
          
          
          
        
      162. 
      
        
    162. 
          9
          
                  if session_data.size > (4096 - @key.size)
        
      163. 
      
        
    163. 
          
          
                    env["rack.errors"].puts("Warning! Rack::Session::Cookie data size exceeds 4K.")
        
      164. 
      
        
    164. 
          
          
                    nil
        
      165. 
      
        
    165. 
          
          
                  else
        
      166. 
      
        
    166. 
          9
          
                    session_data
        
      167. 
      
        
    167. 
          
          
                  end
        
      168. 
      
        
    168. 
          
          
                end
        
      169. 
      
        
    169. 
          
          
          
        
      170. 
      
        
    170. 
          1
          
                def destroy_session(env, session_id, options)
        
      171. 
      
        
    171. 
          
          
                  # Nothing to do here, data is in the client
        
      172. 
      
        
    172. 
          
          
                  generate_sid unless options[:drop]
        
      173. 
      
        
    173. 
          
          
                end
        
      174. 
      
        
    174. 
          
          
          
        
      175. 
      
        
    175. 
          1
          
                def digest_match?(data, digest)
        
      176. 
      
        
    176. 
          
          
                  return unless data && digest
        
      177. 
      
        
    177. 
          
          
                  @secrets.any? do |secret|
        
      178. 
      
        
    178. 
          
          
                    Rack::Utils.secure_compare(digest, generate_hmac(data, secret))
        
      179. 
      
        
    179. 
          
          
                  end
        
      180. 
      
        
    180. 
          
          
                end
        
      181. 
      
        
    181. 
          
          
          
        
      182. 
      
        
    182. 
          1
          
                def generate_hmac(data, secret)
        
      183. 
      
        
    183. 
          9
          
                  OpenSSL::HMAC.hexdigest(OpenSSL::Digest::SHA1.new, secret, data)
        
      184. 
      
        
    184. 
          
          
                end
        
      185. 
      
        
    185. 
          
          
          
        
      186. 
      
        
    186. 
          
          
              end
        
      187. 
      
        
    187. 
          
          
            end
        
      188. 
      
        
    188. 
          
          
          end

    1. 
          1
          
          require 'rack/protection'
        
      2. 
      
        
    2. 
          
          
          
        
      3. 
      
        
    3. 
          1
          
          module Rack
        
      4. 
      
        
    4. 
          1
          
            module Protection
        
      5. 
      
        
    5. 
          
          
              ##
        
      6. 
      
        
    6. 
          
          
              # Prevented attack::   CSRF
        
      7. 
      
        
    7. 
          
          
              # Supported browsers:: all
        
      8. 
      
        
    8. 
          
          
              # More infos::         http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cross-site_request_forgery
        
      9. 
      
        
    9. 
          
          
              #
        
      10. 
      
        
    10. 
          
          
              # Only accepts unsafe HTTP requests if a given access token matches the token
        
      11. 
      
        
    11. 
          
          
              # included in the session.
        
      12. 
      
        
    12. 
          
          
              #
        
      13. 
      
        
    13. 
          
          
              # Compatible with Rails and rack-csrf.
        
      14. 
      
        
    14. 
          
          
              #
        
      15. 
      
        
    15. 
          
          
              # Options:
        
      16. 
      
        
    16. 
          
          
              #
        
      17. 
      
        
    17. 
          
          
              # authenticity_param: Defines the param's name that should contain the token on a request.
        
      18. 
      
        
    18. 
          
          
              #
        
      19. 
      
        
    19. 
          1
          
              class AuthenticityToken < Base
        
      20. 
      
        
    20. 
          1
          
                default_options :authenticity_param => 'authenticity_token'
        
      21. 
      
        
    21. 
          
          
          
        
      22. 
      
        
    22. 
          1
          
                def accepts?(env)
        
      23. 
      
        
    23. 
          9
          
                  session = session env
        
      24. 
      
        
    24. 
          9
          
                  token   = session[:csrf] ||= session['_csrf_token'] || random_string
        
      25. 
      
        
    25. 
          
          
                  safe?(env) ||
        
      26. 
      
        
    26. 
          9
          
                    env['HTTP_X_CSRF_TOKEN'] == token ||
        
      27. 
      
        
    27. 
          
          
                    Request.new(env).params[options[:authenticity_param]] == token
        
      28. 
      
        
    28. 
          
          
                end
        
      29. 
      
        
    29. 
          
          
              end
        
      30. 
      
        
    30. 
          
          
            end

                def referrer(env)

                def origin(env)

    103. 
          1
          
                def random_string(secure = defined? SecureRandom)
        
      104. 
      
        
    104. 
          9
          
                  secure ? SecureRandom.hex(16) : "%032x" % rand(2**128-1)
        
      105. 
      
        
    105. 
          
          
                rescue NotImplementedError
        
      106. 
      
        
    106. 
          
          
                  random_string false
        
      107. 
      
        
    107. 
          
          
                end
        
      108.

      109.

                def encrypt(value)

    111. 
          
          
                end

                def cleanup(path)
        
      22. 
      
        
    22. 
          9
          
                  if path.respond_to?(:encoding)
        
      23. 
      
        
    23. 
          
          
                    # Ruby 1.9+ M17N
        
      24. 
      
        
    24. 
          9

      25. 
      
        
    25. 
          9
          
                    dot   = '.'.encode(encoding)
        
      26. 
      
        
    26. 
          9
          
                    slash = '/'.encode(encoding)
        
      27. 
      
        
    27. 
          
          
                  else
        
      28. 
      
        
    28. 
          
          
                    # Ruby 1.8
        
      29. 
      
        
    29. 
          
          
                    dot   = '.'
        
      30. 
      
        
    30. 
          
          
                    slash = '/'
        
      31. 
      
        
    31. 
          
          
                  end
        
      32. 
      
        
    32. 
          
          
          
        
      33. 
      
        
    33. 
          9
          
                  parts     = []
        
      34. 
      
        
    34. 
          9
          
                  unescaped = path.gsub(/%2e/i, dot).gsub(/%2f/i, slash)
        
      35. 
      
        
    35. 
          
          
          
        
      36. 
      
        
    36. 
          9
          
                  unescaped.split(slash).each do |part|
        
      37. 
      
        
    37. 
          27
          
                    next if part.empty? or part == dot
        
      38. 
      
        
    38. 
          18
          
                    part == '..' ? parts.pop : parts << part
        
      39. 
      
        
    39. 
          
          
                  end
        
      40. 
      
        
    40. 
          
          
          
        
      41. 
      
        
    41. 
          9
          
                  cleaned = slash + parts.join(slash)
        
      42. 
      
        
    42. 
          9

      43. 
      
        
    43. 
          9
          
                  cleaned
        
      44. 
      
        
    44. 
          
          
                end

    path/gems/rack-protection-1.5.3/lib/rack/protection/session_hijacking.rb

    93.75 % covered

    16 relevant lines. 15 lines covered and 1 lines missed. 
        
      
      
        
    1. 
          1
          
          require 'rack/protection'
        
      2. 
      
        
    2. 
          
          
          
        
      3. 
      
        
    3. 
          1
          
          module Rack
        
      4. 
      
        
    4. 
          1
          
            module Protection
        
      5. 
      
        
    5. 
          
          
              ##
        
      6. 
      
        
    6. 
          
          
              # Prevented attack::   Session Hijacking
        
      7. 
      
        
    7. 
          
          
              # Supported browsers:: all
        
      8. 
      
        
    8. 
          
          
              # More infos::         http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Session_hijacking
        
      9. 
      
        
    9. 
          
          
              #
        
      10. 
      
        
    10. 
          
          
              # Tracks request properties like the user agent in the session and empties
        
      11. 
      
        
    11. 
          
          
              # the session if those properties change. This essentially prevents attacks
        
      12. 
      
        
    12. 
          
          
              # from Firesheep. Since all headers taken into consideration can be
        
      13. 
      
        
    13. 
          
          
              # spoofed, too, this will not prevent determined hijacking attempts.
        
      14. 
      
        
    14. 
          1
          
              class SessionHijacking < Base
        
      15. 
      
        
    15. 
          1
          
                default_reaction :drop_session
        
      16. 
      
        
    16. 
          1
          
                default_options :tracking_key => :tracking, :encrypt_tracking => true,
        
      17. 
      
        
    17. 
          
          
                  :track => %w[HTTP_USER_AGENT HTTP_ACCEPT_LANGUAGE]
        
      18. 
      
        
    18. 
          
          
          
        
      19. 
      
        
    19. 
          1
          
                def accepts?(env)
        
      20. 
      
        
    20. 
          9
          
                  session = session env
        
      21. 
      
        
    21. 
          9
          
                  key     = options[:tracking_key]
        
      22. 
      
        
    22. 
          9
          
                  if session.include? key
        
      23. 
      
        
    23. 
          
          
                    session[key].all? { |k,v| v == encrypt(env[k]) }
        
      24. 
      
        
    24. 
          
          
                  else
        
      25. 
      
        
    25. 
          9
          
                    session[key] = {}
        
      26. 
      
        
    26. 
          27
          
                    options[:track].each { |k| session[key][k] = encrypt(env[k]) }
        
      27. 
      
        
    27. 
          
          
                  end
        
      28. 
      
        
    28. 
          
          
                end
        
      29. 
      
        
    29. 
          
          
          
        
      30. 
      
        
    30. 
          1
          
                def encrypt(value)
        
      31. 
      
        
    31. 
          18
          
                  value = value.to_s.downcase
        
      32. 
      
        
    32. 
          18
          
                  options[:encrypt_tracking] ? super(value) : value
        
      33. 
      
        
    33. 
          
          
                end
        
      34. 
      
        
    34. 
          
          
              end
        
      35. 
      
        
    35. 
          
          
            end
        
      36. 
      
        
    36. 
          
          
          end
        
      37.

    path/gems/rack-protection-1.5.3/lib/rack/protection/xss_header.rb

            module Protection

              ##
        
      6. 
      
        
    6. 
          
          
              # Prevented attack::   Non-permanent XSS
        
      7. 
      
        
    7. 
          
          
              # Supported browsers:: Internet Explorer 8 and later
        
      8.
