    1. 
          1
          
          module RSpec
        
      2. 
      
        
    2. 
          1
          
            module Matchers
        
      3. 
      
        
    3. 
          1
          
              module BuiltIn
        
      4. 
      
        
    4. 
          
          
                # @api private
        
      5. 
      
        
    5. 
          
          
                #
        
      6. 
      
        
    6. 
          
          
                # Used _internally_ as a base class for matchers that ship with
        
      7. 
      
        
    7. 
          
          
                # rspec-expectations and rspec-rails.
        
      8. 
      
        
    8. 
          
          
                #
        
      9. 
      
        
    9. 
          
          
                # ### Warning:
        
      10. 
      
        
    10. 
          
          
                #
        
      11. 
      
        
    11. 
          
          
                # This class is for internal use, and subject to change without notice.
        
      12. 
      
        
    12. 
          
          
                # We strongly recommend that you do not base your custom matchers on this
        
      13. 
      
        
    13. 
          
          
                # class. If/when this changes, we will announce it and remove this warning.
        
      14. 
      
        
    14. 
          1
          
                class BaseMatcher
        
      15. 
      
        
    15. 
          1
          
                  include RSpec::Matchers::Composable
        
      16. 
      
        
    16. 
          
          
          
        
      17. 
      
        
    17. 
          
          
                  # @api private
        
      18. 
      
        
    18. 
          
          
                  # Used to detect when no arg is passed to `initialize`.
        
      19. 
      
        
    19. 
          
          
                  # `nil` cannot be used because it's a valid value to pass.
        
      20. 
      
        
    20. 
          1
          
                  UNDEFINED = Object.new.freeze
        
      21. 
      
        
    21. 
          
          
          
        
      22. 
      
        
    22. 
          
          
                  # @private
        
      23. 
      
        
    23. 
          1
          
                  attr_reader :actual, :expected, :rescued_exception
        
      24. 
      
        
    24. 
          
          
          
        
      25. 
      
        
    25. 
          1
          
                  def initialize(expected=UNDEFINED)
        
      26. 
      
        
    26. 
          6
          
                    @expected = expected unless UNDEFINED.equal?(expected)
        
      27. 
      
        
    27. 
          
          
                  end
        
      28. 
      
        
    28. 
          
          
          
        
      29. 
      
        
    29. 
          
          
                  # @api private
        
      30. 
      
        
    30. 
          
          
                  # Indicates if the match is successful. Delegates to `match`, which
        
      31. 
      
        
    31. 
          
          
                  # should be defined on a subclass. Takes care of consistently
        
      32. 
      
        
    32. 
          
          
                  # initializing the `actual` attribute.
        
      33. 
      
        
    33. 
          1
          
                  def matches?(actual)
        
      34. 
      
        
    34. 
          6
          
                    @actual = actual
        
      35. 
      
        
    35. 
          6
          
                    match(expected, actual)
        
      36.

                  # @api private

                  # Used to wrap a block of code that will indicate failure by

      41.

      44.

                  def match_unless_raises(*exceptions)
        
      45. 
      
        
    45. 
          
          
                    exceptions.unshift Exception if exceptions.empty?
        
      46. 
      
        
    46.

                      yield

                  # @api private

      56.

                  def description
        
      58. 
      
        
    58.

      69. 
      
        
    69. 
          
          
          
        
      70. 
      
        
    70. 
          
          
                  # @api private
        
      71. 
      
        
    71. 
          
          
                  # Most matchers are value matchers (i.e. meant to work with `expect(value)`)
        
      72. 
      
        
    72. 
          
          
                  # rather than block matchers (i.e. meant to work with `expect { }`), so
        
      73. 
      
        
    73. 
          
          
                  # this defaults to false. Block matchers must override this to return true.
        
      74. 
      
        
    74. 
          1

                  def self.matcher_name
        
      95. 
      
        
    95. 
          
          
                    @matcher_name ||= underscore(name.split('::').last)

                  # @private
        
      99. 
      
        
    99. 
          
          
                  # Borrowed from ActiveSupport.
        
      100. 
      
        
    100. 
          1
          
                  def self.underscore(camel_cased_word)
        
      101. 
      
        
    101. 
          
          
                    word = camel_cased_word.to_s.dup
        
      102. 
      
        
    102. 
          
          
                    word.gsub!(/([A-Z]+)([A-Z][a-z])/, '\1_\2')
        
      103. 
      
        
    103. 
          
          
                    word.gsub!(/([a-z\d])([A-Z])/, '\1_\2')
        
      104. 
      
        
    104. 
          
          
                    word.tr!('-', '_')
        
      105. 
      
        
    105. 
          
          
                    word.downcase!
        
      106. 
      
        
    106. 
          
          
                    word
        
      107. 
      
        
    107. 
          
          
                  end
        
      108. 
      
        
    108. 
          1
          
                  private_class_method :underscore
        
      109. 
      
        
    109. 
          
          
          
        
      110. 
      
        
    110. 
          1
          
                private
        
      111. 
      
        
    111. 
          
          
          
        
      112. 
      
        
    112. 
          1
          
                  def assert_ivars(*expected_ivars)
        
      113. 
      
        
    113. 
          
          
                    return unless (expected_ivars - present_ivars).any?
        
      114. 
      
        
    114. 
          
          
                    ivar_list = EnglishPhrasing.list(expected_ivars)
        
      115. 
      
        
    115. 
          
          
                    raise "#{self.class.name} needs to supply#{ivar_list}"
        
      116. 
      
        
    116. 
          
          
                  end
        
      117. 
      
        
    117. 
          
          
          
        
      118. 
      
        
    118. 
          1
          
                  if RUBY_VERSION.to_f < 1.9
        
      119.

                    # :nocov:
        
      120. 
      
        
    120. 
          
          skipped

      122. 
      
        
    122.

                  # @private
        
      129. 
      
        
    129. 
          1
          
                  module HashFormatting
        
      130. 
      
        
    130. 
          
          
                    # `{ :a => 5, :b => 2 }.inspect` produces:
        
      131. 
      
        
    131. 
          
          
                    #
        
      132. 
      
        
    132. 
          
          
                    #     {:a=>5, :b=>2}
        
      133. 
      
        
    133. 
          
          
                    #
        
      134. 
      
        
    134. 
          
          
                    # ...but it looks much better as:
        
      135. 
      
        
    135. 
          
          
                    #
        
      136. 
      
        
    136. 
          
          
                    #     {:a => 5, :b => 2}
        
      137. 
      
        
    137. 
          
          
                    #
        
      138. 
      
        
    138. 
          
          
                    # This is idempotent and safe to run on a string multiple times.
        
      139. 
      
        
    139. 
          1
          
                    def improve_hash_formatting(inspect_string)
        
      140. 
      
        
    140. 
          
          
                      inspect_string.gsub(/(\S)=>(\S)/, '\1 => \2')
        
      141. 
      
        
    141. 
          
          
                    end
        
      142. 
      
        
    142. 
          1
          
                    module_function :improve_hash_formatting
        
      143. 
      
        
    143. 
          
          
                  end
        
      144. 
      
        
    144. 
          
          
          
        
      145. 
      
        
    145. 
          1
          
                  include HashFormatting
        
      146. 
      
        
    146. 
          
          
          
        
      147. 
      
        
    147. 
          
          
                  # @api private
        
      148. 
      
        
    148. 
          
          
                  # Provides default implementations of failure messages, based on the `description`.
        
      149. 
      
        
    149. 
          1
          
                  module DefaultFailureMessages
        
      150. 
      
        
    150. 
          
          
                    # @api private
        
      151. 
      
        
    151. 
          
          
                    # Provides a good generic failure message. Based on `description`.
        
      152. 
      
        
    152. 
          
          
                    # When subclassing, if you are not satisfied with this failure message
        
      153. 
      
        
    153. 
          
          
                    # you often only need to override `description`.
        
      154. 
      
        
    154. 
          
          
                    # @return [String]
        
      155. 
      
        
    155. 
          1
          
                    def failure_message
        
      156. 
      
        
    156. 
          
          
                      "expected #{description_of @actual} to #{description}"
        
      157. 
      
        
    157. 
          
          
                    end
        
      158. 
      
        
    158. 
          
          
          
        
      159. 
      
        
    159. 
          
          
                    # @api private
        
      160. 
      
        
    160. 
          
          
                    # Provides a good generic negative failure message. Based on `description`.
        
      161. 
      
        
    161. 
          
          
                    # When subclassing, if you are not satisfied with this failure message
        
      162. 
      
        
    162. 
          
          
                    # you often only need to override `description`.
        
      163. 
      
        
    163. 
          
          
                    # @return [String]
        
      164. 
      
        
    164. 
          1
          
                    def failure_message_when_negated
        
      165. 
      
        
    165. 
          
          
                      "expected #{description_of @actual} not to #{description}"
        
      166. 
      
        
    166. 
          
          
                    end
        
      167. 
      
        
    167. 
          
          
          
        
      168. 
      
        
    168. 
          
          
                    # @private
        
      169. 
      
        
    169. 
          1
          
                    def self.has_default_failure_messages?(matcher)
        
      170. 
      
        
    170. 
          
          
                      matcher.method(:failure_message).owner == self &&
        
      171. 
      
        
    171. 
          
          
                        matcher.method(:failure_message_when_negated).owner == self
        
      172. 
      
        
    172. 
          
          
                    rescue NameError
        
      173. 
      
        
    173. 
          
          
                      false
        
      174. 
      
        
    174. 
          
          
                    end
        
      175. 
      
        
    175. 
          
          
                  end
        
      176. 
      
        
    176. 
          
          
          
        
      177. 
      
        
    177. 
          1
          
                  include DefaultFailureMessages
        
      178. 
      
        
    178. 
          
          
                end
        
      179. 
      
        
    179. 
          
          
              end
        
      180. 
      
        
    180. 
          
          
            end
        
      181. 
      
        
    181. 
          
          
          end
        
      182.

          1
          
                  [:==, :<, :<=, :>=, :>, :===, :=~].each do |operator|
        
      121. 
      
        
    121. 
          7
          
                    define_method operator do |operand|
        
      122.

                      BeComparedTo.new(operand, operator)

                  def predicate_accessible?

          1
          
                  if String === methods.first

    225.

      226. 
      
        
    226. 
          
          skipped
                    def private_predicate?

      228. 
      
        
    228. 
          
          skipped

      229.

      230.

    231. 
          1

      233.

      235.

                  def predicate_matches?

      266.

                  def validity_message

    268. 
          
          
                    return nil if predicate_accessible?
        
      269. 
      
        
    269. 
          
          
          
        
      270.

    271. 
          
          
          
        
      272. 
      
        
    272.

    273.

      274. 
      
        
    274. 
          
          
                    elsif predicate == :true?
        
      275. 
      
        
    275. 
          
          
                      msg << " or perhaps you meant `be true` or `be_truthy`"
        
      276. 
      
        
    276. 
          
          
                    elsif predicate == :false?
        
      277. 
      
        
    277.

      278.

      279.

      280.

                  def negative_failure_reason

                # Used to specify a relative change.
        
      107.

                # @api private
        
      108. 
      
        
    108. 
          1
          
                class ChangeRelatively < BaseMatcher
        
      109. 
      
        
    109. 
          1
          
                  def initialize(change_details, expected_delta, relativity, &comparer)
        
      110. 
      
        
    110. 
          6
          
                    @change_details = change_details
        
      111. 
      
        
    111. 
          6
          
                    @expected_delta = expected_delta
        
      112. 
      
        
    112. 
          6
          
                    @relativity     = relativity
        
      113. 
      
        
    113. 
          6
          
                    @comparer       = comparer
        
      114. 
      
        
    114. 
          
          
                  end
        
      115. 
      
        
    115. 
          
          
          
        
      116. 
      
        
    116. 
          
          
                  # @private
        
      117. 
      
        
    117. 
          1
          
                  def failure_message
        
      118. 
      
        
    118. 
          
          
                    "expected #{@change_details.message} to have changed " \
        
      119. 
      
        
    119. 
          
          
                    "#{@relativity.to_s.tr('_', ' ')} " \
        
      120. 
      
        
    120. 
          
          
                    "#{description_of @expected_delta}, but #{failure_reason}"
        
      121. 
      
        
    121. 
          
          
                  end
        
      122. 
      
        
    122. 
          
          
          
        
      123. 
      
        
    123. 
          
          
                  # @private
        
      124. 
      
        
    124. 
          1
          
                  def matches?(event_proc)
        
      125. 
      
        
    125. 
          6
          
                    @event_proc = event_proc
        
      126. 
      
        
    126. 
          6
          
                    return false unless Proc === event_proc
        
      127. 
      
        
    127. 
          6
          
                    @change_details.perform_change(event_proc)
        
      128. 
      
        
    128. 
          6
          
                    @comparer.call(@change_details.actual_delta)
        
      129. 
      
        
    129. 
          
          
                  end
        
      130. 
      
        
    130. 
          
          
          
        
      131.

                  def description

                  def failure_reason
        
      151. 
      
        
    151. 
          
          
                    return "was not given a block" unless Proc === @event_proc
        
      152.

                    "was changed by #{description_of @change_details.actual_delta}"
        
      153.

                # @api private
        
      157. 
      
        
    157. 
          
          
                # Base class for specifying a change from and/or to specific values.
        
      158. 
      
        
    158. 
          1
          
                class SpecificValuesChange < BaseMatcher
        
      159. 
      
        
    159. 
          
          
                  # @private
        
      160. 
      
        
    160. 
          1
          
                  MATCH_ANYTHING = ::Object.ancestors.last
        
      161. 
      
        
    161. 
          
          
          
        
      162. 
      
        
    162. 
          1
          
                  def initialize(change_details, from, to)
        
      163. 
      
        
    163. 
          
          
                    @change_details  = change_details
        
      164. 
      
        
    164. 
          
          
                    @expected_before = from
        
      165. 
      
        
    165. 
          
          
                    @expected_after  = to
        
      166. 
      
        
    166. 
          
          
                  end
        
      167. 
      
        
    167. 
          
          
          
        
      168. 
      
        
    168. 
          
          
                  # @private
        
      169. 
      
        
    169. 
          1
          
                  def matches?(event_proc)
        
      170. 
      
        
    170. 
          
          
                    @event_proc = event_proc
        
      171. 
      
        
    171. 
          
          
                    return false unless Proc === event_proc
        
      172. 
      
        
    172. 
          
          
                    @change_details.perform_change(event_proc)
        
      173. 
      
        
    173. 
          
          
                    @change_details.changed? && matches_before? && matches_after?
        
      174. 
      
        
    174. 
          
          
                  end
        
      175. 
      
        
    175. 
          
          
          
        
      176. 
      
        
    176. 
          
          
                  # @private
        
      177. 
      
        
    177. 
          1
          
                  def description
        
      178. 
      
        
    178. 
          
          
                    "change #{@change_details.message} #{change_description}"
        
      179. 
      
        
    179. 
          
          
                  end
        
      180. 
      
        
    180. 
          
          
          
        
      181. 
      
        
    181. 
          
          
                  # @private
        
      182. 
      
        
    182. 
          1
          
                  def failure_message
        
      183. 
      
        
    183. 
          
          
                    return not_given_a_block_failure unless Proc === @event_proc
        
      184. 
      
        
    184. 
          
          
                    return before_value_failure      unless matches_before?
        
      185. 
      
        
    185. 
          
          
                    return did_not_change_failure    unless @change_details.changed?
        
      186. 
      
        
    186. 
          
          
                    after_value_failure
        
      187. 
      
        
    187. 
          
          
                  end
        
      188. 
      
        
    188. 
          
          
          
        
      189. 
      
        
    189. 
          
          
                  # @private
        
      190. 
      
        
    190. 
          1
          
                  def supports_block_expectations?
        
      191. 
      
        
    191. 
          
          
                    true
        
      192. 
      
        
    192. 
          
          
                  end
        
      193. 
      
        
    193. 
          
          
          
        
      194. 
      
        
    194. 
          1
          
                private
        
      195. 
      
        
    195. 
          
          
          
        
      196. 
      
        
    196. 
          1
          
                  def matches_before?
        
      197. 
      
        
    197. 
          
          
                    values_match?(@expected_before, @change_details.actual_before)
        
      198. 
      
        
    198. 
          
          
                  end
        
      199. 
      
        
    199. 
          
          
          
        
      200. 
      
        
    200. 
          1
          
                  def matches_after?
        
      201. 
      
        
    201. 
          
          
                    values_match?(@expected_after, @change_details.actual_after)
        
      202. 
      
        
    202. 
          
          
                  end
        
      203. 
      
        
    203. 
          
          
          
        
      204. 
      
        
    204. 
          1
          
                  def before_value_failure
        
      205. 
      
        
    205. 
          
          
                    "expected #{@change_details.message} " \
        
      206. 
      
        
    206. 
          
          
                    "to have initially been #{description_of @expected_before}, " \
        
      207. 
      
        
    207. 
          
          
                    "but was #{description_of @change_details.actual_before}"
        
      208. 
      
        
    208. 
          
          
                  end
        
      209. 
      
        
    209. 
          
          
          
        
      210. 
      
        
    210. 
          1
          
                  def after_value_failure
        
      211. 
      
        
    211. 
          
          
                    "expected #{@change_details.message} " \
        
      212. 
      
        
    212. 
          
          
                    "to have changed to #{description_of @expected_after}, " \
        
      213. 
      
        
    213. 
          
          
                    "but is now #{description_of @change_details.actual_after}"
        
      214. 
      
        
    214. 
          
          
                  end
        
      215. 
      
        
    215. 
          
          
          
        
      216. 
      
        
    216. 
          1
          
                  def did_not_change_failure
        
      217. 
      
        
    217. 
          
          
                    "expected #{@change_details.message} " \
        
      218. 
      
        
    218. 
          
          
                    "to have changed #{change_description}, but did not change"
        
      219. 
      
        
    219. 
          
          
                  end
        
      220. 
      
        
    220. 
          
          
          
        
      221. 
      
        
    221. 
          1
          
                  def did_change_failure
        
      222. 
      
        
    222. 
          
          
                    "expected #{@change_details.message} not to have changed, but " \
        
      223. 
      
        
    223. 
          
          
                    "did change from #{description_of @change_details.actual_before} " \
        
      224. 
      
        
    224. 
          
          
                    "to #{description_of @change_details.actual_after}"
        
      225. 
      
        
    225. 
          
          
                  end
        
      226. 
      
        
    226. 
          
          
          
        
      227. 
      
        
    227. 
          1
          
                  def not_given_a_block_failure
        
      228. 
      
        
    228. 
          
          
                    "expected #{@change_details.message} to have changed " \
        
      229. 
      
        
    229. 
          
          
                    "#{change_description}, but was not given a block"
        
      230. 
      
        
    230. 
          
          
                  end
        
      231. 
      
        
    231. 
          
          
                end
        
      232. 
      
        
    232. 
          
          
          
        
      233. 
      
        
    233. 
          
          
                # @api private
        
      234. 
      
        
    234. 
          
          
                # Used to specify a change from a specific value
        
      235.

                # (and, optionally, to a specific value).
        
      236. 
      
        
    236. 
          1
          
                class ChangeFromValue < SpecificValuesChange
        
      237. 
      
        
    237. 
          1
          
                  def initialize(change_details, expected_before)
        
      238. 
      
        
    238. 
          
          
                    @description_suffix = nil
        
      239. 
      
        
    239. 
          
          
                    super(change_details, expected_before, MATCH_ANYTHING)
        
      240.

      241. 
      
        
    241. 
          
          
          
        
      242.

                  # @api public
        
      243. 
      
        
    243. 
          
          
                  # Specifies the new value you expect.
        
      244. 
      
        
    244. 
          1
          
                  def to(value)
        
      245. 
      
        
    245. 
          
          
                    @expected_after     = value
        
      246. 
      
        
    246. 
          
          
                    @description_suffix = " to #{description_of value}"
        
      247. 
      
        
    247. 
          
          
                    self
        
      248. 
      
        
    248. 
          
          
                  end
        
      249. 
      
        
    249. 
          
          
          
        
      250. 
      
        
    250. 
          
          
                  # @private
        
      251. 
      
        
    251. 
          1
          
                  def does_not_match?(event_proc)
        
      252. 
      
        
    252. 
          
          
                    if @description_suffix
        
      253. 
      
        
    253. 
          
          
                      raise NotImplementedError, "`expect { }.not_to change { }.to()` " \
        
      254. 
      
        
    254. 
          
          
                        "is not supported"
        
      255. 
      
        
    255. 
          
          
                    end
        
      256. 
      
        
    256. 
          
          
          
        
      257. 
      
        
    257. 
          
          
                    @event_proc = event_proc
        
      258. 
      
        
    258. 
          
          
                    return false unless Proc === event_proc
        
      259. 
      
        
    259. 
          
          
                    @change_details.perform_change(event_proc)
        
      260. 
      
        
    260. 
          
          
                    !@change_details.changed? && matches_before?
        
      261. 
      
        
    261. 
          
          
                  end
        
      262. 
      
        
    262. 
          
          
          
        
      263. 
      
        
    263. 
          
          
                  # @private
        
      264. 
      
        
    264. 
          1
          
                  def failure_message_when_negated
        
      265. 
      
        
    265. 
          
          
                    return not_given_a_block_failure unless Proc === @event_proc
        
      266. 
      
        
    266.

      267. 
      
        
    267. 
          
          
                    did_change_failure
        
      268. 
      
        
    268. 
          
          
                  end
        
      269.

                  def change_description

                # @private
        
      308. 
      
        
    308. 
          
          
                # Encapsulates the details of the before/after values.
        
      309. 
      
        
    309. 
          1
          
                class ChangeDetails
        
      310. 
      
        
    310. 
          1
          
                  attr_reader :message, :actual_before, :actual_after
        
      311. 
      
        
    311. 
          
          
          
        
      312. 
      
        
    312. 
          1
          
                  def initialize(receiver=nil, message=nil, &block)
        
      313. 
      
        
    313. 
          6
          
                    if receiver && !message
        
      314. 
      
        
    314. 
          
          
                      raise(
        
      315. 
      
        
    315. 
          
          
                        ArgumentError,
        
      316. 
      
        
    316. 
          
          
                        "`change` requires either an object and message " \
        
      317. 
      
        
    317. 
          
          
                        "(`change(obj, :msg)`) or a block (`change { }`). " \
        
      318. 
      
        
    318. 
          
          
                        "You passed an object but no message."
        
      319. 
      
        
    319. 
          
          
                      )
        
      320. 
      
        
    320. 
          
          
                    end
        
      321. 
      
        
    321. 
          6
          
                    @message    = message ? "##{message}" : "result"
        
      322. 
      
        
    322. 
          18
          
                    @value_proc = block || lambda { receiver.__send__(message) }
        
      323. 
      
        
    323. 
          
          
                  end
        
      324. 
      
        
    324. 
          
          
          
        
      325. 
      
        
    325. 
          1
          
                  def perform_change(event_proc)
        
      326. 
      
        
    326. 
          6
          
                    @actual_before = evaluate_value_proc
        
      327. 
      
        
    327. 
          6
          
                    event_proc.call
        
      328. 
      
        
    328. 
          6
          
                    @actual_after = evaluate_value_proc
        
      329. 
      
        
    329. 
          
          
                  end
        
      330. 
      
        
    330. 
          
          
          
        
      331. 
      
        
    331. 
          1
          
                  def changed?
        
      332. 
      
        
    332. 
          
          
                    @actual_before != @actual_after
        
      333. 
      
        
    333. 
          
          
                  end
        
      334. 
      
        
    334. 
          
          
          
        
      335. 
      
        
    335. 
          1
          
                  def actual_delta
        
      336. 
      
        
    336. 
          6
          
                    @actual_after - @actual_before
        
      337. 
      
        
    337. 
          
          
                  end
        
      338. 
      
        
    338. 
          
          
          
        
      339. 
      
        
    339. 
          1
          
                private
        
      340. 
      
        
    340. 
          
          
          
        
      341. 
      
        
    341. 
          1
          
                  def evaluate_value_proc
        
      342. 
      
        
    342. 
          12
          
                    case val = @value_proc.call
        
      343. 
      
        
    343. 
          
          
                    when IO # enumerable, but we don't want to dup it.
        
      344. 
      
        
    344. 
          
          
                      val
        
      345. 
      
        
    345. 
          
          
                    when Enumerable, String
        
      346. 
      
        
    346. 
          
          
                      val.dup
        
      347. 
      
        
    347. 
          
          
                    else
        
      348. 
      
        
    348. 
          12
          
                      val
        
      349. 
      
        
    349. 
          
          
                    end
        
      350. 
      
        
    350. 
          
          
                  end
        
      351. 
      
        
    351. 
          
          
                end
        
      352. 
      
        
    352. 
          
          
              end
        
      353. 
      
        
    353. 
          
          
            end
        
      354. 
      
        
    354. 
          
          
          end
        
      355.

    path/gems/rspec-expectations-3.4.0/lib/rspec/matchers/built_in/include.rb

            module Matchers

          1
          
              module BuiltIn

                # @api private
        
      5.

                # Provides the implementation for `include`.
        
      6.

          1
          
                class Include < BaseMatcher

                  def initialize(*expected)

                  # @api private

          1
          
                  def matches?(actual)
        
      15. 
      
        
    15. 
          6
          
                    perform_match(actual) { |v| v }
        
      16. 
      
        
    16. 
          
          
                  end
        
      17. 
      
        
    17. 
          
          
          
        
      18. 
      
        
    18. 
          
          
                  # @api private
        
      19.

    20. 
          1
          
                  def does_not_match?(actual)
        
      21. 
      
        
    21. 
          
          
                    perform_match(actual) { |v| !v }
        
      22. 
      
        
    22. 
          
          
                  end
        
      23.

                  def description

    28. 
          
          
                  end

                  # @api private

          1
          
                  def failure_message
        
      33. 
      
        
    33. 
          
          
                    format_failure_message("to") { super }
        
      34. 
      
        
    34. 
          
          
                  end

    38. 
          1
          
                  def failure_message_when_negated

    39. 
          
          
                    format_failure_message("not to") { super }
        
      40. 
      
        
    40. 
          
          
                  end
        
      41.

                  def diffable?

                  end
        
      47.

          1
          
                private
        
      49.

      50. 
      
        
    50. 
          1
          
                  def format_failure_message(preposition)
        
      51. 
      
        
    51. 
          
          
                    if actual.respond_to?(:include?)
        
      52. 
      
        
    52. 
          
          
                      improve_hash_formatting("expected #{description_of @actual} #{preposition} include#{readable_list_of @divergent_items}")
        
      53. 
      
        
    53. 
          
          
                    else
        
      54. 
      
        
    54. 
          
          
                      improve_hash_formatting(yield) + ", but it does not respond to `include?`"
        
      55. 
      
        
    55. 
          
          
                    end
        
      56. 
      
        
    56. 
          
          
                  end
        
      57. 
      
        
    57. 
          
          
          
        
      58. 
      
        
    58. 
          1
          
                  def readable_list_of(items)
        
      59. 
      
        
    59. 
          
          
                    described_items = surface_descriptions_in(items)
        
      60. 
      
        
    60. 
          
          
                    if described_items.all? { |item| item.is_a?(Hash) }
        
      61. 
      
        
    61. 
          
          
                      " #{described_items.inject(:merge).inspect}"
        
      62. 
      
        
    62. 
          
          
                    else
        
      63. 
      
        
    63. 
          
          
                      EnglishPhrasing.list(described_items)
        
      64. 
      
        
    64. 
          
          
                    end
        
      65. 
      
        
    65. 
          
          
                  end
        
      66. 
      
        
    66. 
          
          
          
        
      67. 
      
        
    67. 
          1
          
                  def perform_match(actual, &block)
        
      68. 
      
        
    68. 
          3
          
                    @actual = actual
        
      69. 
      
        
    69. 
          3
          
                    @divergent_items = excluded_from_actual(&block)
        
      70. 
      
        
    70. 
          3
          
                    actual.respond_to?(:include?) && @divergent_items.empty?
        
      71. 
      
        
    71. 
          
          
                  end
        
      72. 
      
        
    72. 
          
          
          
        
      73. 
      
        
    73. 
          1
          
                  def excluded_from_actual
        
      74. 
      
        
    74. 
          3
          
                    return [] unless @actual.respond_to?(:include?)
        
      75. 
      
        
    75. 
          
          
          
        
      76. 
      
        
    76. 
          3
          
                    expected.inject([]) do |memo, expected_item|
        
      77. 
      
        
    77. 
          3
          
                      if comparing_hash_to_a_subset?(expected_item)
        
      78. 
      
        
    78. 
          
          
                        expected_item.each do |(key, value)|
        
      79. 
      
        
    79. 
          
          
                          memo << { key => value } unless yield actual_hash_includes?(key, value)
        
      80. 
      
        
    80. 
          
          
                        end
        
      81. 
      
        
    81. 
          
          
                      elsif comparing_hash_keys?(expected_item)
        
      82. 
      
        
    82. 
          
          
                        memo << expected_item unless yield actual_hash_has_key?(expected_item)
        
      83. 
      
        
    83. 
          
          
                      else
        
      84. 
      
        
    84. 
          3
          
                        memo << expected_item unless yield actual_collection_includes?(expected_item)
        
      85. 
      
        
    85. 
          
          
                      end
        
      86. 
      
        
    86. 
          3
          
                      memo
        
      87. 
      
        
    87. 
          
          
                    end
        
      88. 
      
        
    88. 
          
          
                  end
        
      89. 
      
        
    89. 
          
          
          
        
      90. 
      
        
    90. 
          1
          
                  def comparing_hash_to_a_subset?(expected_item)
        
      91. 
      
        
    91. 
          3
          
                    actual.is_a?(Hash) && expected_item.is_a?(Hash)
        
      92. 
      
        
    92. 
          
          
                  end
        
      93. 
      
        
    93. 
          
          
          
        
      94. 
      
        
    94. 
          1
          
                  def actual_hash_includes?(expected_key, expected_value)
        
      95. 
      
        
    95. 
          
          
                    actual_value = actual.fetch(expected_key) { return false }
        
      96. 
      
        
    96. 
          
          
                    values_match?(expected_value, actual_value)
        
      97. 
      
        
    97. 
          
          
                  end
        
      98. 
      
        
    98. 
          
          
          
        
      99. 
      
        
    99. 
          1
          
                  def comparing_hash_keys?(expected_item)
        
      100. 
      
        
    100. 
          3
          
                    actual.is_a?(Hash) && !expected_item.is_a?(Hash)
        
      101. 
      
        
    101. 
          
          
                  end
        
      102. 
      
        
    102. 
          
          
          
        
      103. 
      
        
    103. 
          1
          
                  def actual_hash_has_key?(expected_key)
        
      104. 
      
        
    104. 
          
          
                    # We check `key?` first for perf:
        
      105. 
      
        
    105. 
          
          
                    # `key?` is O(1), but `any?` is O(N).
        
      106. 
      
        
    106. 
          
          
                    actual.key?(expected_key) ||
        
      107. 
      
        
    107. 
          
          
                    actual.keys.any? { |key| values_match?(expected_key, key) }
        
      108. 
      
        
    108. 
          
          
                  end
        
      109. 
      
        
    109. 
          
          
          
        
      110. 
      
        
    110. 
          1
          
                  def actual_collection_includes?(expected_item)
        
      111. 
      
        
    111. 
          3
          
                    return true if actual.include?(expected_item)
        
      112. 
      
        
    112. 
          
          
          
        
      113. 
      
        
    113. 
          
          
                    # String lacks an `any?` method...
        
      114. 
      
        
    114. 
          
          
                    return false unless actual.respond_to?(:any?)
        
      115. 
      
        
    115. 
          
          
          
        
      116. 
      
        
    116. 
          
          
                    actual.any? { |value| values_match?(expected_item, value) }
        
      117. 
      
        
    117. 
          
          
                  end
        
      118. 
      
        
    118. 
          
          
          
        
      119. 
      
        
    119. 
          1
          
                  def diff_would_wrongly_highlight_matched_item?
        
      120. 
      
        
    120. 
          
          
                    return false unless actual.is_a?(String) && expected.is_a?(Array)
        
      121. 
      
        
    121. 
          
          
          
        
      122. 
      
        
    122. 
          
          
                    lines = actual.split("\n")
        
      123. 
      
        
    123. 
          
          
                    expected.any? do |str|
        
      124. 
      
        
    124. 
          
          
                      actual.include?(str) && lines.none? { |line| line == str }
        
      125. 
      
        
    125. 
          
          
                    end
        
      126. 
      
        
    126. 
          
          
                  end
        
      127. 
      
        
    127. 
          
          
                end
        
      128. 
      
        
    128. 
          
          
              end
        
      129. 
      
        
    129. 
          
          
            end
        
      130. 
      
        
    130. 
          
          
          end
        
      131.

          RSpec::Support.require_rspec_support "fuzzy_matcher"

    2. 
          
          
          
        
      3. 
      
        
    3. 
          1
          
          module RSpec
        
      4. 
      
        
    4. 
          1
          
            module Matchers
        
      5. 
      
        
    5. 
          
          
              # Mixin designed to support the composable matcher features
        
      6. 
      
        
    6. 
          
          
              # of RSpec 3+. Mix it into your custom matcher classes to
        
      7. 
      
        
    7. 
          
          
              # allow them to be used in a composable fashion.
        
      8. 
      
        
    8. 
          
          
              #
        
      9. 
      
        
    9. 
          
          
              # @api public
        
      10. 
      
        
    10. 
          1
          
              module Composable
        
      11. 
      
        
    11. 
          
          
                # Creates a compound `and` expectation. The matcher will
        
      12. 
      
        
    12. 
          
          
                # only pass if both sub-matchers pass.
        
      13. 
      
        
    13. 
          
          
                # This can be chained together to form an arbitrarily long
        
      14. 
      
        
    14. 
          
          
                # chain of matchers.
        
      15. 
      
        
    15. 
          
          
                #
        
      16. 
      
        
    16. 
          
          
                # @example
        
      17. 
      
        
    17. 
          
          
                #   expect(alphabet).to start_with("a").and end_with("z")
        
      18. 
      
        
    18. 
          
          
                #   expect(alphabet).to start_with("a") & end_with("z")
        
      19. 
      
        
    19. 
          
          
                #
        
      20. 
      
        
    20. 
          
          
                # @note The negative form (`expect(...).not_to matcher.and other`)
        
      21. 
      
        
    21. 
          
          
                #   is not supported at this time.
        
      22. 
      
        
    22. 
          1
          
                def and(matcher)
        
      23. 
      
        
    23. 
          
          
                  BuiltIn::Compound::And.new self, matcher
        
      24. 
      
        
    24. 
          
          
                end
        
      25. 
      
        
    25. 
          1
          
                alias & and
        
      26. 
      
        
    26. 
          
          
          
        
      27. 
      
        
    27. 
          
          
                # Creates a compound `or` expectation. The matcher will
        
      28. 
      
        
    28. 
          
          
                # pass if either sub-matcher passes.
        
      29. 
      
        
    29. 
          
          
                # This can be chained together to form an arbitrarily long
        
      30. 
      
        
    30. 
          
          
                # chain of matchers.
        
      31. 
      
        
    31. 
          
          
                #
        
      32. 
      
        
    32. 
          
          
                # @example
        
      33. 
      
        
    33. 
          
          
                #   expect(stoplight.color).to eq("red").or eq("green").or eq("yellow")
        
      34. 
      
        
    34. 
          
          
                #   expect(stoplight.color).to eq("red") | eq("green") | eq("yellow")
        
      35. 
      
        
    35. 
          
          
                #
        
      36. 
      
        
    36. 
          
          
                # @note The negative form (`expect(...).not_to matcher.or other`)
        
      37. 
      
        
    37. 
          
          
                #   is not supported at this time.
        
      38. 
      
        
    38. 
          1
          
                def or(matcher)
        
      39. 
      
        
    39. 
          
          
                  BuiltIn::Compound::Or.new self, matcher
        
      40. 
      
        
    40. 
          
          
                end
        
      41. 
      
        
    41. 
          1
          
                alias | or
        
      42. 
      
        
    42. 
          
          
          
        
      43. 
      
        
    43. 
          
          
                # Delegates to `#matches?`. Allows matchers to be used in composable
        
      44. 
      
        
    44. 
          
          
                # fashion and also supports using matchers in case statements.
        
      45. 
      
        
    45. 
          1
          
                def ===(value)
        
      46. 
      
        
    46. 
          
          
                  matches?(value)
        
      47. 
      
        
    47. 
          
          
                end
        
      48. 
      
        
    48. 
          
          
          
        
      49. 
      
        
    49. 
          1
          
              private
        
      50. 
      
        
    50. 
          
          
          
        
      51. 
      
        
    51. 
          
          
                # This provides a generic way to fuzzy-match an expected value against
        
      52. 
      
        
    52. 
          
          
                # an actual value. It understands nested data structures (e.g. hashes
        
      53. 
      
        
    53. 
          
          
                # and arrays) and is able to match against a matcher being used as
        
      54. 
      
        
    54. 
          
          
                # the expected value or within the expected value at any level of
        
      55. 
      
        
    55. 
          
          
                # nesting.
        
      56. 
      
        
    56. 
          
          
                #
        
      57. 
      
        
    57. 
          
          
                # Within a custom matcher you are encouraged to use this whenever your
        
      58. 
      
        
    58. 
          
          
                # matcher needs to match two values, unless it needs more precise semantics.
        
      59. 
      
        
    59. 
          
          
                # For example, the `eq` matcher _does not_ use this as it is meant to
        
      60. 
      
        
    60. 
          
          
                # use `==` (and only `==`) for matching.
        
      61. 
      
        
    61. 
          
          
                #
        
      62. 
      
        
    62. 
          
          
                # @param expected [Object] what is expected
        
      63. 
      
        
    63. 
          
          
                # @param actual [Object] the actual value
        
      64. 
      
        
    64. 
          
          
                #
        
      65. 
      
        
    65. 
          
          
                # @!visibility public
        
      66. 
      
        
    66. 
          1
          
                def values_match?(expected, actual)
        
      67. 
      
        
    67. 
          6
          
                  expected = with_matchers_cloned(expected)
        
      68. 
      
        
    68. 
          6
          
                  Support::FuzzyMatcher.values_match?(expected, actual)
        
      69. 
      
        
    69. 
          
          
                end
        
      70. 
      
        
    70. 
          
          
          
        
      71. 
      
        
    71. 
          
          
                # Returns the description of the given object in a way that is
        
      72. 
      
        
    72. 
          
          
                # aware of composed matchers. If the object is a matcher with
        
      73. 
      
        
    73. 
          
          
                # a `description` method, returns the description; otherwise
        
      74. 
      
        
    74. 
          
          
                # returns `object.inspect`.
        
      75. 
      
        
    75. 
          
          
                #
        
      76. 
      
        
    76. 
          
          
                # You are encouraged to use this in your custom matcher's
        
      77. 
      
        
    77. 
          
          
                # `description`, `failure_message` or
        
      78. 
      
        
    78. 
          
          
                # `failure_message_when_negated` implementation if you are
        
      79. 
      
        
    79. 
          
          
                # supporting matcher arguments.
        
      80. 
      
        
    80. 
          
          
                #
        
      81. 
      
        
    81. 
          
          
                # @!visibility public
        
      82. 
      
        
    82. 
          1
          
                def description_of(object)
        
      83. 
      
        
    83. 
          
          
                  RSpec::Support::ObjectFormatter.format(object)
        
      84. 
      
        
    84. 
          
          
                end
        
      85. 
      
        
    85. 
          
          
          
        
      86. 
      
        
    86. 
          
          
                # Transforms the given data structue (typically a hash or array)
        
      87. 
      
        
    87. 
          
          
                # into a new data structure that, when `#inspect` is called on it,
        
      88. 
      
        
    88. 
          
          
                # will provide descriptions of any contained matchers rather than
        
      89. 
      
        
    89. 
          
          
                # the normal `#inspect` output.
        
      90. 
      
        
    90. 
          
          
                #
        
      91. 
      
        
    91. 
          
          
                # You are encouraged to use this in your custom matcher's
        
      92. 
      
        
    92. 
          
          
                # `description`, `failure_message` or
        
      93. 
      
        
    93. 
          
          
                # `failure_message_when_negated` implementation if you are
        
      94. 
      
        
    94. 
          
          
                # supporting any arguments which may be a data structure
        
      95. 
      
        
    95. 
          
          
                # containing matchers.
        
      96. 
      
        
    96. 
          
          
                #
        
      97. 
      
        
    97. 
          
          
                # @!visibility public
        
      98. 
      
        
    98. 
          1
          
                def surface_descriptions_in(item)
        
      99. 
      
        
    99. 
          
          
                  if Matchers.is_a_describable_matcher?(item)
        
      100. 
      
        
    100. 
          
          
                    DescribableItem.new(item)
        
      101. 
      
        
    101. 
          
          
                  elsif Hash === item
        
      102. 
      
        
    102. 
          
          
                    Hash[surface_descriptions_in(item.to_a)]
        
      103. 
      
        
    103. 
          
          
                  elsif Struct === item || unreadable_io?(item)
        
      104. 
      
        
    104. 
          
          
                    RSpec::Support::ObjectFormatter.format(item)
        
      105. 
      
        
    105. 
          
          
                  elsif should_enumerate?(item)
        
      106. 
      
        
    106. 
          
          
                    item.map { |subitem| surface_descriptions_in(subitem) }
        
      107. 
      
        
    107. 
          
          
                  else
        
      108. 
      
        
    108. 
          
          
                    item
        
      109. 
      
        
    109. 
          
          
                  end
        
      110. 
      
        
    110. 
          
          
                end
        
      111. 
      
        
    111. 
          
          
          
        
      112. 
      
        
    112. 
          
          
                # @private
        
      113. 
      
        
    113. 
          
          
                # Historically, a single matcher instance was only checked
        
      114. 
      
        
    114. 
          
          
                # against a single value. Given that the matcher was only
        
      115. 
      
        
    115. 
          
          
                # used once, it's been common to memoize some intermediate
        
      116. 
      
        
    116. 
          
          
                # calculation that is derived from the `actual` value in
        
      117. 
      
        
    117. 
          
          
                # order to reuse that intermediate result in the failure
        
      118. 
      
        
    118. 
          
          
                # message.
        
      119. 
      
        
    119. 
          
          
                #
        
      120. 
      
        
    120. 
          
          
                # This can cause a problem when using such a matcher as an
        
      121. 
      
        
    121. 
          
          
                # argument to another matcher in a composed matcher expression,
        
      122. 
      
        
    122. 
          
          
                # since the matcher instance may be checked against multiple
        
      123. 
      
        
    123. 
          
          
                # values and produce invalid results due to the memoization.
        
      124. 
      
        
    124. 
          
          
                #
        
      125. 
      
        
    125. 
          
          
                # To deal with this, we clone any matchers in `expected` via
        
      126. 
      
        
    126. 
          
          
                # this method when using `values_match?`, so that any memoization
        
      127. 
      
        
    127. 
          
          
                # does not "leak" between checks.
        
      128. 
      
        
    128. 
          1
          
                def with_matchers_cloned(object)
        
      129. 
      
        
    129. 
          6
          
                  if Matchers.is_a_matcher?(object)
        
      130. 
      
        
    130. 
          
          
                    object.clone
        
      131. 
      
        
    131. 
          6
          
                  elsif Hash === object
        
      132. 
      
        
    132. 
          
          
                    Hash[with_matchers_cloned(object.to_a)]
        
      133. 
      
        
    133. 
          6
          
                  elsif Struct === object || unreadable_io?(object)
        
      134. 
      
        
    134. 
          
          
                    object
        
      135. 
      
        
    135. 
          6
          
                  elsif should_enumerate?(object)
        
      136. 
      
        
    136. 
          
          
                    object.map { |subobject| with_matchers_cloned(subobject) }
        
      137. 
      
        
    137. 
          
          
                  else
        
      138. 
      
        
    138. 
          6
          
                    object
        
      139. 
      
        
    139. 
          
          
                  end
        
      140. 
      
        
    140. 
          
          
                end
        
      141. 
      
        
    141. 
          
          
          
        
      142. 
      
        
    142. 
          1
          
                if String.ancestors.include?(Enumerable) # 1.8.7
        
      143. 
      
        
    143. 
          
          
                  # :nocov:
        
      144. 
      
        
    144. 
          
          skipped
                  # Strings are not enumerable on 1.9, and on 1.8 they are an infinitely
        
      145. 
      
        
    145. 
          
          skipped
                  # nested enumerable: since ruby lacks a character class, it yields
        
      146. 
      
        
    146. 
          
          skipped
                  # 1-character strings, which are themselves enumerable, composed of a
        
      147. 
      
        
    147. 
          
          skipped
                  # a single 1-character string, which is an enumerable, etc.
        
      148. 
      
        
    148. 
          
          skipped
                  #
        
      149.

          skipped

                  def should_enumerate?(item)
        
      151. 
      
        
    151. 
          
          skipped
                    return false if String === item
        
      152. 
      
        
    152. 
          
          skipped
                    Enumerable === item && !(Range === item) && item.none? { |subitem| subitem.equal?(item) }
        
      153. 
      
        
    153. 
          
          skipped

      154. 
      
        
    154.

      155.

                  def should_enumerate?(item)
        
      158. 
      
        
    158. 
          6
          
                    Enumerable === item && !(Range === item) && item.none? { |subitem| subitem.equal?(item) }
        
      159. 
      
        
    159.

      160. 
      
        
    160. 
          
          
                end
        
      161.

      163.

          1
          
                def unreadable_io?(object)
        
      164. 
      
        
    164. 
          6
          
                  return false unless IO === object
        
      165. 
      
        
    165. 
          
          
                  object.each {} # STDOUT is enumerable but raises an error
        
      166. 
      
        
    166. 
          
          
                  false
        
      167. 
      
        
    167. 
          
          
                rescue IOError
        
      168. 
      
        
    168. 
          
          
                  true
        
      169. 
      
        
    169.

                def define(name, &declarations)
        
      8. 
      
        
    8. 
          
          
                  warn_about_block_args(name, declarations)
        
      9. 
      
        
    9. 
          
          
                  define_method name do |*expected, &block_arg|
        
      10. 
      
        
    10. 
          
          
                    RSpec::Matchers::DSL::Matcher.new(name, declarations, self, *expected, &block_arg)

                  def warn_about_block_args(name, declarations)
        
      19. 
      
        
    19. 
          
          
                    declarations.parameters.each do |type, arg_name|
        
      20. 
      
        
    20. 
          
          
                      next unless type == :block
        
      21. 
      
        
    21.

      22.

      23.

                # Contains the methods that are available from within the
        
      37. 
      
        
    37. 
          
          
                # `RSpec::Matchers.define` DSL for creating custom matchers.
        
      38. 
      
        
    38. 
          1
          
                module Macros
        
      39. 
      
        
    39. 
          
          
                  # Stores the block that is used to determine whether this matcher passes
        
      40. 
      
        
    40. 
          
          
                  # or fails. The block should return a boolean value. When the matcher is
        
      41. 
      
        
    41. 
          
          
                  # passed to `expect(...).to` and the block returns `true`, then the expectation
        
      42. 
      
        
    42. 
          
          
                  # passes. Similarly, when the matcher is passed to `expect(...).not_to` and the
        
      43. 
      
        
    43. 
          
          
                  # block returns `false`, then the expectation passes.
        
      44. 
      
        
    44. 
          
          
                  #
        
      45. 
      
        
    45. 
          
          
                  # @example
        
      46. 
      
        
    46. 
          
          
                  #
        
      47. 
      
        
    47. 
          
          
                  #     RSpec::Matchers.define :be_even do
        
      48. 
      
        
    48. 
          
          
                  #       match do |actual|
        
      49. 
      
        
    49. 
          
          
                  #         actual.even?
        
      50. 
      
        
    50. 
          
          
                  #       end
        
      51. 
      
        
    51. 
          
          
                  #     end
        
      52. 
      
        
    52. 
          
          
                  #
        
      53. 
      
        
    53. 
          
          
                  #     expect(4).to be_even     # passes
        
      54. 
      
        
    54. 
          
          
                  #     expect(3).not_to be_even # passes
        
      55. 
      
        
    55. 
          
          
                  #     expect(3).to be_even     # fails
        
      56. 
      
        
    56. 
          
          
                  #     expect(4).not_to be_even # fails
        
      57. 
      
        
    57. 
          
          
                  #
        
      58. 
      
        
    58. 
          
          
                  # @yield [Object] actual the actual value (i.e. the value wrapped by `expect`)
        
      59. 
      
        
    59. 
          1
          
                  def match(&match_block)
        
      60. 
      
        
    60. 
          
          
                    define_user_override(:matches?, match_block) do |actual|
        
      61. 
      
        
    61. 
          
          
                      begin
        
      62. 
      
        
    62. 
          
          
                        @actual = actual
        
      63. 
      
        
    63. 
          
          
                        RSpec::Support.with_failure_notifier(RAISE_NOTIFIER) do
        
      64. 
      
        
    64. 
          
          
                          super(*actual_arg_for(match_block))
        
      65. 
      
        
    65. 
          
          
                        end
        
      66. 
      
        
    66. 
          
          
                      rescue RSpec::Expectations::ExpectationNotMetError
        
      67. 
      
        
    67. 
          
          
                        false
        
      68. 
      
        
    68. 
          
          
                      end
        
      69. 
      
        
    69. 
          
          
                    end
        
      70. 
      
        
    70. 
          
          
                  end
        
      71. 
      
        
    71. 
          
          
          
        
      72. 
      
        
    72. 
          
          
                  # @private
        
      73. 
      
        
    73. 
          1
          
                  RAISE_NOTIFIER = Proc.new { |err, _opts| raise err }
        
      74. 
      
        
    74. 
          
          
          
        
      75. 
      
        
    75. 
          
          
                  # Use this to define the block for a negative expectation (`expect(...).not_to`)
        
      76. 
      
        
    76. 
          
          
                  # when the positive and negative forms require different handling. This
        
      77. 
      
        
    77. 
          
          
                  # is rarely necessary, but can be helpful, for example, when specifying
        
      78. 
      
        
    78. 
          
          
                  # asynchronous processes that require different timeouts.
        
      79. 
      
        
    79. 
          
          
                  #
        
      80. 
      
        
    80. 
          
          
                  # @yield [Object] actual the actual value (i.e. the value wrapped by `expect`)
        
      81. 
      
        
    81. 
          1
          
                  def match_when_negated(&match_block)
        
      82. 
      
        
    82. 
          
          
                    define_user_override(:does_not_match?, match_block) do |actual|
        
      83. 
      
        
    83. 
          
          
                      @actual = actual
        
      84. 
      
        
    84. 
          
          
                      super(*actual_arg_for(match_block))
        
      85. 
      
        
    85. 
          
          
                    end
        
      86. 
      
        
    86. 
          
          
                  end
        
      87. 
      
        
    87. 
          
          
          
        
      88. 
      
        
    88. 
          
          
                  # Use this instead of `match` when the block will raise an exception
        
      89. 
      
        
    89. 
          
          
                  # rather than returning false to indicate a failure.
        
      90. 
      
        
    90. 
          
          
                  #
        
      91.

      92.

          1
          
                  def match_unless_raises(expected_exception=Exception, &match_block)
        
      103. 
      
        
    103. 
          
          
                    define_user_override(:matches?, match_block) do |actual|
        
      104. 
      
        
    104. 
          
          
                      @actual = actual
        
      105. 
      
        
    105. 
          
          
                      begin
        
      106. 
      
        
    106. 
          
          
                        super(*actual_arg_for(match_block))
        
      107. 
      
        
    107. 
          
          
                      rescue expected_exception => @rescued_exception
        
      108. 
      
        
    108. 
          
          
                        false
        
      109. 
      
        
    109. 
          
          
                      else
        
      110. 
      
        
    110. 
          
          
                        true
        
      111. 
      
        
    111. 
          
          
                      end

      113. 
      
        
    113. 
          
          
                  end
        
      114. 
      
        
    114. 
          
          
          
        
      115. 
      
        
    115. 
          
          
                  # Customizes the failure messsage to use when this matcher is
        
      116. 
      
        
    116. 
          
          
                  # asked to positively match. Only use this when the message
        
      117. 
      
        
    117. 
          
          
                  # generated by default doesn't suit your needs.
        
      118.

                  #

      153. 
      
        
    153. 
          
          
                  # Customize the description to use for one-liners.  Only use this when
        
      154.

      155.
